product_title: Samyang SY35MAE-N 35mm F/1.4 Lens for Nikon AE
product_description: Aperture range F 1 4 22 Optical Construction 12 elements in 10 groups Filter Size 77mm Minimum Focusing Distance 1 foot 0 3 meters Includes removable lens hood lens caps lens pouch instruction manual and 1 year Rokinon warrant

reviews.review_body:
I bought this Samyang lens for Nikon under the Vivitar brand. Also available as Rokinon, Bower, and others -- buy the one going for the lowest price.

At F1.4 the lens is sharp in the center, but soft at the corners and edges. Noticeable vignetting that is correctable in post processing. CA is negligible. By F2.8 the lens is sharp corner to corner and vignetting not visible on my D810. Focusing is spot-on without camera fine tuning. Focus ring has long rotation (nearly half a turn) and is well damped so focusing is a joy. There is a small amount of barrel distortion that can be seen if you shoot fences or buildings, but it should be easy to correct. Like other Samyang lenses, there is no lock for the aperture ring. If want to control aperture by the ring, it is difficult to reach and hard to turn, I guess that makes it better if you want it to stay at F22!

Compared with my other Samyang manufactured lenses, this Vivitar branded lens came with a padded nylon bag rather than cloth, and a lens cleaning cloth, as well as a nicer instruction manual that was Nikon specific. I don't know if these improvements apply to any other rebranding or the Samyang original.
very sharp lens even wide open.
Sick lens, sick price.
great lens.. looks incredible! will buy 2 more of each
Favorite lens I've ever used... including my three L-series lenses
Sharp fast lens. I'd buy another.
Excellent lens, no autofocus, no VR very sharp
I love this lens, it has proven to be tough and versatile for both video and photo
Best lens ever for a true photographer/ filmaker. It is my favorite of my collection. Damn auto focus!
Sharp all the way through!
I used this len at a wedding and the sharpness of the video was awesome.
Love my 50mm lens but I want to get in closer to someone or something and still have that sharpness, this lens does just that for me.
: I am not a pro but I do weddings and portraits I do have to say the colour is absolutely marvellous. Unless you don't practice with it you would not get stunning results .
The delivery was perfect, the product is in top shape but que lense's hood isn't the original and the one I received is loose. But works fine !

I've used this lens for some really important shoots and I'm very happy with the results.  Samyang offers some great value for their product and this is by far the best Samyang Lens I've bought.  Although it's been released for a while, I've used it with my Nikon D750 for photography and video.

Optically the lens is great, and the build quality is outstanding. The only thing wrong is that the hood falls off during normal use. With just a 35mm focal length, the lens hood is a must and I need to tape it into place, or it will fall off.
Sharp, decently built, but very hard to focus consistently. I'll admit it - I have to have electronic focus!

In my back pack i've got just fixed focals  but this one so far is awesome the contrast, sharpness, bokeh  is incredible too mucho colorfull than the 50 mm 1,4 perhaps the 85mm 1,8 gets closer. the 14 mm 2.8 also from the same brand under the opteka name makes a great job but this one become my favorite
The lens I received was very soft, so I returned it for a refund, which took almost a month to get after emailing the the company almost every day for a month. Wouldn't recommend.

Thought that this lens would provide that extra measure of tack sharpness expected from a prime lens over a zoom. Some of the reviews rave about the sharpness and thought I was making a good choice. Don't mind a manual focus lens and occasionally use an old 50mm super takumar, which is manual focus and aperture. Can't say this lens is bad, but its sharpness is inferior to my old super takumar and I would say no better than the 18-200 zoom I'm using at 35mm. I gain a couple of f stops but I was buying the lens more for supposed sharpness.

What can I say....  this is one of the sharpest, best low light lenses I've had the pleasure of owning.  My entire lens bag includes nothing but Canon lenses, I love the cinematic look they give.  That being said, this lens works better in low light than any of the Canon's by far.  The build quality is insane, and the focussing ring is ultra wide and smooth.  I use this with my 5D Mark II & III.

This lens is sharp with great contrast. If you can manage manual focus, then this is a superb lens at an affordable price. This and the 135 mm are my go to lenses. Build quality is sturdy. This is also a very fast lens that provides wonderful bokeh.

I really love this lens. I'd give it 5 stars. Got it on sale with the 85mm version too. It takes great photos, great color, great sharpness, distortion is minimal, it's everything you would want. Built well, works great. The gotcha- I love this one, I really dislike the 85mm. So, I don't know if that is the model differences- or possibly just poor quality control across the line. So deducting a star for that. I dislike like 85 so much, I don't even feel I should re-sell it. But my 35mm copy is fantastic.

All I have to say is, if this lens is used correctly, stunning results can be achieved. If you don't need autofocus, this lens is definitely a great performer. Don't shy away from using manual focusing, it gets easier as you practice more; I find it quite enjoyable actually. It is very sharp from f/4 - f/10, and not too bad for apertures larger than f/4. Build quality is extremely solid and the focus ring is well dampened. Just look at the weight of this thing and you will know what I'm talking about. It feels good in the hand with high quality plastic casing; it does NOT feel cheap, but rather suggest a higher price tag. To wrap things up, this is a great everyday lens when used properly. Understand the limitations of this lens and work around it, you can achieve great photos.

product_title: MegaGear Ultra Light Neoprene Camera Case Bag with Carabiner for Canon PowerShot G7 X Canon PowerShot G7 X Mark II Nikon COOLPIX AW130 S9900 Olympus STYLUS XZ 2 Digital Camera Black
product_description: Ultra Light and compact case made for easy carrying Protective and high quality Neoprene material and foam padding for protection Protects camera from dust dirt scratches bumps and moisture Handmade stitches design for a unique look Available in different colors Fine quality of moisture resistant Neoprene used Durable flap holder to keep camera encased protectively Holder clip for carrying easily Carabineer for carrying easily

reviews.review_body: Nice quality
Works as expected.
Says it works with g7x 2 camera hardly fits.
Though a bit snug, this case offers very good protection.
Perfect for the Nikon 9900.
The Belt Loop ripped off the first day I had it.
An excellent case but could use an outside pocket.
Despite the advertised claim, it's too small and does not fit the Nikon Coolpix S9900. However, it was a fast and easy prepaid return and refund.
Bought this for my new Canon Powershot G7X Mark II camera. It's a very tight fit, and quite cumbersome to get the camera in and out of the case.
Really liked this small bag. fits well. protects my camera very well too. Thank you

The camera case did not fit the camera as stated!
Because of the tight fit, the threading holding the seams of the case together fell apart after one week of use!
Really tight fit. Probably won't use it.
Fast shipping and as described.  Very nice "small" case and fit my Canon Powershot G7 perfectly!
I hate it because I have not received my  refund, as promised  almost a week ago,  A very, very small amount, but a principle is involved and  have no other recourse but this.
I LOST IT AND IT'S HARD TO BRING YOUR CAMERA OUT
Great Item

Stay away from Metgear products at all costs.  These cases make it sound like they will work on so many cameras but the trust is that it hasn’t been tested and probably won’t work on your camera.  Much better products out there in the market.
Fits my canon G7x like a glove.
It's practice but offer poor protection.

The actual dimensions are one 1.5 x 4 x 2.5. Not  even close to wat the description says and not nearly big enough to fit the G7X Mark 2. Clearly they never tried to put the camera in the case before they listed it in the title. Very irritating.
Perfect "snug" fit for the Canon G7x Mark II, padded for some protection and a belt loop for a mounting option...can't complain!
Not a good fit for my Canon G7 Mk II. Very tight and awkward to get the camera into and out of the case. I will be returning it.
Fits my Canon G7X with a spare battery perfectly. If you want small, cushioned and well fitting this is the one.

It fits mi Canon G7X like a glove, providing good protection
It also has a clip I can attach to my belt for extra comfort

I bought it for my Canon G7 Mark II since it's written in the description that this case fits the camera. Well, it doesn't.
The case is too tight and has a fold that makes it very difficult to pull the camera out. I will have to buy another case.

Good tight fit.  In fact it's TOO good.  If it's on your belt, it takes two hands, torquing your body awkwardly, to cram it in the case.  Once in, it's like it's been swallowed up.  When you see that must have shot and you need to get the camera quickly, good luck.  It takes another two hands to get it out.  I'm sending it back and I never send stuff back, but this is horrible.  Avoid.
The right size with a good quality. It has a decent look and feel and gets the job done
Lost my camera case on a recent trip. This case fit nicely and will protect my camera, which is what I wanted. Nice case for the price.
Exactly what I was looking for, just enough protection, easy clip that I can attach to my belt loops (since I don't wear belts). Plus it is soft enough to stuff in my pocket while using the camera.

Bought this for a Canon G7X as that camera was listed in the description. If you think you're going to wear this thing on your belt and pull your camera out for a quick pic when needed, then you  have another thing coming. It fits very tight on this camera and is difficult to insert and remove it from this case. Bu!
good case but just a bit tight for the s9900 still fit though.
Good case overall. Fits well. Good protection for camera though some of stitching is easily exposed. Initial quality is a little suspect but I believe it'll last.
fits g7x mk2 tightly.  I cut it open so it slides in better.
Great case.  I would be able to add a star if it had a pocket for an extra battery.

I love this case. I have a new point and shoot camera. I got this case so I can carry the camera in my purse or in my camera bag with other things. Helps to keep it from getting scratched. Worth the money. Only paid 11.00 for it.
perfect size for canon mark9
But too small for my canon G5 X MII,

It keeps my camera safe(powershot g7 mark ii) but it doesn’t hold my camera as expected. I was looking for a quick draw case, so I could grab my camera fast. The way it holds the camera I kind of have to peel it off my camera and put more effort than I wanted to taking it out. But it keeps it safe and that’s all that matters.

Fits my Canon G7X mkII like a glove !
Probably wouldn't provide adequate protection for a 3 ft. fall on concrete, but if it was any thicker, the camera, case package would be to large to be considered "pocketable".
I have used similar neoprene cases for my last two pocket cameras, and they survived for many years and many 1000's of images.
(FYI, the Canon G7X mkII is pocketable in this case in a cargo pocket. It's a little chunkier than pocket cameras with less glass. it weighs more too.)

Excellent cushion and not bulky. Camera feels safe, which was my #1 goal. Fits my camera perfectly as advertised. There's a little lip to help secure the camera so it doesn't easily fall out, but personally I dislike this feature.  I want to be able to quickly pull out the camera to take a quick photo rather than have to fight with it to get the camera out of the case (which happened to me many many times during a recent vacation).  Also, I didn't feel comfortable using the included plastic clip to secure my expensive camera. I broke it off and replaced it with a carabiner.

I really like this case. I agree with other reviewers who express concern about its ability to protect camera from a 3 foot drop. But if you want a case that will allow you to shove the G7x inside a bag or pock worry-free, it is perfect. All other cases were too bulky. It's also very compressible and so it's easy to quickly stow, leaving your hands free to shoot. I also like that I can keep the camera strap around my wrist while still having the case on the camera. That way you have the camera at the ready rather than trying to fish it out of a bag or disentangle it from a pocket. Can't comment on strength of belt loop as I don't carry it that way. My only real complaint is that it is VERY easy to deploy the lens accidentally while trying to squeeze the camera in. Unintentionally pushing  the side-mounted wifi button powers the camera "on" with the lens closed.  But once powered-up any shutter pressure (inevitable with this snug fitting case) will cause the lens to deploy.  Careful attention to where you press the camera will help, but I still have this problem. I'm thinking of trying the horizontal orientation instead.

The case fit well and seemed good... I would have given it 4 stars. BUT... After only using it a small number of times on my belt (I would guess 5-6) I heard a clunk and was surprised to find my camera on the ground. My canon g7x sustained a small scratch as the case didn't protect it. The case's belt loop had torn free of the case, rendering it useless.

I bought this for my Olympus Tough TG-4. This camera only has one connection area for a strap on one side of the camera. I attached both sides of my camera strap to that one connection.  With the strap around my neck, the camera hangs vertically. This case fits the camera perfectly with my camera strap. When the camera is in use, I like the extra strap with a clip to attach to my camera strap so I won't lose the case while taking photos.
Really hard to get the camera in this case.  It's like spandex when you shouln't be wearing spandex!

Perfect. Exactly what I was looking for.  I purchased to protect my camera while sightseeing in Spain for a month. It Was great. Protected my camera while remaining sleek enough to keep in my purse while traveling around. Recommend.

Ordered this case my Canon G7XMKII. Arrived quickly and fit the camera great! It was slightly snug but once I get used to using it, it was a snap to pull my camera out of it with ease. I loved having the ability to attach it to my belt. It’s more or less why I ordered it. I carry my camera on me a lot...like a lot a lot.

I used it for approximately one week which included some light hiking and a flight across the United States. Still completely pleased with it. However, once I arrived in one of my destinations I took the camera and case off my belt one evening and found that the stitching that held the belt loop nylon on was beginning to tear. :( I didn’t feel confident in it after (didn’t want my camera to come flying off my belt once the stitching completely failed) seeing that and was forced to spend more money on a generic commercial case somewhere which was big, bulky and in my opinion not as cool as this one.

Summary:
It was relatively cheap and a good deal at first. Being small, compact and flexible it was the perfect case for what I needed it for. I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this case and use it A LOT but unfortunately the stitching just kind of looked like a weak point in the product. Not really an issue of quality but more of design. If they somehow remedied this issue I would most definetly get another one which I would attach to my belt indefinetly.
4 out of 5 stars because I just liked it so much. FIX IT PLEASEEEE :)
I traveled through Italy and Barcelona... very good size for my camera

I got this for my Canon G7x Mk2.  When it first arrived I was convinced that the camera would never fit inside it!  But its really stretchy and the camera along with a lens cap fits in perfectly, but tightly.  The belt loop and very secure and properly stitched and that combined with the tight fit means that you will not be able to get to the camera fast if its on your belt, so plan ahead.  Nonetheless, its a great sleek case, albeit with less protection.  And it squeezes down into a tiny size for storage.  The only thing I dont really like is the plastic clip, may have to break it off.

I also got the large amazon basics case for more protection, ie when tossing the camera into a backpack etc.

I recently purchased a new Canon PowerShot G7 X to replace an older Canon for use when traveling. On a trip, I take a lot of pictures – both of scenery and of food – and I want a camera (and camera case) to be to small enough to wear comfortably (and unobtrusively) around my neck all the time. I was pleased with the size of the G7 X, but found it somewhat difficult to choose a case that I liked for the camera. After spending many hours reading reviews, I decided to order 6 different camera cases to see which suited me best. Note that ALL the cases I ordered claimed to be compatible with the G7 X. Surprisingly, the MegaGear “Ultra Lite” Neoprene camera case was the only one of the six cases to suit my needs – all the other ones were either way too large/bulky OR too small for the camera (I felt like the lens was in danger of being crushed when these cases were closed).
PROS for the MegaGear “Ultra Lite” Neoprene case: 1. the G7 X fit perfectly – secure, but not constrictively snug; 2. the case itself was actually smaller than any of the other cases that I ordered – all the other cases were larger (L x W), but some had a shallower or less forgiving depth; 3. the case was easy to open quickly to allow for fast shots of unexpected photo opportunities; 4. the supplied carabiner secured the case easily to my own neck lanyard (I like a longer lanyard length; 5. the case is lightweight and is a stylish and unobtrusive basic black (but, for those more daring than I, it also comes in hot pink, blue, gray and red).
CONS for the MegaGear “Ultra Lite” Neoprene camera case: none really, once you get used to the Velcro closure. I had originally looked for a case with a top zipper opening, but found the MegaGear’s top flap Vecro closure worked well and was really no more “noisy” than a zipper.
* I am pleased with my purchase and would recommend this case to other Canon PowerShot G7 X owners.

product_title: Fotodiox Lens Mount Adapter Leica M to Micro 4 3 Olympus PEN and Panasonic Lumix Cameras
product_description: Mounts Leica M Rangefinder Lenses to Micro Four Thirds MFT mount mirrorless cameras High tolerance precision craftsmanship infinity focus or beyond allowed All metal design hardened anodized aluminum construction Premium grade Fotodiox adapter 24 Month Fotodiox Warranty

reviews.review_body:
I don't have any other M to m4/3 adapters to compare this to. There may be sample to sample variations, but mine mounts easily on my GF1 and my M mount lenses mount easily and securely into the adaptor. I think the only reason I didn't give it full 5 starts was the metal that mounts into the GF1 is (I'm guessing here) aluminum, and brass would be better; and the button that acts as the lens release isn't the same stepped design as the CV adapters, which look (and may function) a bit nicer.

I will also have to add the blurb about how much fun I'm having using Leitz (and Voigtlander) glass on the GF1, and how totally spectacular the results are!

This adapter does the job with a minimum of hassle. Rather than trying to mount and dismount Leica lenses from the adapter, it seems more sensible to just buy one of these inexpensive Leica to M43 adapters for each lens. Then, you'll not have any mount/dismount difficulty,

As to infinity focus and looseness, it's easy to get a small screwdriver and some blue Lock-tite, seat the adapter correctly for infinity focus, and then use the Lock-tite to ensure that the small set screws don't come loose. As I mentioned, at these low prices, you can buy an adapter for each lens and easily ensure that it remains tightly at infinity focus.

I would rate this product at 3.5 stars so it was hard for me to decide 3 or 4.  However, I decided on 3 because even at half the price (which is where I think it should be priced), I would give it 4 stars.  So 3 it is.

Let me start by saying that it works.  Also, the quality is not as bad as I thought after reading some other reviews.  Until I received it, I was thinking I would not even attach it to the camera.  However, it was better than I expected so I pressed ahead.

It is an all metal part so that is a start.  However, the part that attaches to the camera is not stainless steel like the Voigtlander and
Reasonably priced and works well.
Really liked this adapter. Never tried the more expensive models, but it seems that this one does the job pretty good.
Again love my Leicas, wonderful lenses, now still working on my digital camera.
Works perfectly well with all my Bayonet Mount Leica Lenses to my GH2-AF102 Panasonic as well as Blackmagic Pocket Camera
Accurately described item was safely and promptly shipped.
I returned it for the Rayqual version. I recommend the Panasonic, Voigtlander, or Rayqual adapter!
VERY LOOSE FIT ON CAMERS
I am not sure if I got a bad adapter or not, I got this for my Blackmagic pocket camera, and it rattles badly. If I didn't have an off camera mic, this thing would be completely useless.
Works as expected. Allows infinity focus. Check your camera before buying as one of mine does not auto expose using stop metering. It works fine on my Panasonic GX1.
Although the quality isn't up to the original Leica or Olympus the adaptor works great with my old M-seres lenses.

I was very happily surprised by the quality of this adapter.  It is well machined, fits perfectly to my various Leica M lenses and allows me to critically focus my Noctilux on my Oly EPL-1.  Get this adapter. It is great quality for a great price.
works. Had issue once removing lens due to loose pin.
Purchased this for my Leica 50mm Summicron f 2.0.  It's easy to mount and un-mount.  The only negative thing with it is the fit.  It does not fit tightly.

The adapter works, the quality is well below my expectation, with the Leica lenses it works fine, doesn't work with my Konica Hexanon 28mm (too tight, i'm afraid i would damage the lens).
Focusing is easy as on my M8.
Its cheap and working, but it feel a bit flimsy in my ZM lens, but is good enough for me.

If you have Leica M lenses and an M43 camera, this adapter is one of the best values for the money. It is fairly-well finished, fits well and works well. No need to spend much more for a fancier name than Fotodiox!
A little play on the lens side, but I can't tell that it hurts anything.

Not heeding the warnings I read in other reviews and jaded by the low price - I purchased one of these adapters.  Unfortunately there is a .5mm gap present on the M mount side of my adapter which allows the lens to jostle back and forth visibly within the adapter.  I'll be returning this one and looking for a higher-quality adapter.  The price was to good to be true.

I purchased this item to use my Leica M lenses on a Blackmagic Pocket Cinema Camera. The adapter fits the BMPCC fine but the fit of the Leica lenses is totally unacceptable. The Leica lens is so loose fitting that it moves around so much that you can see the image shift on the screen just from touching the lens. I contacted Fotodiox and they did respond but their support was less than satisfactory. They responded that it is normal to have some play to the fit of the lens. No Fn way! I'm sorry. I will never purchase anything from this vendor again.

The adapter worked fine till I tried to remove it from the camera and then the tiny release button broke off and I had to release it with a pair of sharp pointed scissors.
The product is OK if you want to leave it fixed permanently but useless if you need to change it often.
I read other reports on the net of people with the same problem.

I've had adapters from this brand before, but I am very disappointed by this Leica M version.  I got this specifically for my new 50 f/1.4 and there is a small(probably 1mm) gap where it's loose.  Although, it doesn't effect the performance I am kind of afraid it might wear on the Leica brass from constant movement.  If I can find a better replacement I might return this item.

Fotodiox Lens Mount Adapter, Leica M to Micro 4/3 Olympus PEN and Panasonic Lumix

This is great, after reading other positive reviews I was glad I ordered this product.

Also purchased: BestDealUSA Lens Mount Leica M lens to Micro 4/3 m4/3 Adapter which works but is not as nicely machined.

I've been trying to decide on what a fair price would be for a quality adapter... something I could feel comfortable using with a Leica lens, unfortunately, at $80 this adapter is disappointing. First it's not exactly what I see in the picture. I must have received an earlier version because the locking button is different; the red paint that was on it I immediately scratched off because I was afraid it would rub off on it's own and end up inside the camera or the lens. Probably why they changed it to what's in the picture. Good luck getting a newer one. Second, there's no marker to line up the lens with when attaching it. I had to look at the tabs on the lens' mount and the recessions in the adapter to line things up. Lame. Third, the lens fits a little too snug. The way they manufactured it to create grip on the lens is cheap and looks like it could damage a lens if one isn't careful or if the adapter wasn't tested properly. Bottom line, this adapter seems to be of the same build quality as the cheaper adapters on ebay. It looks like I'll be paying $250 for the Panasonic DMW-MA2M adapter. It appears to have the same mount at my M7. My bad for trying out a less expensive solution.

The build quality is "OK" for the price.  The adapter to camera mount is fine.  The M lens to adapter interface is a little stiff, may loosen up with use but so what.  It works and lets me use my M mount lenses on my Olympus e-pl1.  What a joy!  Aperture priority gives you auto exposure.  Full manual control with fill flash exposure compensation is also easy.  I use the 40mm F2 (80mm equivalent in 35mm format)for portraits, indoor low light photograpy.  This lens with iso 3200 on the e-pl1 for theater/church avialable light photograpy is fantastic.  Used my 90mm F4 (180mm 35mm equivalent) with a monopod for a track meet and photographing a bicycle pace line (hand held).  The in body IS stablizes these lenses! Imagine shooting a 180mm hand held on a moving target at 1/250th!  Focusing on the screen works fine.  For precision focusing, one touch on the zoom button brings up the focus magnification screen (7x to 14x, your choise)another push toggles back to compositin view.  In bright light an external viewfinder is avialable.

Update 1/28/2011:

Have been using this adapeter for eight months now.  The "M" side did loosen up and now is almost as smooth as the u 4/3 side.  The plating on the release button is wearing off and shows some brass but so what, we take it on and off a lot and switch between two M lenses regularly.  At this price buy one for each of your M lenses and get proper rear u 4/3 caps for each adapter.  The supplied ones fall off easily.

I've bought lots of Fotodiox mount adapters and never had any issues.  So I was a little concerned when I read some bad reviews.
But, this one is just like all the others I bought - fits great, no play, no looseness, excellent stuff.  Price is right too!  Highly recommended.

I was a little hesitant at first buy because of the reviews stating that it wasnt a firm fit but for tue pricepoint decided to take the risk and I am very happy I did.

Very solid construction and the lens snaps into place perfectly. I refently bought a 75mm voigtlander With M mount and wanted to use it for my gh5 to continue my lens kit. It snaps into place and it has a firm hold. Focus to infinity is achhieved.

Will buy more if I keep buying these M mount lenses.

UPDATE(04/25/2019):

After a couple of months of use. Sadly the fit loosened up to a point where it did not make sense to use it. Since I used the lens for shooting video, it made it impossible to use it with my follow focus.

The Lumix side is solid and virtually no play when inserted and locked in position.

The Leica M side has a large play; the lens have a wobble when attached.
Looking from the top, I can see about 0.5mm gap as I make the lens wobble.
There is that much of play on the Leica M mount side.

I tried it on my Leica 35mm, 50mm, and 135mm lens, and ALL three lens had that gap
between the Leica M lens and this adapter.  Maybe I had a bad adapter; so, the best you
can say is that they have poor quality control.

Time to try higher cost adapter.

I bought this adapter for a CV Nokton 40mm f1.4 on a GF1.
Compared to the original Voigtlaender adapter (I rented it together with a Nokton 50mm 1.1 from LensRentals.com) it is a little harder to fit on both the camera and the lens.
The metal is different (cheaper?), and the look of the release button is horrible.
But it works perfectly fine.

If I had multiple m-mount lenses I would buy one for each lens, I would be worried if I had to screw and unscrew the adapter all the time.
Can't pretend more from a 40 bucks piece of metal.

Both the 40 and the 50mm Noktons over-focus at infinite, but the same happened with the original Voigtlaender adapter.
From what I read it is a feature, not a defect, to allow a small tolerance for individual lens or adapter or camera differences.

I got this to mount my Leica Summicron 50 on an Olympus Pen F. Unlike the other experiences here, the lens fit tightly to the adaptor, and the adaptor tightly to the  Olympus.

I managed to break the pin that unmount the lens, and emailed tech support for help. They emailed me the next day with pictures of how to proceed,  two links, and an offer to have it sent to the factory. Their suggestions worked first time I tried them, so I am one very happy customer.

Good precise mount, great support.

In spite of the misgivings expressed by other reviewers, the Leica M mount to MFT lens adapter I purchased worked for me as well as the other Fotodiox Pentax-K mount adapter I have.  The Leica M adapter is much thinner than SLR adapters because back of M mount lenses is closer to the focal plane, and hence it requires a bit more dexterity to install.  Otherwise, the operation is no different than that of SLR mounts and allows me to enjoy my Summilux lens on my Panasonic DMC-GF2 camera.

There is a deluxe version possibly more refined and easier to operate.  For my intended purposes the product as is works just fine.  For the asking prices of some of the more expensive offerings, I'd consider purchasing a native lens instead.

I bought the adaptor for my E-P2 with little expectation worried that it might be made plastic being the cheapest of adapters. What can I say, it metal and it work well with my 50mm summicron. It is what it is, a simple device. Its cheap enough that I may get another one to attach to a voightlander lens. Its easier to use the camera's lens release then the one on the adapter. I haven't used any of the brand name adaptors and I can't do a comparison.

I bought this even after I read some of the reviews. This was the most economically priced product--others I saw that were priced well over $100--so I thought I'd give it a try. The build quality vs price is very good. Mounts easily and works well. I can use my Leica and CV lenses with no problems. What's not to like?

product_title: OM SYSTEM OLYMPUS PEN E PL10 Black Camera Body with Black M Zuiko Digital 14 42mm F3 5 5 6 EZ Lens

product_title: Domke 720 220 2 Compartment Insert Green
product_description: Customize your Domke bag with Velcro In padded inserts Gray nylon compartments feature removable high density padding Compatible with Domke F 4AF or F 7 system shoulder bags and Domke F 2 Original shoulder bag

reviews.review_body: I bought this to put in my Domke 701-83A F-803 bag. I removed the center divider and it holds my Canon Digital SLR nicely. YES, I WOULD recommend any DOMKE item to a friend or family member.

I bought one of these with the idea that I could put a Nikon 70-300 ED-AF w/hood in one compartment and stack a 28/2.8 AF and a 50/1.4 AF (both with hoods) in the other, like I can with the 4 compartment insert, but I was mistaken.  The 2 compartment insert is substantually smaller than half of the 4 pocket, so the 70-300 fits fine and seems to be well-padded, but the other compartment is more suited for a flash than another lens or two.  As with every Domke product I've owned (quite a few since the Original in 1976), the quality of construction is excellent and it does serve a purpose--just not the way I'd intended.

I bought this because I didnt want to lug around an expensive camera bag.
I like the inserts. They fit well  with my bookbag/messenger bag, and you cant tell I have a nice camera inside.

one holds my camera & kit lens, and the other insert holds my telephoto and soon to be UWA lens.
I agree that bottom portion of the insert needs the most padding, but its fine. I just went to Home Depot and bought some closed cell padding/insulation. works fine.

This is just poorly made, they didn't even bother to stich up the bottom so the foam padding is secure.  It's really too small for a D-600 and lens.  It would work for a couple of lenses without a body.  But I could not recommend it because of the poor quality.

I purchased this insert with the thought of putting it in the bottom of my backpack to hold my Canon SLR body and a medium sized zoom lens.  Impossible to do!  This insert is really small, and I would recommend something else if you have an SLR.

I have found genuine Domke products (there are a number of fakes out there) to be the perfect combination of security and minimalism.  In the case of Domke inserts, they are more moldable than the competing inserts and compliment Domke bags perfectly as they keep the bag from becoming too rigid.

When first transitioning from excessively padded compartments to Domke, you will be concerned about your gear being properly protected.  Trust me, after extended use and abuse, these inserts will not let you down unless you need to protect your equipment from 20 foot falls onto concrete.  Using these inserts, especially in Domke bags, provides great flexibility and usability without bulk and weight.

Many people are turned off upon receipt citing build quality because the foam appears to come out of the inserts.  The build quality is fine.  They are actually designed this way for flexibility.  They will not come apart (unless they are not genuine Domke).

I bought this insert to convert a large compartment in a Swiss Gear backpack to safety and securely store three lenses a Nikon 35mm F1.8, Nikon 18-55vr and Sigma 70-300mm APO DG lens.  The compartment is constructed of high quality material but something was oddly missing.  There is no foam on the bottom of the insert.  Now I've been using some foam inserts from an Ape Case on the bottom of this backpack to prevent damage during an accidental mishandling and I was expecting this insert to be padded on the bottom.

The insert is not hard sided but soft and flexible and the divider is attached with velcro so if you wanted you could completely remove it.  The sides are padded but a four star rating seems justified for such an oversight of padding on the bottom.  I'm still recommending this insert because its potential uses are endless and it is perfectly constructed.

This product is perfect for what it is designed for, which is fitting inside certain Domke bags. It is great for that purpose. I got it as a replacement to use inside my Domke F-4AF bag. That bag came with a similar insert, which is currently being used elsewhere. This new insert is much nicer than the original one. The original insert had a sewn-in divider in the middle. The new one has a movable divider so you can have one big compartment or create custom sized dual compartments.

A reviewer complained that the bottom edge of the sides are not stitched up and the foam protection is not secure. It is designed this way, so that you can remove unnecessary padding and create more room in the bag. So, for example, if this insert is placed next to another insert which already has padding in it, you can remove the foam in one of the inserts and have more space. The foam will be secure if it is used in the appropriate sized Domke bag. Another reviewer complains that there is no padding on the bottom. Again, this insert is designed to fit in Domke bags that already have padding in the bottom. Another layer of foam is unnecessary and wastes space.

If you are looking for a divider to use in a backpack or some other bag besides the appropriate Domke bag, you should probably look elsewhere. There are plenty of companies, such as F-stop, that make inserts that are much better suited for that purpose.

reviews.review_body: so so~

This handle works great, much better than the handle that comes with the camera bag. I have arthritis in my hands and even carrying the bag for a short distance would cause my hands to hurt. This rigid grip spreads the weight of the bag more evenly across the hand and makes it much easier to carry.
Nice that they added a real handle to this, might last longer now

I bought it to improve on the new generation bag handle, which is really ruining Domke's reputation. The new bags are not nearly as rugged and the handle was the worst, with plastic clips. This one is the real Domke Deal!

The product designation of "Super Handle" is a bit over the top as, yes, it is a handle, but ain't super. It's a basic handle of the simplest sort: a one inch cotton strap with a wooden stick stitched to the mid section and flat black metal clips sewed to the ends. Almost anybody could make one just as good with 30 minutes of hand stitching and $10 in parts. Of course, why make one when you can buy one for a few bucks more?

I prefer an adjustable strap with softer grip (lose the stick) and handle padding. A leather handle cover would be nice but I suppose that would fly in the face of Domke's spartan design ethics. Length adjustability is the biggie as some of us would prefer more slack or tightness. The design has a lot of extra material folded over, so you could use a button hole knife to cut the stitches and install a simple buckle to add adjustability.

Unfortunately, this handle comes up short in the comfort area. The handle feels fine on an empty or lightly loaded bag. However, that wooden stick really digs into your fingers with a loaded bag. I found an old neoprene suitcase handle and stitched it to the "Super Handle," making it fatter, softer and a wee bit more super.

The Super Handle is well made, albeit rather spartan, but comes up a bit short in ergonomics. With adjustability and padding this would be a 5-star product.

I've had a Domke F-2 olive green bag for many years, and my super handle strap literally wore out. I guess that means I've used the camera bag quite a bit.  This super handle is a nice improvement to the older one; I just wish I could have found it in olive green instead of black. The new one is a lot easier to grip and carry.
Perfect replacement handle/strap.

I'm more likely now to take my camera with me now as this is indeed a very small protective case. For the ppl that complain it's too small...just measure what you want to put in it. No sense in writing anything negative about this very well made case if you choose the wrong size. I'm really happy with this case...seems very well made for a decent price and just so happens to fit my Leica Q nearly perfectly. I also like it's not some no-name case from you know where..aka PRC,..no weird chemical smells...none of that nonsense. Just a very well made camera case for a very fair price vs it's quality!

product_description: Ideal for any travel and exploration experience Perfect for outdoor and wildlife enthusiasts Water resistant Magnification 8x Lens Diameter 42mm

reviews.review_body:
This National Geographic 16x32 binoculars is not to my liking. I use binoculars for birdwatching. This binoculars’ field of view is negligible (poor), which means I can’t find the bird. First, I have to use my regular eyes to find the bird. Then see if I can find the bird in the binoculars. Most of the time, I can’t find the bird. I am looking all over the place, but can’t find a reference point. If one can’t FIND the bird, one can’t WATCH it. For what it is, it is a good binocular — it is simply not useful to me. I will probably donate it to GoodWill. Maybe someone else will like it.

On the other hand, magnification is super good, once I find the bird. But so rarely that I actually find the bird.

I will try a Celestron Ultima Porro 8x42 to see if I like that.

The pictured binoculars are relatively nice ones worth $100+. The pair I received are a clearance bin item with an MSRP closer to $30. Still a savings, but it's on junk. Maybe I'll gift them away or something.
Original product
Great quality for the price

The box that was supposed to have the lens caps in them were empty in the original purchase and the replacement.
And the magnification was extremely poor--worse than the lesser one I bought at a thrift store.

I work as a professional bird guide, in Brazil, since 1982. I, highly, recommend this binoculars. If, you need extra information about them or about Birding in Brazil, please, don't hesitate in contacting me. E-mail: pauloboute@hotmail.com

This is the second Fotodiox C-Mount lens adapter to Nikon 1 camera that I have ordered in the past several weeks. I ordered a second adapter because the first one seemed so well made and durable that I was sure a second one would prove handy for mounting my Angenieux C-mount16mm movie camera lenses, of which I have several, to my two Nikon S1 camera bodies.

But, as warned, the Nikon 1 J1 must be operated in manual mode when a non-standard lens is attached, and focusing seems, thus far, to not be a simple matter. I'll modify this review if warranted. So is it worth buying this adapter? It was for me because it was inexpensive and I wondered if the better lenses would make the J1 more useful. But for now it's unlikely I will be using the lenses from my DSLR Nikon with the J1.

Not for the amateur or faint of heart but immensely rewarding if you have some old quality Minolta glass from the film era. Since this adapter is completely manual, you have to manually focus the lens and set aperture and shutter speed just like in the old days. For the price, it slips on and off my J1 smoothly enough, and the lenses similarly mount and dismount nicely from the adapter.

Here are some pointers on the use of this adapter on the J1:

Make sure you have the latest firmware upgrade for the camera.  It is freely available on the Nikon support website.

Carefully attach lens with adapter to camera. Only attach a lens that has a both a focus ring and an aperture ring.

Go into the menu and select exposure; then manual

Set the ISO to 400 or less in the menu

Set a shutter speed on the body with the little flippy switch in the upper right. You can focus with the lens wide open, and then turn the aperture ring to choose an aperture setting. As you close this aperture, objects closer and further from the point that you have chosen will come into focus, and less light will reach the sensor.

Try a shot, and look at it on the screen. You can just experiment with a different aperture or shutter speed depending on your initial result or press the display button until the histogram shows up alongside your shot, and change shutter speed or aperture to taste. repeat.

It sounds like a lot of work, but once you get the knack it becomes second nature. It is very rewarding to see the stunning results obtainable with old, sharp Minolta glass. It is also nice that this costs a fraction of the amount that Nikon charges for the modern autofocus equivalent lenses on the J1.

For Planar T* 50mm/1.4 (non MM) on V2/J1 camera.  I gave 5 stars based on the fact that it performs as best as it could for an adapter without electronics and for the price.

Carl Zeiss C/Y lens adapters for Nikon mount are usually bad as they do not allow infinity focus if it is a purely mechanical or if it include optical component it degrades the image quality (the whole point of trying to use a Carl Zeiss lens).  The beauty of using an adapter for Nikon 1 mount is that you can have infinity focus without optical components.

The only primes I have a Nikon 18mm/1.8 and a 50mm/1.8D. The 32mm/1.2 is out of my budget and I was considering getting a 50mm/1.4AFS for better DOF in the 1" sensor.  But during my trip to Denmark I stumbled on a Contax 139 with a Planar T* 50mm/1.4 (non MM unfortunately) for $18 so I thought it would be worthy to loose AF and give it a try.

The adapter works as it is supposed to (for a dumb adapter):
1) You can only take pictures on Manual
2) Manual focus only. The OK button will NOT enlarge the image
3) On my preliminary tests the image seems to be good. I like the bokeh.  The colors are great but change dramatically above base ISO (have not had the chance to investigate why). I don't remember seeing that effect with my Nikkor 50/1.8 and FT-1.

Do I recommend buying the adapter? Absolutely IF you already own a Carl Zeiss C/Y mount lens (or can find a real bargain like I did).  If you don't I would recommend getting a FT-1 and Nikon AF compatible lens as you would also get Aperture Priority and Image enlargement during manual. focus.

I bought this to mount some cheap C mount lenses on my Nikon V1.  Works great for my 25 mm f1.4 that you can find on sale from a number of merchants however when I got my 50 mm f1.7 it had a rather limited focus range about 1 - 2 meters away.  No focus to infinity - which I didnt expect.  I ended up getting my hands on another C mount adapter from EZFoto - and I noticed the overall thickness of the mount is less - tried it on the 50 mm f1.7 and voila, a semi usable focus range [still no infinity] but can focus to at least 3 - 4 meters away [usable for the effective 135 mm equivalent view]

Anyway, I still use this mount for the 25 mm f1.4, but if you use this on a C mount lens and find your focus range limited, you can probably mill out some of the metal or pay about 10 bucks for a thinner mount.

Tried to use this adapter with the Voigtlander 15mm Super Wide Heliar Leica M mount lens.
The lens fits on the adapter perfectly but there is a serious problem.
The lens will not focus further than 20 feet away even at infinity setting.
The adapter is the wrong thickness and is placing the lens either too close or too far from the sensor.
I would expect this same behavior for any Leica Wide angle lens as well.
Wide angle Leica M lenses have a longer lens protrusion into the camera and the adapter must take this into account.
This adapter does not, and anything past 20 feet is blurry no matter what you do.

Just took some pictures with this, my Nikon 1 camera and a couple of Kamero lenses I picked up last year in the US.  No glass and fits perfect.  I suspect the 35mm Kamero my turn out to be a real sleeper as it appears to be extremely sharp.  Mirrorless cameras work much better adapting legacy lenses as they do not require a glass in the adapter.  No loss of resolution at all.  This is a fun way to use all of your old legacy lenses. Will take some movies as I have read it is in movies that the older lenses really work the best.

This adapter works very nicely...I use it to mount my guitar serious 1 zoom with ON mount on my Nikon 1...it mounts smoothly and easily on my camera and holds it firmly...in place with the long lens attached...highly recommend...if you like to manual focus these are a great option to use really quality glass at a great price
Solid metal, good build quality. Some of my lenses did not screw in entirely, disabling inf focus. I had to heavily grind it down. Since then it works.

Using my "classic" Minolta lenses on the Nikon 1 with the 1" sensor provides a 2.8 multiplier, "Crop" factor. A 100mm lens equals 280 mm on the Nikon 1.

The adjustable Aperture, F-stop, ring is important to the correct use of Minolta lenses on the Nikon 1 or any other camera set to "Manual."

Heading says for Nikon 1, but..."Fotodiox PRO Lens Mount Adapter, Sony A-Mount, Minolta Maxxum AF Lens to a non Minolta.Sony AF camera.

I have a Nikon J1 and a few Zeiss lenses from my old film days and when I saw this product I figured I'd try it. What the heck, it was less than six bucks and if it didn't work I could use it for surf casting. If it did, then I could put a few dust collectors to work.

Well, it does exactly what is is supposed to do. The machining is top quality and they even thoughtfully added a tripod mount on the adapter, which is a good thing as the lenses are huge in comparison to the camera.

Advantages- You can utilize some old glass. There is a magnification factor of 2.7 which makes the 50 into a short telephoto and the 80-200 into a honking 540mm lens. The small sensor in the camera only uses the sweet spot of an already amazing lens. The depth of field is very shallow, especially at f1.4 giving some neat bokeh.

Disadvantages- The camera must be used fully manually. Focusing is a task on the screen, especially in bright light. Setting exposure is by trial and error as you will get nothing to indicate proper exposure. No real issue though, just take a guess and adjust as needed.

Since I got the camera cheap and I already had the lenses, this setup will be my beach camera where I don't like to take the SLR to close to the water. With the big lens on a tripod I can get some good surfer pictures.

Overall, a quality product from Fotodiox. Everything I have bought from them is good.

Yes you will be using manual mode using this adapter and I believe all except Nikon's official adapter.  Other reviewers have not been very fair since manual should be expected.  Unfortunately Nikon's adapter is just too expensive and not worth the price for the Nikon 1 system.  One of the reasons I really like Canon mirrorless is the ability to get a cheap adapter for Canon EF mount lenses that communicates with the camera and autofocuses.  But that isn't the case with Nikon 1.

The biggest disappointment for me is discovering Nikon is not allowing magnification when a lens isn't detected.  At least that seems to be the case on the V1 and it sounds like it applies to other Nikon 1 models.  The screen is sharp enough to focus when you don't need to be very precise, but (from only a few minutes of testing) it seems it may be quite difficult to achieve precise focus.

Anyway regarding this adapter specifically it works well as expected.  I bought this one because it allows adjusting aperture and as far as I know I don't think most of the others do (will need aperture ring on lens and most of my Nikon lenses do not have one)

product_title: AmScope Kids SE100 ZZ LED 20X 50X Cordless Student Stereo Microscope LED Light
product_description: Two magnification settings offering clear erect stereo images Built in reflecting top LED light powered by two AA batteries Cordless and portable for on site field applications Two Pairs of Eyepieces Included Excellent Five 5 Year Factory Warranty

reviews.review_body: Good basic observation microscope. Wish the lenses would stay in place easier. Otherwise very pleased.
Love it
Excellent product...very light but good quality optics and the battery with light is convenient.  Thumbs up.
Spend a little more and get the SE305, Hugh improvement, the difference between a toy and a tool.
Great little scope.  Very user friendly my 6 year old has no problems operating it.  It's light weight is great for taking outside to explore.
We are very impressed with our own experience on the product; buying one for kiddo's best friend as they enjoyed so much looking into the microscopic world!
We got this for my 5th grader and it is great.  We use it for bugs, rocks and a host of other things we want to see up close.  This was a great buy!
For the grandchildren and they have had it for over a year and love it.  They check all kids of things under it.  More a magnifying  then microscope but they still learn from looking.

Nice & Clear and the LED light works very well. This is the perfect power for looking at cool everyday things (20x). My son and I love it.  Construction seem reasonable especially for the price. The spare 50x lenses do fit a little loose but they work ok.
Portable and inexpensive but lacks the qualities that could make it a stand in for an expensive binocular scope.

Purchased for my granddaughter. She's eight and loves it. It took her a bit to figure out the focusing and since then has been looking at everything under the sun she can get under the microscope. At her age she really doesn't understand cells and other truly microscopic items, but she really understands bugs, pebbles, and other tiny items that exist in her reality.
no sense in giving x15 eye pc's if it's going to blur the view.

This was a Christmas present for the kids to mess around with and hopefully get interested in science. Some reviewers seem disappointed that this is not a serious optical instrument. At this price point, it is not intended to be. It also is not a quite a toy, the quality is a little better than that. It is light, portable and fairly durable. I would buy it again.

My wife homeschools our 4 kids so I thought this stereo microscope would make a fun addition to their curriculum.  So far, our favorite specimens have been insects (stink bugs) and mold we found in some expired salsa.  Sometimes it helps to use a desk lamp for more light.  To remove the eye pieces, pull them out, don't unscrew them.  Very happy with the product, the price, and the customer service

This was a great present for our daughter. The whole family has really gotten into finding things to view. The construction is solid, but we got one with a lose wire for the light. Easy fix for me. Defitely worth it.
Okay but arrived damaged and had to return.  Somewhat flimsy / delicate.  Durability questionable so did not elect to replace damaged unit.

The microscope is a good one.  My nieces (11 and 9 years) love it.  But, it came without the 25x eye pieces for the 50x power.  After I wrote the company an email, they sent ONE eye piece.  Another email later, the other one was sent.

I do appreciate their being responsive and eventually both missing eye pieces came.  However, I was amazed the incompetence of some of their staff--how can you send just one eye piece for a machine that needs a pair to operate properly.

I got this for my son who is nine.  He loves everything sciene and is now looking for anything he can examine under this.  For the price, I didn't expect a scientific instrument, but the utility of this is great.  One of the eyepieces comes out a tad too easy so I just had to make sure my son was aware of this and is careful if he carries it anywhere.

A plastic case to store/transport this in instead of a cheap plastic bag cover would make this five stars.

Now I just need the perfect book to give him ideas of things to examine and what to look for!

The 50x magnification (25x eyepieces plus 2x objectives) of this scope has such a narrow field of view that it cannot be viewed with my glasses on. With glasses off and eye guards on, it works, though it takes some getting used to (you have to press your eyes to the eye guards to see 50X).

20X is perfectly fine with glasses on, as its field of view is significantly wider and deeper.

This is not surprising (as width and depth of view always decrease with higher magnification), but still worth it to keep in mind. Better 25x eyepieces would have offered better viewing experiences.

At 20x with help of the included LED light, you can clearly see an enlarged 3D image of a lady bug. Depth of view at 20x is enough for lady bug (or any insect of same of less thickness). 20x or 50x also works well for a small ant.

Diameter of the eyepieces are 23 mm. If you need 10X (and wider and deeper view), you can buy a pair of 23 mm 5X eyepieces to use with this scope.

Build quality is not bad for the price. I saw exposed circuit boards in the scope's battery compartment and loose/cheap plastic parts. Main body of this scope is light and made of plastic. However optics are decent enough (though, again, 25x eyepieces could use a wider view).

Great first microscope for my daughter, she looks at all sorts of things through it.  Flies and insects are fascinating. Simple to use. Getting a small plastic petri dish to contain samples, it's a lot easier! Downside = flimsy build quality (hence 4 stars), but adequate for kids who look after their stuff.

This was one of the best Christmas gifts I gave.  We looked at allot of things including spiders,  sinks bugs, fly,  jewelry,  stones,  rocks, ...really works well.  We could see things not visible to the naked eye.  It made the kids really excited about science.  It magnified the bus to show details we never saw.

I'm very pleased with this sturdy little stereoscope. We received it today and have been looking at our less-than-1/2-inch caterpillars; moth, butterfly, and cicada  wings; seeds; and other small, solid items. The detail is very crisp and clear. Included in the package: dust cover, 2 AA batteries, 2 25x eye pieces, and 2 rubber pieces to fit on ends of lenses.

The 20x lenses work great, and I am pleased with the nice, clear picture. When I put on the 50X eyepieces, the quality was so poor that I could see more with the 20X. If I were to buy again, I would have gotten something to hook up to the computer for the same price that gives you a greater zoom that everyone can see at once.

I was very disappointed it stated that you could hook it up to computer it also shows that on the box but nothing came with it to do so if there is a adapter or a cord or camera I could purchase to fit the microscope that would be great
I really liked the idea that this microscope is cordless and lightweigh and it worked well, but the higher powered eyepieces didn't fit.  I ended up sending it back for a refund :(

Purchased this portable scope for the twins to take to the park and use when exploring the woods and pond water.  Well built but does not like cold temperatures,  the adjustment knob slips in cold weather and works well in warm weather, the plastic used must shrink and cause slippage.  Can live with this and overall a good product.
Scope works great. Does what it's designed to do. Not professional lab quality but a fair price and fair quality.

reviews.review_body: Advertised to fit the Sony hx80.  Doesn't fit it at all.  Total waste of money.  Thanks for the garbage whoever described this.
I can't believe someone gave this 5 stars.  My Sony almost rattles inside this thing and to make things even worse it is open 1/2 way on both sides.
Fit perfectly

There are two similar-looking models of MegaGear case, but one is larger, and too large for these camera models.  The one I received when I ordered this is the larger model, which is clearly too large and the camera just rattles around inside.  I tried ordering two other MegaGear small camera cases and it seems MegaGear is making this same mistake with all of their small camera cases on Amazon.

Case is a little too big for my SONY HX80. I got this camera to be a pocket camera, but this case will defy its purpose by making it gigantic. It has too much extra space that camera rattles in it. Returned without any difficulty. Two stars for good quality and magnetic enclosure which I liked, but I only had it for 1-2 days.
Case arrived promptly. Good quality. Fit camera well.
I really like the camera case and my camera fit into it very well.  Good purchase.

The leather case is durable and fit my Sony DSC PERFECTLY!  Like the shoulder strap that allows you to keep the camera close with quick removal from the case.  The description notes that you can take pictures while the camera is in the case.  That is not accurate for THIS case. Other cases from this company can do that for larger camera - but not this case.

product_title: Opticron Marine 3 7x50 Monocular
product_description: Porro prism design with contoured protective rubber armoring Nitrogen gas filled waterproof construction Fully multi coated optical system all air glass surfaces Full field of view wearing glasses with fold down rubber eyecups Eyepiece focusing

reviews.review_body: Solid but unfortunately it's terrible at bringing things closer 20 feet maybe,  sent it back

Love the Marine 3 7x50 monocular by Opticron. I bought it three months ago, and have found it to be both a great supplement to my telescope sessions, and also a very useful instrument on it’s own. Here in western Oregon where I live, opportunities for stargazing can be fleeting in fall and winter. Being waterproofed and nitrogen filled means it won’t easily fog up.

With a magnification of 7x and an aperture of 50mm, the Marine 3 brings in plenty of starlight for scanning the sky. Even in my light polluted suburbs, I’m able to view the Andromeda Galaxy, the Orion Nebula and a few of the other showcase Messier objects. The eye relief is great and the monocular fits well in my hand. It’s light enough to minimize shakiness while viewing, and it provides a nice, wide field of view. Recommended!

Monoculars are the overlooked cousins of binoculars.Sometimes a monocular is more handy
because of its smaller size and weight and the fact that it can't be knocked out of collimation
like binoculars.

This 7x50 has excellent build quality,fit and finish.The field of view is 7.2 degrees,a little
more than the usual 7.1.

Eye relief is superb,eyeglass wearers (like this reviewer) will have no problems.
(The eyepiece has a fold down feature to accommodate eyeglasses.)

Images were sharp and it passed its star test but like all refractor instruments
it had the usual coma flaring as the image neared the edge of the lens.(You can only
see this with a point source of light like a star.)

The "marine" designation means it's nitrogen filled and waterproofed.

So while "pricey" you get what you pay for,a high quality well made
monocular that's worth it.
Well made - and strong.

lightweight, excellent optics, no color fringing seen. focus works great but with such long depth of field (which is an excellent advantage) really tuning in to the most sharp focus is more difficult--not a bad thing technically but just different experience. I find myself looking for detail moving the focus up and down to really perfect the focus. Once in focus nothing is sharper! Sharpness (of course not magnification) is as good  as neighbors $3500 15 x 56  and $600 10 x 21 binoculars. In dim lighting everything is much brighter than with naked eyes. QUALITY of this monocular is TOPS! I bought and returned roof prism monoculars with ED glass because this was better such as better than the ED glass Hawk monocular not even close in sharpness (though it is a 8 x 42 it will obviously, also, gather less light).

reviews.review_body: Works good.

The inside diameter of the plastic insert is too small and so the shaft of the Luxo lamp is not firmly held in a vertical position. So the base of the Luxo lamp flops over and the lamp won't stay in a set position.
It Worked the way it was supposed to
Very useful when you need to mount your lamps to a flat surface.
Fit my Luxo light perfectly. Allowed me to get rid of the clamp that was always coming loose.
Just like the lamp would have come with! Use larger screws than what they supply for heavier lamps.

reviews.review_body: Great case with good protection.  Holds the Osmo Pocket in the original case thus adding neoprene protection to the existing hard case.  Appears to be well made.
Exactly as described.
protects my osmo pocket nicely. fits even with the gimbal cover on.
Groovy fit. This little case gives me confidence when I take my camera out in the wild.

This neoprene case has a very nice feature of a fully articulating clip fastener that allows for attachment to anything without binding up. I’ll be buying a few more for my backpack use and dive bag addition.
My DJI pocket gimbal in its protective case fits perfect in this pouch. I wear the pouch on my belt. Easy to access and also looks great.
Bought a new DJI Pocket ll and this case is the perfect case to protect my camera, thinking of getting another one for my other Osmo pocket.  Love the belt hook and the clip...

I needed a soft case for my Osmo to make sure it is not damaged in a bento box on my bike even through the roughest rides.  After some research, I purchased this case and do not regret.  Great quality, easy access to the camera, soft, nice colors. I will buy this case if I need one more.
Carrying DJI Pocket 2 with its original case with wide angle lens and the rest of the adapters was troublesome as they were easily fell off. This neoprene case fits the gimbal and its original case.
The fit is really good and the color is really nice. The vocal holds up really well
