reviews.review_body: For me this is a scam. It is literaly contact paper, the one u use to cover books and notebooks. But the difference is that u pay 10 times more for 3 small pieces. I am pretty sure this is not an autentic polaroid product. Amazon shall check this item.

It is good that they include 3.  I tried to put on the first one, and I could not get the bubbles out.  I used the tool they included but it made scratches and never could get out the bubbles. So, I used the 2nd one.  It is much better as far as the bubbles are concerned and less scratches, but one edge is already peeling up. I have use screen protectors in the past and never had this experience.
They do not stick
These do a great job of protecting the screens on our Canon Elph Powershot 300 series camera screens after being cut down to size.

I've received these in the bundles offered for various lens and camera bases.

There is no possible way to put these protectors on without having bubbles or other issues.  Trying to make adjustments makes it worse.  The card that comes with is low quality and the edges decay/soften after just a couple strokes..  They are also super thin, which isn't that big of a deal to me.

I view them as a temporary protector for a few days before the one I want arrives.  I would NEVER buy these as I think almost every competing product would be better.  They are almost low quality enough it would be like throwing your money away.
Wrong Dimentions Listed. Its actually 4" x 3" not 5" so it doesnt even come close to fitting. I tried sticking the one directly in the middle but it doesnt stick well at all. Peels very easily.
Easy to use. I was satisfied.

product_title: Manfrotto 153 Mole Richardson Adapter Converts 5 8 Inch Stud 48mm Long Mount Replaces 3106 Gray
product_description: Product Type Camera Other Accessories Package Quantity 1 Package Weight 1 0 lbs Country Of Origin Italy

reviews.review_body: Not too much to say.  It's solid.  I use it to provide a few inches of extra length on the bottom of a Phottix Multi Boom used in a Westcott medium Apollo Softbox.  Just one of many uses I'm sure.

The Manfrotto 153 is one of many adapters I keep in my studio to help make diverse pieces of gear work together. Sometimes I need more clearance for a light head and the 153 is ideal for adding a little length to a light stand, Super Clamp stud, extension arm or boom. Simply slip the 5/8" socket over the stand stand tip and tighten the t-screw and you're in business. It also fits perfectly on mic stands and booms if you need to press one into light stand service.

While not as strong as milled pieces--it's cast aluminum--the 153 is well made and strong enough to gold up a typical 5- or 7-bulb CFL head on a boom or Super Clamp.

Finally, realize the tip is designed to mount standard light stands (Mole Richardson style) and doesn't work with a cold shoe unless you add another adapter on top of it, e.g., Manfrotto Umbrella Mount 026. If you mainly plan to use a cold shoe, you should get a

product_title: Zing BLUE 501 101 Standard Neoprene Camera Case for DSLR Cameras with Small Prime or 18 55mm Lenses Black
product_description: All Zing camera cases are made of 5mm 1 4 inch thick neoprene Zing neoprene is laminated between layers of smooth nylon knit making it quick to remove and scratch resistant Neoprene sheds water like a duck making it an ideal outdoor material providing great protection against rain snow sand and dust Perfect for DSLR cameras with an 18 55mm 35mm or 50mm lens Neoprene has just the right thickness and density to absorb the shock of everyday handling

reviews.review_body: The Zing camera case is perfect for traveling.  I've only used it with the standard Canon Rebel prime lens and haven't had any problems. It's durable, easy to put on and take off and provides that extra protection to make you feel secure about handling your camera.
Zing 501-102 SB1 Standard SLR Cover (Blue)Zing 501-102 SB1 Standard SLR Cover (Blue)Zing 501-102 SB1 Standard SLR Cover (Blue)  great Product just did not fit

This case is freak'in awesome!  Protects the camera without the bulk - connects to camera strap so you can just slip it off and shoot without having to try to find someplace to stash the case - love it!

Excellent quality.
Fits snugly the Olympus E-M1 with mounted 12-40 f2.8 lens, but without the lens hood.
Material is thicker and firmer than the Optech
A little tight for my cannon t3i with 18-55mm lense but I got it to work. Difficult to get in and out of case.

This case is great for traveling with to protect your camera but I always take it off and leave it in the room if I'm out and about snapping pictures as it has a tendency to get in my way if it's hanging off my camera.

I love the idea of this product, but in practice it's a little cumbersome. I've been using it with the new Pentax K-X for about a month and a half. I normally have the 18-55mm kit lense attached. With this combination it does fit, but it's a tight squeeze and I worry a little about putting too much force on the lens to loop the top over. It has stretched out some and I think it does its job well enough now. I'd probably go for the Op/Tech type neoprene case if I had to do it over again, although that one might have its own problems.
This cover did a great job of protecting my camera.  I found it light weight to carry on my trips.

Was looking for something to provide protection for my Sony DSC-HX100V while it was floating around a backpack.  As others have mentioned, it can be a little tricky placing the camera into the cover but I see that as a sacrifice I make for the compact design of this product..no big deal.  I was concerned that the grip on my camera might prevent the cover from closing properly but was quickly relieved to see that it wasn't an issue at all.  The lens area of the cover provides me a little extra room at the end which is good because if I accidently hit the power button on the camera as I'm placing it in the case the lens has some room to extend.  If the lens had no room to extend it could damage the lens motor, so I'm glad there is a little extra room.

Seems perfect for moderate protection from scrathes and bumps. I like it.
This is a nice camera cover if your camera fits.  Mine does not and the cover keeps falling off.  I do still have it.  I may have a camera in the future that it fits better.

The case was too small even for my small DSLR (a Canon SL1) with basic kit lens.

I had no choice but to return it.

I had to import this great camera cover to New Zealand after not being able to find it anywhere in Australasia, Dubai and Europe. It is such a great traveller because it is less bulky than normal covers - when using a small backpack - and it still gives the protection necessary. The only recommendation I would add is a small Velcro pocket for the spare battery/SD card.

I was looking for a camera sized protective case for my Nikon Coolpix P90 and came across this. While it spoke specifically to using it for the DSLR I thought it might work for my needs.
It fits the P90 perfectly and while it is bothersome to have it hanging from the camera while shooting, it does provide the protection I was looking for.

This is the second Zing cover that I own.  I bought my first for my very first camera, a Canon AT-1 SLR, at the local drug store, back in the early 90's and though I don't use that camera anymore, its Zing cover is still protecting it in it's place in the closet.
I bought my second Zing cover here at Amazon for my brand new Canon EOS 60D DSLR.  It's the exact same size as the first and cause my new camera is a bit bulkier, the Zing cover is a bit snugger, though it works for me, just as wonderfully as my original did for almost 20 years.

This case fits very well with my 40mm Prime lens on a Nikon D5100, but it feels like it won't fit much larger. Most kit lenses will be too large for use with this case.

The quality of construction is second to none, and the fact that the colors reverse is cool. I can only marvel at the fact that someone couldn't figure out how to close it... it's simple and elegant.

I slept with my camera inside my sleeping bag on a 25º night. Despite the camera being oblong and my mummy bag being snug, this case made the camera comfortable to float around with in there. It also made it feel very secure from being accidentally rolled on, though, this was a minor concern.

product_title: Athlon Optics 10x50 Cronus UHD Laser Rangefinder Black Binoculars with Eye Relief for Adults High Powered Binoculars for Hunting and Long Range Targets
product_description: Accurate Precise Rangefinder Ranging capabilities of 5 800 yd on a deer and up to 2000 yd on a reflective target includes illuminated ranging display perfect for hunting or long range targets Ultra High Definition View These ultra high definition binoculars have exceptional edge to edge clarity sharp detail enhancement ultra clear brightness and true color representation Top Tier Viewing Experience Athlon Optics Cronus provides ED glass for a sharper image an edge to edge system for image clarity and a ESP dielectric coating for accurate color reproduction Lightweight Durable Magnesium chassis is as tough as a metal chassis but more lightweight tough XPL lens coating prevents scratches and dirt buildup Built for the Outdoors Athlon is a proud US sports optics product company we are devoted to delivering superior quality optic products and outdoor accessories at a competitive price

reviews.review_body: Did a low light test with a pair of 10x42 Swarovski EL’s and I couldn’t see a noticeable difference between the two. The Swaros are a more comfortable to hold, but they don’t have a rangefinder in them either. Overall, I’m very pleased!

product_title: MegaGear MG1519 Slr Dslr Leather Shoulder Or Neck Strap For Canon Nikon Samsung Olympus Sony Fujifilm Panasonic Dark Brown
product_description: High quality leather the Mega gear leather Camera straps are made with high quality stylish leather Stylish and functional this strap lets you keep your camera within quick reach with comfort Secure secure your camera with a soft adjustable Nonslip strap that gives you quick hands free access for indoor or outdoor photo shoots Convenient The Mega gear leather Camera strap is designed to help carry your camera over the shoulder or around the neck the thick strap will prevent tension and stress from the weight of your camera Universal The Mega gear camera strap works with a wide range of SLR and DSLR camera models including Canon Nikon Sony Olympus Pentax and more Durable the Mega gear shoulder strap is designed with long term use in mind and will accompany your camera through its life

reviews.review_body: This was definitely not what I expected. I have had many camera straps and this one is about half the width of all of them. Not big enough for a DSLR.
I love it!
Advertising quick release clips... Does Not Include any!!! Be forewarned...
real leather, good value
Definitely satisfied with quality.
JUST WHAT I WANTED  CLASSY WIDE CONFORTABLE  STRAP  GOOD BUY
Not a great strap. Average at best.
Leather is okay quality, could be a bit softer

No complaints about the product itself; however, I guess when it went through packaging somebody was not careful because the leather came with a jagged fingernail scratch all the way down the middle. It’s so deep that I cannot get it out with leather balm. We are rolling with the worn look, but I am very disappointed in the product check.

Have not used this in the field so I can't comment on performance.

Pros:
Lesther-Well built.
Fits the camera well.

Cons:
Directions do not make sense. If you have ever added a strap to a camera or binoculars, do this one the same way.
Limited adjustibility.
Love this strap so much that I’m buying a second one for my other camera
I purchased this for a camera I gifted and I was disappointed when I saw the gift opened since the connecting buckles did not come in the package. The strap is useless

Basic soft leather strap. A perfect fit on my fuji X-T3. Be advised that you will need ring adapters to attach to certain bodies. The price of this strap certainly offsets that additional purchase. Very satisfied.
Does what I need it to do. After all, it's only a strap. It attaches securely, holds a heavy camera and lens combination and I haven't had a problem with it.

Good quality leather stitching is well done but I'm kinda confused with the advertising of this product. In the picture it shows an extension clip straps but they are not included? Initially I thought there maybe a second option where the extra extension clip is included but no. I've bought two and both came with just the leather strap. So for that I'm taking 2 stars just for false advertising.

This isn't the best strap ever, but it's a good strap. It will give you that sweet timeless look with a touch of class and wanderlust. It's not very wide so it's not the most comfortable, especially with heavy glass, but it get's the job done. Will it be the strap you hand down to your protégé... no, probably not... but it's okay, it'll do ya for now until you find your favorite strap ever.
Excellent leather neckstrap that is affordable, I bought multiple of these for my binoculars and cameras. Highly recommended.

Some reviews mention not receiving the extension clips - mine arrived with them in a small bag. They clip in easily and do not feel fragile. The stitching on mine was good, and the length also fits well.
No complaints, good for the price.

product_title: Barska AB12804 Level ED Waterproof Binoculars 10x42
product_description: Compact Binoculars The tough and compact 10x42mm binoculars is a handy optic that is suitable for a wide range of activities Quality Optics The binoculars comes with Extra Low Dispersion Glass BAK 4 prism and fully multi coated optics bringing you bright and crystal clear views Rugged Design The binoculars is dry nitrogen pruged and sealed and is protected with rubber armor It is fogproof waterproof and shockproof Comfort Handling The Level ED binoculars series feature a non slip textured rubber design ensuring a comfortable and stable viewing experience Accessories The binoculars comes with Carrying Case Neck Strap and Lens Cloth

reviews.review_body: I once owned a pair of budget Barska porro prism binos when I was younger. They were adequate and I have to say worked very well. That's mainly what Barska is known for. There were hardly any reviews on these particular binos anywhere so I was rather hesitant.  But I decided to take a chance with the Ed glass and all. At the moment I own Bushnell Legend L 12x50 ED, an old pair of Zen rays 10x42, these Barskas 10x42, and 1 pair of Vanguard Spirt ED, all roof prism. I'm going to compare these to the Legend L. The Bushnells are very good binoculars and like them better than the Vortex Diamondback for clarity and edge to edge viewing, and no color issues. Edge to edge so far have found nothing. And very clear. I',m satisfied with them. When I got the Barskas and tried them I was sort of stunned. I got what I was hoping for. These are even clearer and more detailed than the Legend! An etched clarity. And with the same edge to edge clarity. Not only that it matched them in every other optical way, including light transmission, and keep in mind the Lgends are 12x50. Mechanically I like the Legends a little better, while the legends are  significantly heavier.  The only other thing I would say is at the price they are at this time, they are a steal! They're worth much more in my opinion. And they have a limited lifetime warranty.

product_title: Firefield 10x42 Binoculars
product_description: Bak 4 Prism High quality optical component known for its superior light transmission edge to edge clarity and minimal distortion Fully Multi Coated Optics Elevate optical performance with anti reflective coatings on all lenses maximizing light transmission brightness color accuracy and reducing reflections Achieve premium image quality in top tier optical equipment Ergonomic Design The Firefield 10x42 Binocular is designed with ergonomics in mind offering users a comfortable and user friendly viewing experience ensuring that extended periods of observation are comfortable and strain free Lightweight Twist Up Eyecup This binocular features lightweight twist up eyecups allowing users to easily adjust the eyecup height for a customized and comfortable fit accommodating those who wear eyeglasses or sunglasses for extended viewing sessions

reviews.review_body: Better than expected, highly recommend.

product_description: Country of Origin China Package length 1 0 Package width 1 0 Package height 1 0

reviews.review_body: very handy to mount lights below say desk level,  well-made.
good for small flash heads , but if raised high , can be wobbly with heavy heads .
Sturdy light stands, like all Manfrotto products!!  I have used Manfrotto for the last 30+ years, they are superb products for the right price!!
Pretty portable size and very lightweight. I'm using for measurements microphones
It's a good, well built stand.  I would have given it 5 stars if it used the fold flat legs of Manfrotto's light stands.

Great stand to hold an iPad with: iPad bracket not included. :)
This does not have big ol outrigger legs, so some people may consider this top-heavy with an iPad attached.
As the description says: this only goes about 4 ft high: maybe not high enough for some.
You'll need a thread adapter to convert from the smaller thread size to a standard mic stand thread: cheap and easy. I own two of these stands.
Like most Manfrotto studio gear, this one is made very well. The 3rd stage gives you a bit more height than the base model backlight stand. Overall, very good build quality for the money.
Great stand.  Very light weight but sturdy at the same time.  I purchased several for a sound calibration kit and have been very happy with the stand.

The brand almost says it all, it is very useful for small spaces, lights to illuminate the back of the stage, attach a monitor of 7 or 10 inches in its thread 1/4, a microphone, well built, tough ... even in an emergency I could use it with a heavy 1000 open face light arri.

La marca casi que lo dice todo, es muy muy util para espacios pequeños, luces para iluminar el fondo del escenario, acoplar un monitor de 7 o 10 pulgadas en su rosca 1/4, un microfono; bien construido, resistente...incluso en una emergencia pude usarlo con una pesada luz arri 1000 open face

The practicality of this product, along with Manfrotto's typically outstanding built quality, combine to make this an item most photographers will find indispensable in the studio. A superb alternative to the bulky and balky boom systems more commonly used to position lights low to the ground. And (to my surprise) it works well even with large and relatively heavy lights.

reviews.review_body: The only one I use...
Quality product
Works perfect with my GoPros and my tripods.
Good quality, just wish there was a nut instead of a threaded insert

This probably isn't a bad product. I rated it harshly because I received something different than what's pictured and the difference could be important. The product photo does not show the bottom of the tabs having a thinner area where they attach to the base. Also the way the bottom of the tabs have 90 degree angles rather than radii / fillets makes them more likely to fatigue and break. I thought that I was buying a better than average product. Now that I have it, this product doesn't appear to be anything special :-(
I wanted to contact Fotodiox directly but I couldn't find an email address on their website.
A very good product, very happy with the purchase
Works great for my GoPro.
The aluminum base and brass nuts mean that this adapter is lightweight but strong.  The quality is top notch. I no longer worry about the GoPro coming loose and falling off.
This is well made and durable. I use it to attach my GoPro to Joby tripod. Worked flawlessly.

reviews.review_body: Much better than anticipated. Use them on many events. Gives a nice studio feel in tight conditions.
If I could get it on my flash maybe it would be ok.... Elastic is waaaaay too tight. Fought with it for an hour and couldn't get it on.

This looks just like a RoundFlash. But they can't call it that, because it is a knockoff.

Buying this unit actually hurts photographers. How? Because it is a direct knockoff of the RoundFlash ring adapter. And when companies do things like this (CowboyStudios is, in fact, pretty famous for having no respect for IP) it stifles innovation.

The RoundFlash was an innovative approach to ring flash adapters. But why would someone in the future put in the time, work, money and risk to create cool things when you can expect to see it ripped off by companies like CowboyStudio?

The original version is better made, comes without the baggage of damaging the industry and only a little more expensive. Please don't support these kinds of shady ethics companies.

I like the results, nice soft light from the Nikon flashes, folds nicely, travels well.  Only drawback is the mount does not allow the softfbox to drop down to parallel to the camera lens.  Light is slightly above subject when flash is hot shoe camera mounted. Works great on a boom for accent/hair light and when you need soft directional well placed light.

The item pictured appears to be a round flash with no branding, common practice with cowboy studio knock offs.

This has entirely different, much cheaper, and in no way even metal let alone magnetic supports. They are a cheap, plastic hinge system the kind of locks in place, but any amount of pressure ore movements unlocks them.

Even the center where you put the lens is far inferior to the real one and the one pictured on this.

I assure you that this item will be useless to you if purchased. You can see pictures of what I received attached and immediately will notice it's not the same thing.

Purchased this instead of the L brand. I'm an amature, not a pro. May use this a few times a year. For the money, it works great. Using it on a Photix Mitros flash. Fit is snug- a good thing. Easier to mount to the flash before you put the front fabric on so you can reach in. Once on, it performs nicely. Will not be confused for a 24x24 softbox, but easy to handle in one hand while the camera is in the other (using wireless remotes or a TTL cable).

I am very disappointed with this product. I opened it up and was really excited because it looked like a really fun, portable, easy to use modifier. I should have known better when the velcro pulled right off of the inner diffuser as soon as I tried to attach it to the inner velcro flaps (I didn't pull on it hard or anything). I was ok with this for $12.00 though so I superglued the velcro back on. So then I go to put it on my flash. The hole in the back was to small to fit around my Yongnuo YN560 OR my Nikon SB26 which renders this "universal fit" product worthless to me. Also the black material it is made out of is very poor quality, there are small holes in it straight out of the packaging and I don't see it lasting more than a couple months with regular use (if that). I really, really wanted to like this but I can't find any reason to.

Also, in case Amazon is wondering why I am reviewing something I didn't buy from them, I bought this off of eBay DIRECTLY FROM Cowboy Studios because they had it for $12 with free shipping.
Excellent
Item as described. Easy to set up, incredible quality.
Perfect, they do exactly what they say they do (I have two of them now).
does not stay on
This is great. All photographers need this. It softens and helps with those harsh shadows the flash throws. I love it.

It does the job designed to do.
Fit's in most photo bags.
With careful handling, this softbox will be around for years to come.
falls off the flash

As always Cowboy Studio has provided quality, cost efficient, easy to use and set up products. Cowboy Studio is always my first stop when it comes to Studio, lighting and still life photography equipment.
Nice
got here quick and worked really well
Took an awfully long time to ship it out. But does the job.
Pretty flimsy, mediocre product. It would not hold it's shape when put on a light and kept collapsing in on itself.
I use this as a Desktop Softbox for some studio desk lamps i purchased.
Inside is Velcro and can be kind of difficult to position.  Overall, I am happy with the product.
The product works as expected.  The zippered case is a weak point.  The zipper pulled away from the thin fabric with a few uses. Very useful for the money.

Cheaply made and somewhat different than the advertised picture.
The spreaders are not magnetically locked to each other as in the picture, they are cheap plastic spacers with center hinges that don't lock well.
It works if you are to modify it by adding bolts to lock the plastic hinges.

For the price it's not so bad. But it is an awkward fit and more trouble than it's worth sometimes but it does diffuse the light well enough to fill harsh shadows softly so I can't argue with the results.

This met my expectations.  I was going to do a beach shoot and my first off camera flash.  The smaller footprint meant it would blow away with the wind on th beach and the compact design allowed me to set it to the side.  The images came out fantastic.
I was looking for something to diffuse the light when I don't have a good place to bounce light from and this fits the bill.  Easily mounts to my

I purchased this specifically for off-camera flash in macro shooting scenarios, and it is perfect for that.  Seems solidly made, and the double diffusion evens out the flash very well (at the cost of some output power). At the close distances I use this for macro, it doesn't matter about the output loss.  I'm also interested in using this on a flash bracket for events.  Seems like it might work well for medium distance (6-8') shots.  Anything further will probably not benefit much from the small diffuser -- but we'll see!

Serves it's purpose. Seems sturdy enough but I have to struggle to get it on my flash because the opening is round and my flash is rectangular. Once it's on it stays on well. It takes a little moving back and forth to get it square because you store it folded up.  The velcro is really strong, I have to be careful when I'm wearing a sweater that it doesn't get caught on the velcro! For the money I think it does a good job.  I'm only a beginner photographer so I don't know enough about proper lighting to say whether this is great, but for me it was a good purchase.

I bought these softboxs so that I could do some quick little food photography setups without have the big softboxes in the kitchen. They set up fairly easily and produce a nice light...especially when I place them close to the subject and turn down the intensity of the flash.  The reason that I only gave them 4 stars instead of 5 is because they have a tendency to fall off of the flash when I have the flash above the subject, pointed down.  I need to work on resolving this problem. I like them much better than a similar product by fotodiox.  The fotodiox product does not stay open and will collapse when attached to the flash. These do not have that problem at all.

I had purchased a Fotodiox rectangular softbox, and while I'm a Fotodiox fan, their 9" box flopped over and blocked a lot of my light.  When I saw this product, which looks like a smaller version of my 24"X24" softboxes I knew I had the answer.  Now that it has arrived, I'm not disappointed.  I use the softbox attached to my speedlight on a flash bracket which places the entire assembly high above my camera.  When shooting up close (2-4 ft.)  the softbox creates soft, smooth shadow transitions.  It isn't a large softbox of course, so when you back up a bit, reducing the effective size of the light, the shadows become more defined quickly.  Usually, I use this along with a 24"X24" softbox or a 43" umbrella on a pole and held by a VAL as a main light and my small 9" softbox on my flash bracket as fill.  This is a great two light event setup and gives me a ton of options and flexibility.
The opening in the 9" softbox fits snuggly on my YN 565 EX flash (virtually the same size as a Canon 580 EX) and the two sets of wide velcro straps won't let go anytime soon.  One thing I discovered right away in regards to mounting my flash inside the unit is to not strap the flash into the softbox firmly.  Doing so causes the flash to point to the bottom of the softbox.  Letting the straps have a little play will keep the flash head pointed forward and still keep the softbox from falling off.
Four stars?  This thing isn't going to fall apart on me...especially since I'll never fold it back up and put it back into it's case.  But the stitching could be a little better.  Still...for $15?  It's a very useful modifier.

I bet I find myself using this a lot since it will fit in most of all my camera bags. It's big enough to put on a stand with a flash for extra lighting. But small enough to have on camera while doing simple portraits or snapping pictures. Very versatile and handy in my opinion. The construction of the softbox itself is far better than I expected for the price.

For the price I can't complain about the flimsy case. If I was buying it for the case I would be disappointed, luckily I did not.

So I've bought other Cowboy Studio products and you have to go into it knowing it won't be the best quality.  Keep in mind the Softbox is tight and rigid and fighting the Flash to stay on.  I think Cutting the Straps to the necessary size for your Flash works best.  I havetwo Yongnuo -580EX Canon, and the straps are way too long to stay secure.

Other than a few minor design flaws, it works for the purpose intended.  In a quick Pinch on camera flash it works pretty good.
Upon opening the two diffusers I purchased I discovered what I could only think must be white mold inside the folded segments of one. Otherwise I might have said this was a good product.

I regularly use small, inexpensive soft boxes on speedlites when traveling, usually for off camera flash, as I find they noticeably improve the resulting picture when shooting portraits from up close.
For years I have used very simple ones that tend to not hold well together and break easily but are otherwise downright cheap to buy ($10 or less), very light and can fit in any pocket of any bag.
Except for travel portrait I also use them for macro photography where stacked-up macro rings eat so much light that you can't really consider going without some additional lighting.
The problem with them in addition to their flimsiness is the lack of double buffering resulting in a somewhat uneven lighting pattern, especially visible when shooting macro, and their size really too small for portrait.

This 9-inch softbox solves these two problems: double buffering produces a very even light field and 9 inches is bigger yet still a manageable size when doing macro or for travel.

The quality of the fabric seems right; the interior is very reflective and the results match my expectations for the price and design.
The lips on the side do a decent job at controlling light spillage and restricting illumination to where you want it.

Now it is not perfect.
It folds to a manageable flat form that can be stored away in a pouch, but the folding is pretty stressful on the frame which is made of a springy wire of a gauge more suitable for soft boxes twice or thrice the size, resulting in a required folding effort too high for the size of the softbox. This results in deformations of the size of the frame on the inner fold once folded, and my questioning of how many folding/unfolding it will withstand.
So far maybe 20 and it works just fine.

Another sticking point is the way the speedlite is attached to it. Its head is to be stuck in the hole at the back of the soft-box, which features an elastic ring of fabric for light tightness (works very reasonably) and two pairs of velcro straps to attach at the back of the head. This means that your speedlite must be folded in the classic "cobra" position, or the straps would slip; and it also means that the actual angle of the soft box on the flash is somewhat haphazard.
This is not necessarily a drama considering you have double-buffering to avoid hot spots on the front buffer, but if you add to that the impetus to rotate the head 90 degrees to a side to expose the sensor used for remote triggering the speedlite (canonistas will know what I mean) it can become somewhat flimsy.
Then of course it remains a small soft box - this is fine for travel portrait or macro but it remains utterly inadequate for your usual fashion shoot.

All in all for the price a good acquisition. It will not take good pictures for you but if you know what you are doing it should help you a lot.

I got my first original RoundFlash 18 months ago.  It worked perfectly (was using it with Canon EOS 60D? and 430EXII flash).  Sadly I lost it on my last month trip to Europe, so decided to buy a cheaper chinese version . Bellow are my observation after circa 5 weeks.

1.  Collapses at times during photo shoot. Seems magnets in the opening mechanism are faulty.
2.  Lamp mounting appears too soft and flimsy. I supposed, another reason for collapsing.
3. Quality of material not so good. Definitely getting less light - can tell after compared my current portraits with the ones taken with the original.
4. China product just feels heavier and  becouse of that more difficult to use.
5. Quality of the craftsmanship not so good either.  Noticed some wear and tear after 4 weeks.  Doubt it will survive a year.

 I decided to buy original Roundflash.  Totally worth a bit extra.  After all you do get what you paid for...
This works great for my gaming lighting set up. Small and portable. Great buy!!

I just purchased this softbox and think it is a decent product. In fact I have the comparable photodiox (8x12") product and this product is much better.. at least the idea is.

It does a great job diffusing and softening the flash and is reasonably small when folded.

It holds on nicely to the flash although mounting it can be a little cumbersome. Also folding it back into the pouch is a little tricky. However, unfortunately it came with a popped open seam at one side.

At that price I am not surprised that there are quality problems which is too bad. The idea is great and it does the job better than other products . I would be willing to pay a little more if the quality was improved.

For only $15, you can't go wrong with this. It has inner and outer diffusion panels for nice soft light and folds flat when you want to travel with it. You can use it off camera with a trigger, or attach it to a hotshoe mounted flash. When used with a shoe mounted flash it works great for macro, giving soft, directional light. Most importantly, it attaches firmly to my Yongnuo flash heads so it doesn't need constant adjusting. Only downside is it's not wide enough to fit my Vivitar 285 with zoom head.

product_title: Ape Case Pro Large Digital SLR and Video Camera Case ACPRO1400
product_description: Perfect For Dslr Video Cameras 35mm More Plenty Of Room For Additional Lenses Flash Accessories 15 Organized Pockets Compartments Configurable compartments Compatible with SLR cameras digital cameras 35mm cameras and mini digital video cameras Exterior Dimensions 14 inch L x 10 5 inch H x 9 0 inch W Interior Dimensions 12 inch L x 9 inch H x 6 0 inch W Lifetime warranty

reviews.review_body:
I’ve had two ape case backpacks for years now that was given to me by another photog and they’re used everyday just about without any signs of wear. So I had plenty of faith to make the jump for a bag that’s been on the market since 2003.
It holds pretty much everything in a compact space that I’d need on a shoot. I highly recommend this bag!
This bag is better and more sturdy than just about anything new on the market. Some of the new kids on the blocks should take note on how to design a camera bag.

I was searching the web for quite some time to find the best bag for my new (at the time) 7D camera and tamron 70-300 lens. After checking different products and carefully going through the comments I decided this was the good bag for me. So I ordered it and actually the product is very well build and I loved the quality. It looks durable and the shoulder slip is very nice. So nothing to say. Lot's of pockets very ergonomic. The pockets can be arranged as one likes but it took me some time to find the best setup.

It is a little bulky though so I had to buy a smaller bag for short trips when I don't need all my material. But now with the flash and a 50mm prime it is starting to get crouded in it.

Overall it is a nice product, we don't see many in our globalized era :(...

We got a new digital SLR and shopped quite a bit for this bag. I can fit:

This camera with a medium lens
a telephoto lens
the digital handicam (it is a smaller one)
the coolpix little digital 35mm in its case
the old film SLR with a medium lens

securely in this bag with all the dividers. Plus extra filters, and assorted junk in all the outer pockets.

...and carry it comfortably.

As others have noted the yellow interior really is a help.

The only thing I would change is that the 3 latches for the top are a little loose, so if you don't zip the bag when you are wanting easy access, when you lift it by the top handle, it always feels insecure. It really isn't (3 latches work fine with a good overlap top to side for protection), but I wish it didn't scare me everytime I lift it.

I have researched camera bags which were very expensive, but they do not hold a candle to this unbelievably affordable APE Case.  It is very versatile, highly functional and extremely protective of all my included equipment from bumps and rain.  I am glad that I took my time during my search.  Almost purchased a $200 bag, but this is the one for me.  I purchased the 1200 and it is really a big bag.  The 1400 would have been too much for my needs.  I recommend this bag to everyone; you will not be disappointed.  If anything changes during the time I own this item, I will be sure to update my experience.

I've been using my Ape case for a couple of months, mostly on trips involving air flights.  The Ape case pro is just about as small as I would like, yet still have plenty of storage for larger items like extra lenses, external flash, lens shades, extra batteries and charger, extra digital media and readers, and still have plenty of zippered pockets for this-that-and-the-other -- but not so many I can't find anything.  I was even able to stow a one-liter water bottle in one of the external mesh bags and attach a collapsible umbrella - if only to put the jinx on the promised rainy weather.  It can even fit in my wheeled carry-on luggage with enough room left over for a couple day's worth of underwear, shaver and toothbrush.  The internal layout is adjustable to your needs with velcro'd dividers.  Nice, sturdy-feeling material.

I got this case for my flash accessories and spare lights. Fits sooo much gear. I have all my Magmod gear, spare flashes, batteries, cold shoes, straps, lens cleaning gear, clamps, cards, water bottle, small tools, random things, and it is still just about half filled. Can fit more gear as I grow my business. The case is made up of quality materials and I am very confident it will last a very long time and keep my gear protected. Other cases have weak and uncomfortable straps but this Ape case strap is durable and comfortable for walking around with my gear.

I purchased 2 of these for xmas presents.  I looked all over the web for something that was comparable to my Tamrack but not nearly that expensive.  I came across this, looked at the specs, read the reviews and decided it was a good value.  Bag 1 carries 2 DSLR bodies, 4 lenses, 3 batteries, charger, cf card wallet, flash, several filters, misc cables and manuals with no problems.  Bag 2 carries 1 dslr body and everything else as above.  Although I wish the lens cutout was left of center, in the long run I can live with that flaw.  Both bags have performed exceptionally well surviving the use and abuse of 2 teens and a trip to Hawaii.  I'll purchase 1 for myself for use when toting the big bag is impractical or prohibitive.  I would highly recommend this bag to anyone looking for an economy camera bag that has room to expand
The bag appears well-made, but the product description is inaccurate.  This is a medium-sized bag.

The Ape case is excellent for my frequent shoots that require me to have multiple cameras and related gear and accessories. I routinely carry the Sony HXR-NX70U and the Nikon D100 SLR in this bag, along with related batteries, remotes, mics, cables, and even a Gorilla-pod.  The bag is roomy and padded, allowing me to stow the camcorder in without removing the microphone assembly.  The inside can be configured to your needs, with velcro padded sections that can be positioned to create the size and shape compartments you need.
The front pocket is large and has numerous holders for batteries, remotes, pens, tools, cleaners, etc. Side pockets are a great place to keep larger items like chargers and power cords.

I take this to a shoot about once a week, and it is a great bag that gets a lot of use.

I've purchased this item (ACPRO1000) on July 31, 2011. One of the reasons I bought this product was the 'built-in retractable water proof weather cover', as I could read on Amazon.com page. But... I could not find the cover. I've called Norazza and they told me that the sentence about the cover is not true, they apologize, etc (!)
Otherwise I can say that this camera case is a good one, a solid one. Unless you would like to buy a camera case having a rain cover, this is a good one for a medium size DSLR with an attached lens and 1-2 lens plus some little thing like filters, battery charger, a cleaning kit, etc.
Cons: the sentence about 'built-in retractable water proof weather cover' is not true, you would not find such a cover.

I was looking for a new case for my Cannon GL2 camcorder, as my case had broken clips on the both straps. After searching for some time, I found this case. The case is great! It fits both my 17" laptop and my camcorder with many accessories. I was very happy that it fit in the overhead bin when I took an airplane trip and the neck strap has a large amount of padding for the long haul between airline terminals. The inside dividers use velcro straps and can be moved to get the camcorder secure and floating within the compartment. The only thing that upset me was the leather hand strap ripped at the sewn seam after the first usage. The hand strap uses to much velcro and is a little hard to open. The construction is very good and the design is great! I would recommend the case and I would buy it again.

Love this bag, like any photographer (hobby only) I have been on a continuous search for the one bag that meets 80%of my needs, this one is it, this bag fits both my cameras with lenses attached plus EVERYTHING else, it is extremely easy to pack this bag beyond a comfortable carry wieght but I learned quickly find a spot for everything I need.... Then when going on a specific hike etc, drop out th gear I WON'T need to cut the wieght back to comfortable depending on the situation, I HIGHLY recommend this bag BECAUSE it Cana carry everything for travel but then easily lose the gear I don't need to take it back down to horlurs of comfortable walking/hiking etc

I was looking for a bag that could house my entire VR setup for portability and was told to check out SLR bags. This bag exceeded all my expectations and almost seems tailor made for my requirements. This bag perfectly fits my HTC Vive (HMD, sensors, cables, chargers, controllers etc) and my 17" laptop (and power block) with just enough room on top for 2 flexible tripods to help set up the sensors depending on the environment. The bag is tough, feels well built and the interchangeable internal dividers means I can isolate items like the sensors so they don't bang around against other items. I am truly amazed at how perfectly everything fits and I can't recommend it enough for this kind of application.

I really like this case. I was skeptical a bit as I've always bought Pelican or Porta Brace cases for my cameras, but I didn't want to drop a lot of money for a new case this time, and I wanted something a little smaller/lighter for run and gun type shoots. If you're looking for a light to medium duty case that has a lot of well placed pockets and is fairly light weight, I'd recommend this case. I use it to store a Panasonic HPX-170 camera and it fits fairly snuggly, but that also helps it from moving around in the case. There is also plenty of room/pockets for P2 cards, laptop, hard drives, headphones and other accessories. If you have a larger camera, just be sure to check the measurements as it could be a close fit width wise.

I purchased this case to carry my Nikon D40, 18-55 Kit lens, 55-200 Nikon VR lens, SB-600 Flash, about 3 filters, and 3 SD memory cards.

Everything was really easy to see inside the case because of the yellow.

I wound up returning the case, because I could not configure the dividers on the inside to hold my camera without taking the lens off. There is one long divider that can separate the case left to right, but there are no pads long enough to separate it top to bottom.  Having to take my lens off to stash the camera away was a nuisance to me.

Held my gear very securely, but I would have to buy another case if I were to expand my equipment selection.

I have a D3 and a D700 w/grip and neither fit well. If I turned either camera sideways with a lens attached in order to center the lens in the bag it worked alright but was a VERY snug fit. I have a 50mm, 12-24mm and 24-70mm and a SB-600; if I fit everything in there (minus the second camera body) it was an uncomfortably tight fit. I planned for this though and ordered the ACPRO1400 alongside it and so far am pleased with it. I'll drop a review on it after using it for a while.

Also, if you want quick access to your camera like they advertise then beware of the 270-degree-zip-open-as-well-as-un-clip-all-three-strap-clips "quickly" when fully closed. And the top sorta folds awkwardly.

Do not mis-read me. I like this case but only for a smaller body like a D90/grip or a full-frame with no grip and perhaps 2 mid to full-size lenses. (D300 w/grip may even be too snug)

PROS: Very nice rugged feel. Rubber feet are solid and everything seems to be built solid. Well made for small to mid-sized DSLR with 2 lenses and a flash. Zippers and compartments out the ying-yang (about 4 separate compartments).

I ordered this case on a Monday and received it Wednesday.  Talk about super service!  Just an awesome case in general.  Great quality, sturdy, lot of space, adjustable dividers, lots of pockets, and has a compartment for a laptop up to 17'' (don't know why people are bitching about it having a laptop compartment- if you don't have a laptop to put in there, then use that space for something else.  I store my handheld and shotgun mic and some cables in that compartment, personally).  I have a Panasonic DVC-80 video camera with three batteries, charger, headphones, and an AC adapter all stored in the main compartment.  I also have some manuals, batteries, and various other items stored within the many pockets and pouches.  Good sturdy shoulder strap with a great non-slip pad that feels great on the shoulder, and comfortable handles to boot.  Fits my needs perfectly, and would buy from Ape Case again.  I'd recommend this to others.

This bag is as described by many previous reviewers. AWESOME!! Currently, it's holding 3 flash guns, 4 lenses-one of which is 70-210mm, the camera body(I chose to dismount all lenses for the best fit), batteries, cords, flash stands, remote trigger/reciever, 2 collaspible lens hoods, gels, etc...until I ran out stuff to stuff it with! The removable compartments are easy to arrange and rearrange (as I'm sure I will do). Quality materials thoughout. I thought the yellow interior was going to be a turn off, but it's not as 'neon' as I had feard. It actually makes locating anything 'black' in that bag a snap! It's not bulky or uncomfortable on my shoulder. It's not so big that it screams-Steal Me! either. We all know that there are pricier bags out there that are probably just slighty (and only slightly) better as far as acutal compartmnets, but for the price of this sweet bag, YOU CANNOT GO WRONG with this purchase!!  :D I'm VERY glad I bought this bag!

Unlike other reviewers I feel this bag is HUGE!!!!  Very well built, highly customizable, and with HUGE room on the high vis yellow interior.
No need to go on with whats great about this bag...everything is great!
I can only think of one con...maybe the shoulder strap...but I like it.  It's not a big deal to me for this inexpensive HUGE bag.
What do I mean by HUGE?
It stores my Pentax K-x, my DA 55-300, Tamron 90mm macro prime, the kit 18-55 DAL, and my plastic fantastic DA 35mm prime, along with sets of batteries, the charger, a couple of polarizer filters, my lens pen, remote, cleaning kit, rocket blower, manual, cards, etc...and I didn't even come close to filling it up!  I have all my stuff in one durable bag with more room for new lenses and flashes and a sandwich if I want...
UNBELIEVABLE bargain for what you get...
Don't hesitate...buy...heck if you don't need massive storage think about the medium or small.

I love this bag. I have done some "modification" like cut some straps off I never use. It's well made and I have a large DSLR and 4 lenses as well as many CF and SD cards and all sorts of accessories. I recommend it highly.

Update: I got this bag in 2010. I have had it for 6 years. It has been great. I use a 7D and carry the camera with a lens attached with 3 other lenses. One lens is a 50mm F/1.8 so it fits under the camera. This bag is highly configurable. It carries all kinds of other stuff like cables, CF, or SD cards, filters, batteries, etc... I would buy this again. Great bag.

With a myriad of camera cases to choose from, this one has proven itself well. It’s not huge (unlike the wearable ones that flip for access to lenses — good concept, but you don’t see many people actually USING them because they’re so big), but it holds enough that you’ll be set for most missions. The medium: one camera body and three lenses (as long as they’re not huge), or two bodies and two lenses. Plus power converters, filter pouches, etc. There are pockets for other things. The bag comes with a lot of sturdy, well-padded dividers that are highly customizable. The bright yellow interior is well-chosen to contrast most black camera equipment. Solid closure devices. Tough. Lightweight. This is a good bag.

This is one of my favorite camera cases ever, and I've plowed through a lot of 'em.

I wanted a home for our media lab's Sony NEX-5r, and have been around long enough to know that it's easy to get fooled by a camera's tiny size into thinking that you only need a tiny case.

This thing safely holds the NEX-5r, four alternate lenses, a shot gun mic, a PCM audio recorder, an LED light, and all the chargers and extra batteries that all of these things require.  Moving the dividers around to make this work was a breeze.

I'll say this:  once you've had a bright-colored interior (yellow, in this case), you can never go back.  If all your little connectors and camera doodads are black, why on earth would you want to put them in a black case?  Nothing can hide in this baby.

I bought both the medium and large Ape cases and I love them.  I am using the large for a Canon G50 video camera with rig, and not only can it easily fit the camera with cage & zoom H5, but it also fits a Blackmagic Video Assist, AC adapters, cables, etc. etc., and I still have plenty of unused pockets.  My one criticism is that while they are very customizable with many dividers, they could do with more velcro on the inside case sides for the dividers to attach to.  Otherwise they are really nicely made cases and I am quite happy with them.  Would definitely purchase again.

I was surprised at how large this case is, in fact is is to large for what I wanted but am using this case anyway. I keep my Nikon 1 J1 with the zoom lense and also a Sony camcorded in it along with all the chargers and cables. It is kinda big to be carrying this on a trip like to a zoo or Disney world. It is well built and the yellow inside helps to see what is there and there are plenty of pockets for extras. I bought a smaller case to put my Nikon and batteries in so I don't have to lug the big case around all day when we stop somewhere. But I think anyone who has a lot of cameras and lenses will love this case. It says small but I would call it a medium size. But for a camera like the Nikon 1 J1 it is a little bit to large for one camera. I will update my review later after I have used it more.

I have had a LowePro camera bag for years, and it did a great job - it is just at the point where it was falling apart. I have a DSLR with a large telephoto and just bought a Macro lens. I want to be able to carry them in a bag along with batteries, cards, etc. There are lots of closing options (zipper and clip) and compartments. I can leave a handbag behind and use the bag for wallet storage and a snack out in the field. The strap is strong and the handle covered in rubber. It is strong, padded and stable. Yes, with the equipment loaded it is heavy - but that is my equipment. A great bag so far.

This case is exactly what I needed to hold my camera gear safely. I added 4 pictures to illustrate what I did.
Picture #1 shows how the inside is divided out-of-the-box. The right side has a lower and upper tier, with the first vertical piece having a cutout for the lens if it is attached to your camera.
Picture #2 shows from left to right what is on the bottom tier
  Canon Vixia HF200 & VL-5 Light
  Canon EF 70-300 F4-5.6 IS USM Lens
  Canon 430EX II Flash
  Canon sunshade for 24-105 4L Lens
Picture #3 simply shows the right side covered with the yellow Velcro attached flaps. I removed one vertical piece from the right side and left side to make my gear fit perfectly.
Picture #4 shows the Canon EOS 70D with 24-105mm 4L lens attached in the upper tier
There is tons of room in the zippered pockets for whatever you need.
This certainly fulfilled my needs.

OK.  I was looking for a bag large enough to carry my STUFF, while remaining organized and secure.  THIS IS IT.  WELL PADDDED and repositionable partitions make it customizable for the way I shoot.  The yellow interior is great.  Makes the camera equipment easier to locate at a glance, and the adequate laptop storage is going to make lugging things onto flights just that much easier.  CAUTION!!!  When repositioning the partitions, please be aware that the velcro is SUPER STRONG and you may need to hire Arnold Swarzenegger to reposition the whole bag.  At least my wife got a laugh out of seeing me struggle!!!

I shoot only stills, and the camera bag is great for holding my Nikon D3000 with a battery pack and lens attached plus much more.  But with just a little thought and effort, I could see it working equally well for video equipment!  Glad I waited untjil I bought this EXCELLENT bag at a fraction of the big-name and big price competitors!

In the end I returned it.

Part of the appeal was it had tripod straps and as it is a large case it seemed like it would hold a reasonably sized tripod.  I couldn't get my tripod on their without lots of work, the straps are not snaps so if you can't slide the tripod in and out from the side it is a huge PITA to put on or off.  It hangs from the bottom awkwardly.

I did like the interior yellow, I thought it worked well.  Padding was solid.

Wasn't in love with the dimensions when actually trying to pack things in as a couple of places you end up with two layers.  I realize that is just life sometimes and would not have been a show stopper.

I ended up going with a backpack (adventure 7, which is smaller camera area but more overall space, adventure 9 is more similar to this in the camera area) for less cost as I basically decided I was always going to end up putting this bag down to get stuff in and out there wasn't a huge point in me killing my back/shoulder for this style of bag.

there are no perfect camera bags. there are bags for occasions. so complaining by some it is not perfect is nonsense, it only shows their lack of planning for photo outings and appreciation of what this bag can do.
having read so many conflicting reports , its too small its too big were of no help.
the "perfect camera bag" has to change with use, so you need to change bag for your needs. ( ask any woman !! they will explain it to you)
This bag is very affordable and very well built.
big enough to use to store a large amount of equipment.
large enough to carry a large amount of heavy equipment if you must bring it all with you
otherwise, the bag is very adaptable to targeted shooting events with enough room for the required equipment,
camera couple of lens, flash, accessories, snack and drink .
you should not require to bring it "all with you"
so this is a solid bargain.
only noticeable lack, is a rain cover

It seems to be a well thought out camera bag,  I like it.  Not too big, Not too small, I have a Mirrorless body, 2 lenses, go pro, insta360 one r, selfie stick, batteries, mounts, cables, pen, pad, tons of filters, map, chargers and can put my travel tripod on the case.  I like this bag so far.

Pros: Very well constructed case, light weight, and very sturdy.  Cons: Case can't hold as much equipment as the manufacturer claims.  The inside of the case can be configured a lot of different ways, but depending on the equipment, it won't hold much.  I have a Canon 60D with 18-135 Zoom attached.  I can squeeze it in, but not much room left.  Only enough room for a couple of small primes and 430EX flash.  One side pocket is a mesh pocket and is best used for holding a water bottle.  The other pocket is good for SD cards, lens cleaning stuff, pens, and a couple of batteries.  There is plenty of space for manuals, maps, train or plane tickets in the cover and a pouch in front for holding thin items.  The hand and shoulder strap are great, and the bag is secure with snaps on each side of the lid and the front.  Ape Case products are of excellent construction, just don't expect to put the kitchen sink in this Medium case.  You may want to go with the next size up, although the internal specs look to be about the same in the large and medium.

I bought this for my guitar rig. I have a Kemper profiling amp and a foot controller, as well as cables and in ears that all go in this. It all fits, but is fairly snug. I love the extra dividers that Velcro in place. I use them on top of the Kemper, between it and my foot controller. Works great. I’ve only had it maybe three months, using once a week, and the handles are starting to tear. So I’m not sure how well the build quality will hold up over time. But it’s good for light transportation for now. The whole rig is surprisingly heavy too.

Just just perfect for what I required , way way better than I had ever expecte ,  built quality is just excellent ,exceeded my expectations,, delivery was spot on , this is a top top product and if all their products are like this bag then we'll this is a first class manufacturer.

I searched and searched and searched everywhere for such a bag , of this size , this design , this brilliant built quality and I just could not find it anywhere , till I came across these guys, they for sure know what they are doing and understand the needs of photographers and a lot more.

I must mention that the price at $78 was very very reasonable for this size, this quality,,, amazing va,he for money ,,,and free delivery ,, what more can anyone ask for !!!!!

I highly recommend them ,,, buy from them, their  products are better than first class for the cost

I recently bought my first Digital SLR, considered an entry level Camera, and wanted to make sure I paired it with a Case that would be both functional and practical. My search on Amazon, and retail stores in my area, only offered either compact or huge backpack / luggage designs.

Imagine my joy when I finally found Ape Case, their selection is here http://www.amazon.com/s/ref=bl_sr_photo?ie=UTF8&field-brandtextbin=Ape+Case&node=502394 and decided on the ACPRO1000.

The ACPRO1000 is light and strong, with velcro secured panels inside, which can be rearranged to best fit your Camera/s, Lenses, Adapter Tubes, etc. Do take note there will be gaps below each of the velcro secured panels inside, so all the smaller items like your Batteries, Flash Memory Cards, USB Cables, etc., must be kept in the other zip secured net panel inside, or the two zip secured panels at the front of the Case.

I highly recommend Ape Case, particularly the ACPRO1000, because it is really a Great Case for those who are looking for something both functional and practical to keep their Camera and Equipment safe and secure.

Let me preface this by saying that I am not a professional photographer, but I do use my DSLR for business to take some product photos as well as the typical vacation/recreational uses. My camera is in use at least a couple of days a week.

I have been looking for a replacement case to the basic Nikon bag that came with my camera. As I have acquired more lenses and a flash, it was becoming increasingly difficult to fit everything in the camera bag, much less feel like they were well protected.

From the moment I opened it, I knew that I had found what I was looking for: A case big enough to hold my gear and protect it from life's little mishaps. It's refreshing to find a product that is so well thought out.

Like most photographers I carry two cameras, multiple lenses, flashes, batteries, chargers, filters, and various other little things.  I enjoy the pockets and compartments on the Ape Case and the yellow interior really does help spot things in less that perfect lighting.  Being able to move the dividers in the main compartment is brilliant and endlessly useful.

This bad is a weird size for me, however.  It's not big enough for all my gear but it is too big to take out for casual shooting.  I would like to fit both camera bodies and my monster Canon L series lenses in the bag but wind up prioritizing what I will need and removing stuff or packing lenses separately in their own cases.  Neither is ideal and I need to find a larger bag.

For someone with only one camera body or moderately sized lenses this bag is the bee's knees.

Man, this is a good case. Everyone I show it to loves it. It also is not labeled CANON or "EXPENSIVE CAMERA" like most of the other ones are.

The yellow interior is awesome. Easy to find dropped in items - this is the only case with that handy feature.

As with some of the other reviews, two problems:
1. I wish I would've bought a bigger case. I have the Canon XSi with battery grip, three or four lenses I like to lug around and a Speedlite flash - they fit all very well, but I wish I had a little extra room anyway.
2. The aforementioned straps on the side really get in the way of the zipper. As ALSO mentioned in previous reviews, I cut them off first day and was quite pleased.

All in all, this is a fantastic bag. The fact that it costs less than $50 is just insane. I'd recommend this highly to anyone, and my next case will be an Ape Case as well when I need to replace this one years from now.

I bought this case for my Canon DSLR Camera with 3 separate lenses and my Panasonic HD-TM90 Camcorder.  Not only could I EASILY carry all that, I am also able to carry around separate batteries for both the camcorder and the DSLR camera.  I also was able to carry the charger for both as well.  Plus I still have LOADS of room to carry other stuff.  I bought this and then a few months later used it for a 7 day Disney World vacation which I just finished.  This case was great.  It has a bright yellow inside which made it EASY for the security at Disney to check my bag. It has a wonderful strap which made it easy to carry around Disney.  Even my 12 yr. old son said it was easy to carry around.  It also has a hard/firm bottom and it feels like it is padded so that if it fell off the table or something, my camera would not be harmed.  Bottom line.  It is durable and comfortable at the same time.  I LOVE IT!

I love the interior of this bag and all of the pockets. Every divider and pocket in this bag is useful and has it's own purpose. There's not too much of any one feature, allowing you to pack in everything you need. For this reason I do like this bag a lot. I do have to complain, after about one year of heavy use flying around the country on different projects, that the build quality is somewhat lacking. After about two trips, the leather/velcro strap on the handles ripped apart. The handles are still intact though. Also in some places the stitching is now pulling apart; not badly, but it makes me worry. Other than that it's holding up okay. For the price, it's doing a good job. There aren't many bags on the market like this one, so your options are limited, especially in this price range. I'd buy it again.

This is a very well made case and for the money the best choice you could make for smaller formats, The "Medium" ended up being much larger than I had anticipated, but will work fine for a Micro/Four Thirds body with lens attached, additional lenses, flash and accessories. It is Not big enough however, for my full frame Canon with lens unless that is the only thing you put into the bag after removing all of the dividers. It has numerous pockets, dividers and velcro lined for a variety of different configurations, but I don't like all of the clips on the top and sides that have to be undone to get inside. There is a zipper on the front that would have been ideal for quick access without divulging what's inside the bag, but unfortunately this is not available. Otherwise, I think this will serve me well for many years.

Should I save a few dollars and buy the medium case, or should I go for the large?  Decided on the large and am very happy with the choice.  I am able to carry my DSLR with 300mm lens and sun hood attached with easy accessibility.  Beneath this, there is plenty of space for additional lenses, batteries, etc.  The front pocket works well for my filter collection.

The non slip shoulder strap works well and I have never felt in danger of losing it.

The exterior seems tough, but only time will tell there.  Zips and fittings all seem robust and should be good for the long haul.  Padding is dense and well located and I expect it to do the job fine if I ever have the misfortune to drop the bag.

All in all, very pleased with the purchase and look forward to many years of solid service.

The Ape Case Pro Large Digital SLR and Video Camera Case (ACPRO1400) is an excellently made, well-padded, highly configurable camera case.  I don't use SLR's, but this case is very internally configurable and the size is comfortably large enough to put in a Sony Cyber-shot RX10 , a Nikon Coolpix P900, and a Panasonic DMC-FZ 70, which are all rather large point-and-shoot cameras.  Plus enough room to carry all their batteries, chargers and accessories.  You probably could throw in a Sony RX100, too, with room to spare.  It has one large front zippered pocket, one smaller front zippered pocket and on good sized side zippered pocket.  This is enough for me to carry my filters, cleaning cloths and SD card case.  So, I am very happy that I can safely organize everything to go; as it just did on our trip to Niagara Falls and Acadia National Park. Great case!

I have a D3100 with the 18-55 lens plus the 55-300 lens and it all fits perfectly in this case.  There is still room left for a flash or another lens.  I like the fact that you can customize the inside to how you want it.  There are several pieces to use.  I really like the shoulder strap b/c it is nice and cushioned and makes it easy to carry.  One of the main reasons I chose this case is b/c it zips.  It also has buckles that you can use for easier access if you don't want to use the zipper.  There are plenty of extra pockets for other things such as batteries, chargers, SD cards, etc.  I also like the straps on the bottom front for a tripod!  The yellow color inside the bag makes it easy to see things in there.  I just LOVE this camera case!  It is very well made and seems to be very safe and cushioned for my camera.  It also seems that it will keep dirt and dust out fairly well.  I totally recommend it to anyone that has a DSLR camera.

By the time I found this case on Amazon, I was becoming frustrated by the selection of cases available from other sources. The relatively few cases that were the style and size that I wanted were simply too expensive for my budget.  I was happy to see this case at this price, and even more excited when I arranged the dividers and saw that it would store all of my camera equipment, with room to spare.  I'm  using the case to store/carry my Nikon D60 w. lens attached, 2 other lenses (my longest lens, a 70-300, can be stored on the camera, and the "kit lenses"  still store easily),2 lens hoods, my battery charger and cord, an extra battery, my sb400 flash, several filters, a spare memory card, a remote for the camera, and  a cleaning cloth.  With minimal reconfiguration, I'm sure the case would also hold a larger flash and one more lens.  I haven't had the case long enough to speak definitively to it's durability, but it seems really well constructed.  Overall, I'm extremely satisfied with this purchase.

This bag is exactly what I wanted. It has a ton of compartments and pockets. The flexibility and quantity of dividers in the main compartment is great. I "explored my options" (played with, while my wife rolled her eyes), arranging the dividers to fit my specific gear. I carry a Canon Rebel (with a short lens), my zoom lens, large external flash, small flash (backup), gary fong puffer(knockoff, which works great and is lots cheaper), gary fong cloud diffuser with all three covers (knockoff, which works great and is lots cheaper), batteries, and shutter release... all just in the main hull. I still have an extra space under the camera. I really like the dividers that hold up the camera, which gives a "secret" compartment underneath. It has a great mesh pocket for a water bottle on one side and a small gear pocket that is good for pens, memory cards, batteries on the other side. The side and front pockets are thinner than I would want, but sufficient for my needs. My one year old has tested its durability, climbing all over it and rolling it around a bit. Once I configured the dividers to my specific gear, I was in love. Great bag, great price!

I received this from Amazon and have been using it for a few weeks. The case its self has a great, sturdy shape with lots of cushion for protection. There are also many pockets to put additional items like a charger or filters. The bag is perfect with one body and two lenses but an additional lens could fit if you rearrange the pockets. the main storage compartment has Velcro walls so you can configure the bag how ever it suits your needs. While this is convenient, its difficult to move the walls without getting them stuck because there is velcro everywhere. Where there is no velcro, there's yellow nylon which feels cheap to me. Those are my only two complaints about the bag. It is very sturdy with a great shape and if you only need to take a camera body and a few lenses and want it to hold a phone or personal items than I would suggest this bag.

I'm an event photographer and this ACPRO1600 is my third Ape Case bag. I purchased this one for my backup camera where I also store my audio equipment for videos (wireless mic, field recorder, and cables). I like to store my camera with a 200mm prime and a shoulder strap attached to it. I also had room for a 24-105mm zoom and a 50mm prime, plus a battery grip, charger, 4 batteries, flash trigger. Instead of a laptop, I used that spaces for 2 clear bags where I store all sorts of audio cables to connect my recorder to the DJ console at the events. It really is very customizable. Other reviews already mention how sturdy and well made this bag is. I highly recommend Ape Case regardless of which size you choose. They last many years of high-paced professional work.

I really like this Ape Case. It is just great for my Canon Rebel XSi and the two lenses, Flash 430EX 2 and other assorted gear I have put into it. The construction is second to none and the versatility of the adjustable compartments makes all the difference. I will be able to carry this size bag and not be overloaded by any means. I kept my smaller bag for quick trips about my home area and will be using the medium Ape Case for weekend jaunts when I may require more of my gear at hand.
I'm a photo enthusiast and would recommend this Ape Case to anyone wishing to expand past their starter bag they probably got with or bought with a digital camera.
I would like to see a small change with this size case that could allow for a 10in tablet to be packed along and not lose any space for the camera gear.

I must have looked at forty different camera bags - in-person and online - before finding this one. I'm so glad I didn't settle for one of the others.

This is the ideal bag for what I wanted. It's rugged and very, very well-padded. The dividers are sturdy and have just the right range of adjustability, but without the entire interior being made of the cheap microfiber on the inside of so many cases. The form factor is just right for carrying a D3300 with the 17-55 lens attached, an additional 55-300 lens, a full-size flash, multiple batteries, a charger, misc. whatnot, and there's still room for an additional large lens (plus more whatnot under the camera battery). There are pockets and organizers galore, and tripod straps along the front. Finally, the build quality is excellent. I expect this bag to last me through many grand adventures.

In my opinion, Ape Case has built the perfect camera bag. It has everything I could want, and nothing I don't need.

Love it, love it, love it.  Used for travel from NYC to Hawaii and back in 2010.  Carried still Olympus digital camera, Hitachi video camera, Garmin GPS, binoculars, chargers and wires and recording media needed for all items.  Still had room in bag for personal items that didn't fit in suitcase.  Medium bag just huge and can "configure" into compartments with provided padded separators and the velcro really catches and holds fast.  Loved the bright yellow inside which made it easier to see the black camera bodies.  Very well made, protective bag.  Best purchase for my electronics I ever made.  Have since used it for other travel Mexico 2011 and 2012 and changed what I carried - still lots of room and protection for everything inside.  Audio recorders Sony Mini-Diac and Zoom H-4, add on Toshiba Multi Drive for my netbook, headphones, batteries and chargers still lots of room. Still Love it.  Yeah - don't get the two "clips" on the bottom edge on either side of the bag - but  just leave them folded up.  Maybe someday I'll use/figure out what they are there for.

What a fantastic camera bag!
The build quality is extremely good - and for the price, this is difficult to beat.
The main compartment has several velcro dividers that you can easily reposition/adjust to fit your gear nice and comfortably. I'm able to fit my Nikon D90 with battery grip and 35mm lens (attached), 3 additional lenses, my SB-910 speedlight kit, a Joby camera strap, and charger. That's just in the main compartment. The other zippered compartments hold various items like extra batteries, flash cards, manuals, cleaning kits, cable releases, etc.

The bag also has straps for a small tripod/light stand. The shoulder strap has swiveling clips, which helps to keep the strap untwisted. There are rubber feet on the bottom of the bag which is nice to keep the bottom off the floor and keep your equipment safe.

Overall, this bag is great and compact - but well organized to hold lots of gear. The yellow interior is a nice aesthetic touch that is also functional - It provides contrast so you can easily SEE your gear.

I had a Canon backpack case before this one, it was great, but now that I have a few lenses, I needed more space.  This case solved a lot of problems.  I fit my EOS 40D with lens, two additional big lenses, my speedlite, all my memory stuff, filters, cleaning cloths, even my ipod and cable, cell phone...everything.  I carry it with me wherever I go and the shoulder strap is very comfortable.  The construction is very solid and secure.  Even if you drop it, there is enough padding so you don't have to worry.  You'll be amazed at all the pockets it has, so much so, you may forget where you put something if you're not careful.

UPDATE AUGUST 10th, 2009:  This case is still awesome, has held together well with one exception:  one of the brackets that holds the shoulder strap to the bag body has come untied twice and resulted in a dropped bag.  Thankfully it only dropped 2-3 feet and the padding inside protected everything well.  Something to keep an eye on, but I still love the storage and padding in this bag.

I bought this to allow me to hold two DSLR bodies with lenses mounted (one wide, one 70-200 2.8) plus a couple extra lenses. That is not much of a challenge for this bag! Turns out it can hold a lot more! I am able to have a Canon 6D with a 24-70 or 15-30 plus my 7Dii with a 100-400 both mounted and available on the top layer (longer lens mounted vertically) plus my 70-200, 15-30, 85 1.8 and 50 1.8, plus a speedlight, filters, batteries and remote flash and shutter triggers. When I'm just shooting long, it can hold a mounted 300 2.8, 150-600, 70-200 and a spare body or short prime. The only limitation is my tolerance for carrying all that weight.
The only thing missing is a tripod solution. It would be nice to be able to mount one on the bag.
I'm still thrilled with my purchase. Would buy it again.

I'm in agreement with all the positive reviews on this case; it's well constructed, holds two cameras plus 5 other lenses and the usual accessories photographers need to have with them.  For me, the metal zippers are a huge plus, because the nylon zippers limit the useful life of any bag, no matter how expensive.  We all know that we tend to stuff more in to our bags than we really need, so when I can rely on the zippers staying intact, I can always put up with a torn seam or two.

A broken zipper means one thing...dust.  The yellow interior is fantastic as everything is visible right down to the bottom of the bag.  Ape makes a bag one size larger than this one, which I will get for my medium format film cameras...they are really that good.

I bought this case to store and carry my Nikon D5000, lenses, and flash.  After five months of use--including two vacations and plane trips--I couldn't be happier with my purchase.  Although this case is relatively compact, it's interior design, with removable and repositionable walls and separators makes this a case that can carry a surprising amount of stuff.
