I keep my lenses in the OP/TECH cases inside a Pelican case (with foam removed) - best option I have found yet for equipment storage. You can drop this setup off a building or drop it in the lake and your equipment's safe.
Purchased  the Manual size for my EX2s and XF27 lens; a perfect fit. Great for a little protection and carrying in a bag without any bulk.

Bingo, finally.
After trying two other camera body pouches, the OP/TECH USA Soft Pouch Body Cover - Af-Pro fits the Nikon D500 and D810 camera bodies. Other body pouches were too small or very tight fitting. This pouch will help assure safe packing of my camera body when packed for travel. I plan to purchase a another OP/TECH USA Soft Pouch Body Cover - Af-Pro so I have one for each camera body.

MADE IN USA with great quality.  Stitches are nicely done and feel solid in hand.  Virtually identical in material feel with LensCoat.
Size wise, this seems to be your only option if you are using a compact body with grip.  Fit my Canon 760D / T6S body with BG-E18 fine.
 Material is elastic so should fit a wide range of gear.
2 snap closures on bottom of pouch to keep the pouch closed.  However, these 2 snap buttons are not hidden, so they grind against the bottom of your camera leaving scratch marks.  Weird enough they have protection flap outside to prevent scratching other things.
Also, these buttons are near impossible to close with 1 hand - the hook and loop closure of LensCoat body pouch work much better.
Ok for a small DSLR body (like a Pentax K-30) but doesn't work on bigger bodies.

Using this to throw my X100T into a bag--not using a hood or filter, just the lenscap, and the fit is near-exact. Make sure that you get the SLR/Rangefinder Manual, NOT the D(igital)-Compact.

If, however, you want to have a cover that fits the X-Pro, or an X100-series camera with the lens hood or one of the TCs on the camera, you may want to look at the "Rangefinder" pouch instead: http://www.amazon.com/OP-TECH-USA-Pouch-Rangefinder/dp/B00009R9BP

This fits the Fuji X100T perfectly, but t's a precise fit, with no room for lens hood or convertor lenses. This really helps when you want to leave your X100 in a backpack, or bag, with other items. It protects it from minor bumps and scratches.

I gave it 4 stars for the product as it is made very well.  Had it fit my camera I would have been thrilled.  I went to their website & chose the product designed for my camera and it is way too small.  I am returning.

I've been looking for a cover for my Nikon Coolpix P7700 for those times when I just want to put it in my purse, or tote bag, and need to protect it. Until I discovered the OP/TECH USA Soft Pouch Body Cover, I had no choice but to carry a camera bag.  The neoprene cover even fits with the lens hood that I have on my camera. It closes with two snaps, so I don't have to worry about a Velcro closure not holding. When I'm taking pix, I snap the cover onto my camera strap and it stays just fine!  I'm very pleased with this product and would not hesitate to purchase other OP/TECH products.

Just I wanted for my leica summicron 50mm last version (not the asph one). Original cap is bad as it has a sun shade for pull out. So it clips inside. So it often fells of. This one is perfect replacement.

Used for Fluke Ti55 Thermal Camera. Has loop for attachment. Seems Identical to OEM supplied unit.

Please please please please, change your photo. I bought 4 of these for a very specific reason. I wanted the flat surface with the indent so I can put stickers in the center for labeling the lenses without them getting scratched. The ones you actually ship do not have that and have a texture across the top which makes it very difficult to put labels on. And because there is no indent or embossed center, the label is easily scratched.
I knew something felt familiar as I looked through my purchase history and was burned by these in the past. Change the photo or actually start selling what you are showing.

After reading the reviews I was wary about getting the sizing right, but I measured 70mm across the diameter of the lens head and the 70mm cap fit perfectly over my Canon EFS 17-85mm lens, which also has a Tiffen 67mm Wide Angle UV protector.

I love my Canon EF 16-24mm f/2.8L lens with the thin B+W 82mm Slim-Line Kaesemann Circular Polarizer with Multi-Resistant Coating, however, the fact that the B+W lens cap, or any other one I could find would never stay on it, frustrated me a lot.  Just think of having a $300 filter with no way to protect it.  I was using plastic bags, leaving the hood on, etc.  No luck. UNTIL I found this lens cap.  Works great !
Works well on my 72mm Tiffen variable ND filter...it does tend to slip off sometimes when I pull it out of my bag, but overall it's what I expected.
I bought this to go on  pair of Celestron 7x 50 binoculars. It fits well and does the job.

Works fabulously! Stays in place. It is a little tricky to remove when hood is in place, but I have weak nails, so maybe it's just me. Followed another reviewer's advice and ordered the 85mm for an 82mm lens. (Canon 16-35mm L 2.8 II with B+W slim filter). Fits perfectly! Buy this cap! Don't hesitate. If you need a cap for a slim filter, this is the one!

I have a Tiffen Variable ND filter that attaches to 77mm front threads. The front of this filter because it’s a variable neutral density filter and not a standard ND makes it larger. Because of that all my normal caps do not fit. I bought this hoping it would and it’s a perfect fit!

But does the job of protecting my Sony RX 100 3 camera lens...and the blades that close over the lens....automatically, but can get dirt etc. on them without extra protection....according to blog reports of problems.....

I'm afraid I have a tendency to lose lens caps.  So I usually have several of the same size around.  I use thin-mount lens filters which prohibit the normal lens caps one receives when ordering a lens.  Push-on caps are the way to go.  This particular brand of cap is great because the sides are deep, which in turn means that the cap will stay on the lens rather than falling off (which often happens with a couple of other brands I use).

If you need a push-on cap, this is a great brand and reasonably priced.

The 85mm fits the K&F Concept 77mm ultra slim ND2-ND400 fader variable neutral density lens filter. The filter wouldn't hold a standard "pinch" lens cap and I don't want to have to store the filter whenever it wasn't in use. Luckily I found this cap. It fits well and stays on. Seems to be well made (Made in Germany).

Originally ordered and tried the 58MM for my Canon G5X Mark II.  It DOES NOT work.  It just falls off.
Measured the lens ring with a micrometer, it is 56.134mm in diameter.  Reordered the 56MM and it works very well for me.

Good product for protecting the built in blades on the lens while camera is in a case.
The one thing i would want to change... it has a texture at the top and i would perfer it being smooth so i could add a sticker to the top of the lens displaying info. That aside this is perfect!

it was nice to find a replacement cap for a pair of binoculars. The size matched the lens and the cap is a snug fit. The shipping time was fine. It's interesting to see how the price of a small amount of plastic pellets was raised as the cap was molded, shipped, stored, and shipped again. But it was worth it.

As another reviewer mentioned, this will not fit a Sony RX-100M6 until you grind off just a little bit inside the cover ring.  I don't believe it was advertised to fit the Sony, and it certainly isn't a lot of work to modify it.

Product description specifically says "Diameters are the inside dimensions of the lens cap. This corresponds with the outside diameter of the lens (or filter) which is covered with the lens cap."

Well, that's just not true.  I ordered 37&46mm sizes.  The 37's showed up first, and the outside diameter of the cap is the same as the filter, not the inside.  So it simply cannot be made to go over the filter.  Period.  I contacted the seller through Amazon and never heard back.

I was still waiting for the 46's and assumed I had an odd lot defect as they were so grossly off base.  But the 46's were only marginally better. It takes so much pressure to make them fit, that I fear a slip of the thumb would actually break the glass in the filters.

In that the seller was silent on my return request, I even tried cutting slots in the perimeter to loosen up the 37's.  They are in the trash now.

The 46's will go on, but are so tight they force themselves off in only a few minutes.

Worthless product, and no response from the vendor.  So $50 for two sets of each shot....

I recently purchased an antique surveyors transit that came in missing a lens cover.  The scope has an outside diameter of 47.80 mm measured with my Mitutoyo caliper.  I ordered the 48 mm cover and it fits perfectly plus it's made in Germany!
P.S. if you need to measure things accurately check out Mitutoyo calipers-mine is model CD-6" ASX-manufactured in Japan.  A first class caliper that feels great in your hand and makes you want to measure things.

Hint: it's not because you're rich. It's because metal slip-on caps get knocked off your lens, and pinch type caps are equally ineffective at staying on. This Kaiser product - similar to a jar lid - holds tightly and comes off with a little bit of suction. This means that if you stick, say, a capped Fuji X100 in your pocket, the lens cap will stay on and seal out pocket lint. One other benefit of the Kaiser product is the little plastic loop so that you can tie a lanyard between the cap and the camera. Order a size 2mm biggr than your filter thread - so a 49mm lens or filter generally takes a 51mm cap.

Perfect for the Canon G7x Mk 2.  I've been concerned about the weak lens shutter on the camera and a survey of the forums on the internet indicate that this an issue.  The lens opening is quite large and probably this compounds the weakness in the mechanism.  Everyone suggests this lens cap as the best solution as it offers protection and prevents dust from getting in.  Just be careful not to turn on the camera with the cap on, as it fits snugly and may damage the lens extending mechanism.

I needed a lens cap for the Hoya Variable Neutral Density filter I have. The filter is a 62mm. I bought a regular lens cap but it wouldn't clip into the filter, and the filter was about $80 so I didn't want to leave it unprotected. This cap works perfectly. I wasn't sure about the size, but it fits the 62mm filter just right.

Fits great on my Cannon G7X MK II and seems durable.  I would like a loop on the edge where I could add a lanyard to make it hang off the camera when I removed it.  That would take my rating to 5 stars.
Used on binoculars.  Had lost a lens cap Bit of a struggle to get it on but OK now.  Does protect the lens
Fits perfectly on my Canon 200mm f2 Lens.

I think the crappy retracting lens diaphragm on Canon G7x has made this little Kaiser lens cap a popular necessity. I can't believe I paid this much for a piece of plastic, but you know what, it keeps the lens clean (I removed the blades on the camera due to them repeatedly getting bent and not opening or closing all the way when powering the camera on or off).
Product does not come with a lanyard anchor, unless it was broken off during shipment. Also the sizing isn't what was expected. The lens cap fits loosely, not snuggly as it should.

I bought this to replace squeeze-type lens cover.. I fit over thin polarizer perfect ..  Definitely the way to go. If I had used measurements I would have bought the wrong size.  Filter size +2mm worked for me...

Can't say that it "fits" a Sony RX100 vii.  I managed to force the cap on and I'm hoping the cap will expand a little. Easy enough to remove the cap.  I think it will work to keep objects from poking into the lens.  A bit over priced.

Edit:  I gave up on the 55mm cap and bought the 56mm size. Didn't know they offered different sizes but I found it.  The 56mm cap works very well for my Sony RX100 vii.

Although this item is surely overpriced, it does provide nicely for the option to leave your filter on a slim style lens filter without having to worry about damage to filter.  Four stars  due to price, but is marked to be made in Germany.  Be sure to purchase the 85mm size for the 82 as recommended by another reviewer.

It actually split a little on the edge when I pushed it on, so you might try a 55mm. Better yet, order both and try the 55mm first  and if its loose, you know the 54 will fit tightly. I bought this after my lens jammed. I was able to repair it  by googling  camera lens repair and slightly and carefully prying my lens cover my with a needle. Hopefully this will prevent it from happening again.

Bought this for my Canon SX720 HS.
I have had problems with the fragile built in lens cover easily getting damaged if something is next to it in your pocket.
This cover fits snugly, just right.

The Hoya ULTRA Super Slim Ring filters don't offer front threads, minimizing vignetting (why did Hoya stop making these?) on WA lenses.  Thererfore, use of a standard lens caps designed to attach to front filter threads isn't an option.

Measured my filter OD with a digital caliper to confirm the Kaiser 70mm and 80mm caps would correctly fit, respectively.  Removed my Hoya included rubber caps, installed the Kaiser caps, and they fit perfectly; much better than the Hoya rubber cap.

Key step is to actually measure your lens filter's actual OD.  Good quality.

Bought this as a replacement cap for my Olympus FCON-T01 Fisheye lens.  I lost my Olympus lens cap while hiking.  After trying to get a replacement cap for my fisheye, I discovered that Olympus does not sell a replacement cap and the large 65mm accessory lens for the Olympus TG-1, TG-2 and TG-3 rugged cameras.  So, this was the best I could find at 67mm to serve as a replacement.  It is too large for the Olympus fisheye lens, however, I modified the cap by molding strips of electrical tape around the edges of the cap at 4 corners and building up the thickness by a couple millimeters so that the cap actually fits snugger and more securely on the lens than the original OEM cap.  Otherwise, its just a plastic lens cap like the original.  Cheap and does what its supposed to, protect the glass of a very cool little accessory lens for my Olympus TG-1.

I bought 57mm lens cap to replace the original 57mm one on my Yashica Super 8 camera which wouldn't stay on. The camera has a 55mm built-in lens and a haze filter attached. This replacement cap fits very snug, snug enough that I can unscrew the filter attachment with it on. Personally, I like it that snug because most original Super 8 camera bags don't have a lot of extra room, so it's easy to knock off the lens cap when taking the camera in and out of the bag, especially if you've got a filter on the lens. The snug fit and the fact that this is slimmer than the original cap completely solves that problem. I also like that this has a lanyard attachment. Definitely recommend as a replacement.
Fit perfectly.
Worked fine on my telescope.

This push-on lens cap fits PERFECTLY on my Panasonic Lumix DMC-TZ5 camera, after the retracting lens diaphragm got stuck open, with the lens uncovered. I already have a lanyard which would have worked if there was an eyelet to thread it through, but--despite one of the reviews for this cap saying it "doesn't come with a lanyard, only an eye for a lanyard"--there is NO eyelet hole to attach a lanyard. Now I have to wait for the stick-on lens cap lanyard I just ordered, so I don't lose the cap. I gave it one less star for not having a way to attach a lanyard--and because it was so expensive for a simple molded piece of plastic. But it's a really good lens cap that won't come off until I want it to.

Not sure why I messed with the pinch style lens caps for so long, but these are amazing. I bought one each for a Zeiss 35 f2.8 and the Zeiss 50 f2.8, measuring to the outside ring. The fit is snug but just enough to keep them from slipping off.

After the lens cover blades on my Canon G7x mk ii were irreparably damaged during routine operation, I removed the blades, measured the diameter of the control dial, came up with 58.25mm, and found my way to this item, and immediately saw that its reviews were full of people in the exact same situation as myself.

This lens cover fits snugly and securely over the camera's lens in its closed/powered off position.  Its color and texture matches the camera body well enough that it looks like it was meant to be there.

Only flaw-- item description states that it comes with a tether anchor, to allow the cap to be tethered to the camera body.  The item I received has no connection point for a tether.  If you are so inclined, you can resolve this by poking a small hole in the lens cover to thread a tether to, but this results in the whole arrangement losing a bit of its tidy appearance.

So I followed the advice here and ordered a cap 2mm larger than the filter size.  Unfortunately this advice proved to be flawed. The 54mm cap does not fit my Fujinon XF 18mm f2 lens (which uses a 52mm filter).  The Fujinon lenses have a bayonet mount lens shade and there is a ridge on the outside of the lens barrel for the mount.  I intend to reorder after I take a measurement of the lens barrel (hopefully I can get that right without calipers).

Otherwise I like the feel of the lens cap.  Since it is plastic I believe that it will stay on the lens.  This will be a major improvement over the pinch type caps that Fujifilm sells with their XF lenses.  I will update my review when I get the right sized cover.

One other item, if you change to this style of cap, you will no longer be able to store your lens shade on your lens if it has a bayonet style mount on the barrel.

I chose this product for my telescope, as I have misplaced its original lens.  It is top quality.  I needed advice for the fit and called customer service.  I will say that this company has one of the top rated customer service departments on all of Amazon.  They answered promptly, the representative was knowledgeable and communicated easily, polite and informative.  He helped me remedy my issue in a matter of minutes.  Products arrive before scheduled date, well wrapped and in perfect condition.
I strongly recommend if you you are looking for photo or video supplies you purchase from A&R Photo Video.  I am very pleased with them and will surely order from them again.
Careful of the sizes you purchase, (for example) this 85mm cap fits my sigma 24-70mm DG DN lens perfectly which originally have a 82mm filter thread, so you have to buy 2 or 3 sizes up.

I hike with my camera, so usually a pocket size point and shoot. It's dusty, so after a few years I have to replace my cameras because dust gets inside the lens. This is mostly an issue shooting into the sun. I just got a new camera, so I'm going to try keeping a cap over the lens, even though it has a leaf lens cover. This 60mm cover fits my Lumix zs570 perfectly. Doesn't come with a lanyard, so I had to make one, shipping was very slow despite the exorbitant shipping charge, but if this keeps the dust out, I'll be happy.

Fits well and doesn't fall off like pinch-type caps, but there are two problems.

First and most obvious, they are horribly over-priced.  It's a simple plastic molding and ought to cost about three bucks.

Second, and more serious, their sizing is completely non-standard.  As far as I know, in 30 years of experience, all other lenscaps are sized like filters.  That is, a lens that takes 49mm filters usually takes a 49mm cap.  NOT SO WITH THESE!  On these Kaiser caps, the size is the inside diameter of the cap, so that, for instance, Pentax film lenses that take 49mm filters need a 51mm Kaiser cap.  Presumably Nikon lenses that take 52mm filters will need a 54mm Kaiser cap. In general, try a size about 2mm bigger than the filter size of the lens. You want the outside diameter of your lens, NOT the filter size.

There are so many complaints here about customers having gotten the wrong size that you would think the seller would want to make this more clear.

Anyway, I got the right size on the second try, and the caps work well, but I won't be buying any more at the current price.
Need it for 52mm threads, ordered 51mm on the advice of another review and it is a perfect fit.

I bought a Sandmarc 58 mm lens for my iPhone 15 Pro Max and a set of hybrid PL/ND filters that fasten onto the lens. I needed a lens cap to put over filter when I carry the assembled parts in a bag. This 63mm cap does the job. The reason I didn't give it five stars is because a bit expensive for a simple piece of plastic.

The original lens cap would slide off in my bag. This slip on/ push on cap is the perfect solution. I will buy 2 more for my other lenses.

Note really. Measure your diameter of the filter/lens before buying. It’s better to go 1mm smaller. I called B&H for support before purchasing this unit. It’s worth every penny.
Bad company, bad product and bad service. I ordered two lense caps both were the wrong item and I called them and they said I could not return.

I bought this item for an old lens that doesn’t have filter threads for a snap on cap. Comes in any size you could possibly need. Fits perfectly and the quality is very good for a slip on cap. If you’re having trouble deciding between this and a more expensive product like the B+W this one is totally sufficient. I can’t see any reason to drop the extra cash.

This provides a nice tight fit for the front lens of the Instax mini Evo camera. Just be careful when pulling it off as it’s pretty tight and if not careful could maybe pull something off. But protects lens which I was looking for as I will be traveling internationally with it.

These lens caps are very good quality, better than the original Minolta caps that came with the binoculars.  Well-fitting, good materials, and I like the loops for attaching a strap so you don't inadvertently lose them in the field.

product_title: Fotodiox Lens Mount Adapter Compatible with Canon FD FL 35mm SLR Lenses to Leica M LM Mount Rangefinder Cameras
product_description: Smooth surface for effortless mount Infinity Focus Allowed Anodized Aluminum Construction 24 Month Manufacture Warranty

reviews.review_body: It works, no problems. I would recommend it for it's intended use.

Two slight issues:
1. Focuses beyond infinity, but can be fixed by shimming inside of adapter (haven't done this yet)
2. Slight play from side to side so your lens could be off-center by a hair. No problem for me as I'm projecting unto APS-C (Ricoh GXR Mount)

Aperture control works fine. I'm very happy using mom's old FD lenses.

Works perfectly with my M-P 240 and Canon FD lens, I'm not sure what the purpose of the OPEN/LOCK slider, I just keep it in the LOCK position all the time so the aperture ring on the lens adjust the aperture blades.

The description by the manufacturer says that it fits a Leica M2. It certainly does. However, it's completely useless because the rangefinder cam isn't engaged when the lens is mounted so you cannot focus this. No point in buying this I would say on an M2 or M3. Returning it.
I used it for adapting Leica m lens to L mount

product_title: MegaGear Panasonic Lumix DMC LX10 Ultra Light Neoprene Camera Case with Carabiner Gray MG1030 PU Leather
product_description: TAILORED TO FIT This MegaGear neoprene camera case is specifically tailored to fit the achieving that desired perfect fit PROTECTIVE Crafted from scratch free soft durable and padded neoprene material to provide maximum protection FAST AND CONVENIENT The neoprene material is flexible lightweight and takes up minimal space making this case a perfect on the go companion OUTDOOR OR TRAVEL Protects your camera and lens from dirt scratches dust bumps and moisture while traveling or outdoors BOLD VIBRANT COLORS Comes in a variety of fun unique colors to choose from Choose the color that expresses your style and passion

reviews.review_body: The case tears off where it’s hooked after a single holiday of light usage
Brought for my teenage daughter. Convenient  and ample storage with on the go charging capability.  Durable fabric and sleek design.  She takes it everywhere!

Provides a terrific case to protect my Lumix lx10 which is an expensive piece of equipment. The case is tight fitting and convenient- I clip it to my belt loop. The only con I note on the camera is the battery life- I've experienced running out of battery during a photoshoot. It would be neat to have room in the case for a spare battery which is why I took a star away. Other than that I'm very pleased with the case.
Well priced, designed, sized and constructed. Also attractive. What could possibly be better?

product_title: Fujifilm Camera Lens Filter PRF 39 Protector Filter 39mm
product_description: Protector filter for Fujifilm 60mm F2 4 Macro lens Durable Fujinon Super EBC Coating Protector filter for any device with 39mm filter threads Country of Origin Japan

reviews.review_body: I received the wrong item - hoya pro1 digital filter 52mm :(
It was not clear from the description, but this filter is too small for the x20. Quality looks fine otherwise.
protects the lens,probably at some cost to IQ according to smart people

This filter fits perfectly on my Fujifilm XF 27mm F2.8 Compact Prime Lens.  With the filter installed you can still use a lens cap.  It dose not stick out a whole lot so my pancake lens is still retains its pancakeness.
Why not buy original Fuji for your Fujinon lens.  Is it a B&W... no.  Does it work, yes.  Fit and function are perfect.  Quality of the images seem not to be affected at all.

I never drop my camera, But I did, and it hit the floor hard. The glass of this filter shattered, and no part of the camera/lens was damaged at all.
It is thick glass.

product_title: OP TECH USA Lens Filter Pouch Large 0501132 Black
product_description: Protects and organizes your lens and filters Zippered filter section with two protective sections to better organize and safeguard your equipment Wide mouth design on lens section offers ease of use and accommodates larger lenses with sunshades Keeps your lens handy and secure with a snap attachment and belt loop Drawstring closure and padded dust flap protect expensive lenses

reviews.review_body:
I got this case recently with the idea of putting my Canon EF 70-300 IS USM (non DO) inside and throw in a backpack with no other form of protection. The case fits the lens well closing completely. As a matter of fact, it is quite wide and fits the lens with the relatively large hood reversed. The construction seems OK, although the padding is less dense than I would have liked. This is a soft case and I can feel every protrusion of the lens through the fabric without applying too much pressure with my hand. In this regard I am not sure about the protection the lens will get in a backpack full of other stuff.

The filter compartment at the bottom is a good idea but not for naked filters as the bottom of the case is not hard enough to really provide much protection. I guess I could cut a couple of round pieces of cardboard and attach then to the filter pocket and that would do. Alternatively, the pocket is large enough to keep a couple of filters (58mm) in the plastic box they came in but this is certainly not a very convenient solution, especially if you use your filters frequently. This is one of the occasions in which round filter cases would make soooo much sense! The filter compartment can be used to store not only filters but wipes and other small items as well. Again, I like the idea.

All in all this is a good product. It affords more protection than a Zing pouch without the added weight of a hard case. I took one star because of the lack of a hard bottom in the filter compartment and the -apparently- less than ideal amount of padding.
Perfect! Just as expected
Needed good protection for a Canon lens and this case provided it at a great price. Plus a spot for an extra filter as well.
Great product that several of these it's even better when it's an open package and you get it for half the price

This is large enough to hold my Nikkor 135 2.8, and some filters.
It is light, and and be folded up when not being used for lens carriage.
This does the job. Wish the bottom was a little more formed and less rounded so that the lens would stand up more securely.  Filter compartment seems to do the job.

This is a great lens pouch for the money.  Well padded and an easy slip string opening at the top. Handy zip slots for a couple of extra filters at the bottom.  I especially liked the belt loop.  Makes taking that extra lens with you super easy without carrying the whole camera bag. Fits my Canon 50/250 IS with room to spare.
It's a good case, just not for smaller lenses such as one would use with a micro 4/3 system. The diameter is quite large.  I wouldn't use this for any lens having a filter thread of less than 58mm.

This case is perfect except for the closure.  I have some Adorama Slinger lens pouches that have a zipper closure instead of the pull string like this, and I much prefer the zipper closure.  Other than that, this pouch is made exceptionally well, and I LOVE the fact that I don't have to carry a separate filter wallet anymore.  If they could do this exact case but with a zipper closure, I'd replace all the lens pouches I have with these.
Not much better than the one that came with my lens.  I wanted one wit more padding for use when traveling on the motorcycle and it has more than the original but add more bulk than padding.

This pouch is perfect for what I needed. It has more padding than my old pouch and the filter compartments add extra protection. I only have one filter in there at a time so I can't comment on using it to hold two, but it seems like it might not give quite as much puncture resistance in the outer compartment.
Much larger than expected. The small will fit my 56mm 1.2.  Much to big for my 23, 35 & 50mm 2.0.  But there are no sizes listed on the packaging. Perhaps the vendor got it wrong?

Unable to find a proper carrying case for. 100mm photography lensball, so I bought this.  Width is a nice snug fit; height is a little taller but one you tighten the draw strings it holds it well.  Not a whole lot of cushion if it is dropped, but will definitely keep the ball from normal dings and scratches.

Overall this is a nice pouch for the price. It is well padded and the bottom is fairly rigid and thick affording plenty of protection. The bottom also has a zipper around it revealing a compartment that can be used to store filters, small flat accessories, etc. The only problem that I experienced with it is the tab where the clip is attached. On a weekend trip where the only extra lens I carried was in this pouch I had it clipped to a carabiner on the outside of a small messenger bag and after several hours noticed that the stitching securing the tab had almost totally unravelled. Had this completely come apart the pouch with the lens inside would have fallen off and landed on the sidewalk. Fortunately I noticed this and put it inside the bag and carried it inside for the rest of the day. That night, to my wife's amusement, I was able to adequately reattach the tab with the little sewing kit in the hotel room. It held securely the next day and when we got home I had a friend bartack it with a sewing machine. Overall I like the case and would purchase another if needed, just check the stitching.

Very well made lens bag.
Provides ample padding, and the draw string has a little locking knob
so your lens cant fall out. It also has a compartment for a lens filter or two.

The only problem I have is that it is so bulky, it will not fit in my camera bag,
which is one of the largest on the market.

I ended up not using it for that reason. My camera bag already provides plenty of
padding, so I just put my lenses in plastic bags and stuff them into the bag.

With a large lens in this pouch, it is so bulky, I would have to remove my camera
to make room for it.

However, if you are looking for a good lens pouch with lots of padding, and a secure draw
string with a locking knob, you will not find a better one for this price.

Also, Amazon's price and service were great.

Good lens case, good protection and materials. Better than the ones that came with the Nikon lenses. The bottom will hold 2 filters, the sides and top are padded for extra protection. I got mine from Event Camera through Amazon, fast shipping.This can be used for a 18-55mm, 55-200mm or a 50mm prime Nikkor lenses with hoods reversed.

product_title: SLIK Master Classic 2 Way Pan and Tilt Head Black 619 710
product_description: Compatible with tripods or support systems that feature a 1 4 20 mount 2 way pan and tilt movements allow 360 Degree rotation and 90 Degree backwards or forwards tilt Head rotation as well as backwards and forwards tilt movements function simultaneously 1 4 20 mount with anti slip cork surface for compatible cameras lenses or sport optics 13 2 lb load capacity

reviews.review_body:
Love it, exactly what I was looking for to mount a heavy spotting scope very solidly.  I had trouble with other heads that either had a floppy quick-attach mount or a floppy 3-Way head.  I only needed 2-Way and didn't need a quick-attach which I didn't trust not to drop off.  Everything on this is solid aluminum except the little triangular locking collar for the 1/4" bolt going into your camera and the handle grip. The locking collar has a threaded metal insert though so I think it will be fine.  Even the small lever you see on the side for locking the camera mount swivel is aluminum.  Very durable it looks like something was made in the "good old days" - made to last.  Made in Japan.

The plastic handle locks both tilt and pan at the same time, or loosens them both for movement.  Its not a fluid head but it can be snugged to allow controlled movement smooth enough for anything but video I would think.
Well made and simple to use and with an L bracket you don't need a three way head.  Replaced the original ball head on my Vanguard and I'm very happy so far.

funciona muy bien y bastante estable y preciso con tu equipo digital.
camara, celular, binocular y video

product_title: AmScope SM 7TX FRL Professional Trinocular Stereo Zoom Microscope WH10x Eyepieces 3 5X 45X Magnification 0 7X 4 5X Zoom Objective 8W Fluorescent Ring Light Articulating Arm Boom Stand 110V 120V Includes 0 5x Barlow Lens
product_description: Professional stereo microscope on articulating arm has long working distance to enable users to perform work or manipulate large items including circuit boards and dental appliances Trinocular viewing head with pair of 10x super widefield eyepieces adjustable interpupillary distance fixed 45 degree vertical inclination to reduce eye and neck strain and 360 degree rotation capability to enable sharing 0 7x 4 5x zoom objective provides continuous zoom magnification and longer focal length for inspecting large scale specimens and a 0 5x Barlow lens extends the working distance Removable 8W fluorescent ring in a plastic housing provides bright shadow free illumination Articulating arm stand has 40 reach and solid steel base plate to provide stability

reviews.review_body: It works very well. The stand will tip over if you don’t add a lot of weight or clamp it down. To make it work they would need to at least double the weight and it’s quite heavy as is. I suspect the price would need to go way up and especially shipping cost. You might be better with the bench clamp but my workbench top was to thick for it.  My stand was rusted in several places but Amscope took care of it. Their support was top notch. Dustin and Travis are two professionals that answered my slew of questions and were a pleasure to work with. If not for the rust and no mention that the stand easily tips over, I would have given it five stars. The included light is not very good but their 144 LED light is great and is reasonably priced. Over all I am happy with it.

product_title: JOBY Cold Shoe Mount Standard 1 4 20 Attachment Compatible with GorillaPod and TelePod for Accessories for Content Creation Live Streaming TIK Tok in ABS Plastic and Stainless Steel
product_description: FOR PHOTOGRAPHY ACCESSORIES The mount is held in place with a standard 1 4 20 attachment to your GorillaPod or TelePod STRONG AND DURABLE The mount is made from durable ABS plastic and strong stainless steel STAINLESS STEEL The 1 4 20 threads are made entirely of strong stainless steel so they won t wear out or rust VERSATILE Mount any of your accessories on a GorillaPod Telepod video equipment a camera stand a tripod for lights or on any other tripod IDEAL FOR CONTENT CREATORS You bring the creativity JOBY will give you the equipment you need Always ready to help those who put their hearts into their content and want to leave their mark

reviews.review_body: This cold shoe is a wonderful option for those who are looking for something that can hold a speed light which uses a lock pin to secure itself to the cold shoe instead of the thumbscrew style.  Not much more to say beside it seems to be well made and out of durable plastic, and it even has an embedded metal 1/4"-20 threaded insert on the bottom for the tripod to screw into, which makes it much more durable than plastic alone.

product_title: Fotodiox Designer Body Cap Compatible with Nikon F Mount Cameras
product_description: Precision made replacement body cap Protects camera sensor when stored away Constructed from high impact plastic Color Black Limited 2 Year Manufacturer Warranty

reviews.review_body:
I love the design on this body cap—it's unique, and it complements the styling of the Nikon F2 I'm using it for. HOWEVER... there's a concern to be aware of: you may find that the body cap becomes "stuck" when trying to remove it.

Now, to be clear, this might only be a problem with older Nikon F-mount cameras, because none of the other reviews I've looked at mention this.

Although it twists into place easily, there's a FIRM resistance when removing it... and I absolutely panicked for a moment when I LITERALLY couldn't get it off. Luckily, I realized that you simply need to firmly pull the cap outward (away from the camera body) while rotating it off. It's weird... it requires a bit of back-and-forth twisting while doing this. So, it's definitely tricky. And I couldn't quite determine what part it's getting stuck on.

Again, this might only be an issue with Nikon's vintage film cameras... the older bodies probably just have a very minor design difference in the mount. But it's still a concern. Just be cautious if you're using this for an older F-mount body.

(I realize that this body cap was probably NOT designed with 50 year-old cameras in mind, which is why I'm still giving it 5 stars overall. It still works!)

[UPDATE 11/26: I'm bumping the rating down from 5 to 4 stars. I was able to test this cap on another early F-mount body, and unfortunately ran in to the same problem, so it wasn't just my camera that had a compatibility issue. While the cap still fits okay, I'm worried that it could cause panic for others trying to use it. If you have a Nikon DSLR, it's probably fine, but just be cautious with vintage Nikon cameras.]
Great replacement body cover for Nikon F camera. This is a necessity to protect your Nikon body from dirt, dust, and debris.
came just as expected

Perfect, does the job! Definitely worth the little money you pay and this will not disappoint :)

Love the oreo cookie look too!
Doesn't fit a Fuji s1 as advertised.
Worked well, thanks!
Just what it is advertised as and works beautifully.  Came quickly and am using it daily without any problems.  Highly recommend this product.
Didn't even fit my camera. And it wasn't the item pictured at all
Did  not receive the item pictured. I assume that what I have here is for the mirrorless Nikons. This is NOT an F mount cap, much smaller with N-1 stamped on it.
Did not have pretty design on it as advertised. Only says NIKON. Other wise fine.
Ok
Great product! Works well.
Works and cheap.
I bought 4 of these so I could have replacement caps, and to drill holes into to create a pinhole effect with my camera. Works!
I bought this for an old F3 film camera body that I recently acquired. Fits perfectly on the F3 and also on my D300.
good fit for my Nikon D3300 , fast delivery and decent pricing
Was perfect for my Nikon D80. Affordable product. It is always useful to have one of these between the suitcase.
I have a Nikon D7100 and a N65, This cap fix both bodies. Happy that I am not getting dust particles in my mirror or sensor.
good price
I like this cap as it seals the camera very securely so you don't always have to have a lens attached.
Cap fits very nicely on my Nikon D80 and doesn't feel cheap. Works great to keep the dust and dirt out of the body.
Works fine for my d7100
Fits my Nikon D3000 great and the price is right. I would purchase again if needed. Ordered on January 19th & arrived on the 21st.
Nice, snug fit. I also love the design element etched into it! Great value for the price, I would order again.
This camera body cap is exactly what I was looking for. Fits perfectly. Great quality for the price. Would purchases again.
Fit great and looks good. No problems and would order again.
Needed a body cap for an older DSLR.  This one fits well and served its purpose well.
These are great replacements. They fit snug unlike old Nikon body caps and are of high quality.
It fits both my new Nikon and my old Nikon, it really helps to keep fragment and dust out of the chamber of your camera.
works as designed
Fits the camera way better than the original Nikon cap. Seals the sensor
Fits great
...it works fine.
very loose, the cap is not tight enough as a cover.

These caps are indistinguishable from their Nikon cousins at a fraction of the price. Remember your high school Geometry to find the exact center of the body cap, Drill a very small hole in the center. You've got a digital pinhole camera, very cool to play with.

I ordered a bunch of these and they did not stay on the camera body.  They were loose and kept falling off.  Not very good at keep dust out of the camera body.  I contacted the manufacturer and they sent me a couple more - same problem.  I don't know if these new ones with the OREO pattern are any better but the ones I have were very loose!
I lost my body cap and found this one on Amazon.  I fit my Nikon D90 perfectly.  My only complaint is it feels a little light.  Even with that reservation it did the job and I would order again.

Nervous about buying this generic replacement part for your camera?  Don't be.  Fit like a charm on my Nikon D3100. No concerns over construction, fit, anything.  Absolutely perfect! Would buy again, but hopefully I won't lose this again so I won't need to!!
Fit perfectly, a little tightly. Beautiful engraving looked even better in person. I was buying this as a replacement cap and now I'm glad I didn't get a plain one again.
Perfect fit should have purchased more than one

This cap is pretty good, for the money i paid for it. first came one for cannon them i sent it back and for a misunderstand i was really mad wait for the cap then it came like 4 days after return and now i am satisfied with this product!

I needed a cap for a Nikon lens to Canon body converter, just to protect it better when off camera. There are probably others that are of less-fancy design, but it is a solid fit, looks cool, and I'll be able to tell where it belongs by being different from my "plain" ones.

This body cap was a great addition to my camera.  It fits the body of the camera, so I don't have to keep a lens on all the time to protect the camera interior.  The cap fits as though it were original equipment. I seems sturdy and you can feel it lock into place.  I'd buy another if I lost this one.
Item is as described and shipped fast.

Got the Nikon body cap along with a bunch of other items (combined shipping and 3 day transit, nice).  I expected something ok for the price but wow!  Nikon and Canon body caps very nice and are BRANDED!  They even had the proper Canon logo for the 80's.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Definitely a good grade plastic and should hold up for a while.  A+ Value!
Unlike some other unofficial Nikon accessories which can have poor finishing, this one really nails the quality.
Fits perfectly for my Nikon D60! As well as it looks super cute with the design on the front of it!
Excellent port cover and 1 day shipping.  If you lost yours this is a good replacement:)
Not much to say except that it fits and does the job.

How much is there to really say about a 4 1/2 dollar piece of molded plastic?  Fits as well as the Nikon branded cap on my D3100 and slightly better on my Nikon F.  Has a cool design on the front, (kinda reminds me of a Hydrox cookie knockoff of an Oreo) instead of the Nikon name, but who sees your camera with a body cap on anyway?  Keeps dust out of the camera body (that's what it's suppose to do).  And $2.50 less than the Nikon cap.  And that's all I'm going to say.

It's a pretty way to protect the camera's innards when you don't have a lens attached.

The material feels durable, not flimsy. I think this cap is of good quality and good value. I may purchase another.

This fits cameras with the Nikon F mount. Some non Nikon brands have the F mount. Double-check before purchasing.

There is a dot that you will want to line up with the dot on your camera to ensure proper alignment and to keep it rightside up (see photos).
Worked perfectly as a replacement cap for  my Nikon d7000.

These body caps fit tight and stay in place, and as an added bonus they have a cool pattern on them. I have about nine F mount bodies that rotate through use, and they all have one of these body caps on them.

I bought this cap with the idea to modify it into a pinhole photography "lens". It is working just fine for this purpose after my modifications. Had I not altered it, it would still be a fine body cap.
Solidly built of hard plastic. Fit my D850 camera as well as the original cap did; that's pretty much all I ask for. Kinda fancy on the front which is nice, I guess.

If you order a bunch at once, the shipping cost barely increases, so I recommend snagging about 9 at a time to keep unit cost low.

I have put these on modern and old digital SLR bodies as well as modern and vintage film SLR bodies and teleconverters and extension tubes.  Nice fit that isn't loosey goosey, except on my old Nikon TC-200 teleconverter... but I can't get anything to fit snug on it, so I don't blame these caps.

Okay, okay, they look fancy and pretty.

If you want to experiment with making your own pinhole digital SLR camera, might I recommend these caps? Just, uh, don't try to put the hole in the cap while it is attached to a camera.  ;)

product_title: Cokin Square Filter Landscape Creative Kit Includes Gnd 3 Stop Soft 121S Gdn Blue Soft 123S Gnd Tobacco Soft 125S for M P Series Holder 84mm X 100mm
product_description: Gradual ND8 filter P121S with 3 stop density and soft transition Gradual Blue filter P123S with soft transition Gradual Tobacco filter P125S with soft transition Filter holder and adaptor rings not included P121S FilterP123S FilterP125S Filter

reviews.review_body: I have been using Cokin square filters for years, and this is an excellent addition to their Creative Kit series.
Used these filters the first time but the blue and sunset filter scratches easily. Now, I have a paper weight.
Super easy to use. Love my cokin products!!
Very useful - a Pain to keep clean
I wish I’d have spend the extra money and gotten the glass ones. These scratch so easily! Mine scratched while wiping them with a micro fiber cloth!!!
Came as described was a last minute buy to take photos of Yosemite. Aided in bring out the granite mountains.
Quality glass and produces images without any hard vignetting.
These filters are good quality, and they are going to help me get very creative. For the price it's a no-brainer.
It's not the best filter I have, but honestly to start and have a first experience, it's enough.

I like using the Cokin square filters better than screwing round color filter lens on and off the camera.  Watch some of the videos on youtube to learn how to use it.  I bought it so I could darken the bright skies to bring out more of the blue while leaving my subject in bright light.  With another lens, I could give my white clouds an orangy tint.  Fun to play with.  Don't worry about the lens falling off it holder, the plastic holder grips it in place so all you have to do is slide the lens up and down for whatever effect you want.  It can hold up to 3 lens to use at a time.
Liked the kit format enabling me to get started in using photo filters.

product_title: Manfrotto 155 Tilt top Head with Camera Platform 143BKT
product_description: The Package Length of the Product is 17 272 centimeters The Package Width of the Product is 15 494 centimeters The Package Height of the Product is 7 112 centimeters Country of Origin ITALY

reviews.review_body: Great Product, Fast shipping.I glad I purchase this item.

Researched this carefully before the purchase. Not rich enough to purchase a cheap product. Does exactly what it is supposed to do. Well built and sturdy. Using it on the tabletop. This is a lifetime product. Five stars.

If you're even looking at this review, you need this product.  This thing is great.  To say it's well constructed is an understatement--It's built like a brick $*** house!  You can use this to hook anything to anything else.  I use mine with the Manfrotto 035 clamp to mount my speedlite anywhere, to anything I want.  I've also used it to mount my gopro camera with both the clamp and a panavise suction cup.  I can mount my strobes to it.  Basically, if it has a 1/4 thread or 5/8 stud mount, you can hook it to this sucker and go.

product_title: Samyang SYIO14AF E 14mm F2 8 Full Frame Auto Focus Lens for Sony E Mount Black
product_description: UMC anti reactive coatings three Aspherical lens elements and two ED lens elements Constructed of high strength aluminum alloy housing 14 elements in 10 groups Aperture range of F2 8 22 with 7 aperture blades The integrated autofocus motor works in conjunction Compatible with full frame and APS C cameras with an angle of view of 113 9 degrees on full frame cameras and 89 8 degrees on APS C cameras

reviews.review_body: Greet
My friend ordered this lens. He is a professional photographer. I am assuming he knows his craft and leaving this review.

This does have a little bit more distortion and Chromatic Aberration than the Sony fe 14mm, but in most situations you want notice it. F2.8 is wide enough for 90% of shooting scenarios, but, of course, if you find yourself shooting in very low light you may want to consider the Sony instead. The Sony fe 14mm has a wider aperture at F1.4, it's a sharper, and it has slightly less CA and distortion. The only compelling thing on that list is the aperture for low light performance, the rest you'll have to look really hard to tell the difference in any practical shooting scenario. This comes down to your budget. If you need the ultimate in performance, the Sony brand lens is your way to go. If you need a 14mm lens now that gets you so close that most people couldn't tell the difference, then save around a grand and buy the Samyang. It's a great option.
Has some chromatic aberration! Just be ready!!! It is pretty bad!
It’s a 499 lens. Needless to say you get what you pay for. I could not get it to focus for the life of me! Save your $$ and get a better quality lens

Wide. Like my...

shoulders.
Not happy with the image quality what so ever. I have a sigma art 35mm 1.4. Save your money for that one!
warmth
It does not recognize my A7IV
Good lens for the money, fun to use
I originally had the MF version of this lens.  Sold it after a few months to get this one...it's exceptional!  Super sharp with great color.
Great lens for the buck

I want to really like this lens but for some reason it takes a miracle for the autofocus to magically focus on anything. It's so blurry except for when the focus manages to engage. I'm unsure if this is normal, I've always had a manual lens and I thought autofocus would be better but there seems to be no way to change the focus ??
I used to photograph air craft interior and plan to use for real estate stills and video.

I am in the process of returning the replacement to the first one I order a few weeks ago. Both exhibit severe vignetting with color degradation in the corners. I've spent too much time trying to fix this in Lightroom. Not worth it, and it's certainly not worth $600.
2 stars for very good center sharpness but deteriorates quickly towards edges.
Finally, do not use the Samyang rear lens cap on any other e-mount lens. It takes 2 men and a boy to get it off. I thought I was going to have to break it off. Seriously. But this is no longer a concern for me since lens is goin' back.

I like how one of the questions is "For portrait photography" ?  Only if you don't like the subjects of your portrait photography.  Ultra-wide angle lens for real estate or landscapes.  Only use for portraits if you want people to look fat.
Love this lens. I use it for real estate photography and tight spots at weddings.

The lens I bought came with the latest firmware V21. Before this I had the Rokinon Cine DS 14mm T3.1. This lens performs great and it's handy having the autofocus capabilities with the Sony A7S II. Once recording the lens doesn't hunt and search in an unpredictable manner so the fixes have worked a charm. This is a great wide lens.
Let’s face it, you don’t buy this lens because it’s the best, you buy it because it’s 1/3 the price of the Sony. That said it’s still pretty good.
I use this for real estate photography. Gets the job done, excellent for its price.

Wonderful optics and performance. The only downside is that due to the domed glass design, ND filters are not available easily or at all. If you need to shoot low light inside this lens is a dream. If however, you shoot outdoors in the sunlight and need to compensate with Neutral Density filter, you may want to explore other options.

I bought this lens to use on my a7s2 in order to create walk-through videos of homes for Realtors.  I need a fly-by-wire lens to do this because in order to create these videos FAST (that's important since the customers don't like to pay a lot for these basic basic basic videos) you need to shoot in S-Priority so that the camera can take control of the aperture and open it up and close it down as it sees fit as light levels increase and decrease when you walk through the house filming.

This lens had a good bit of barrel distortion but I was willing to forgive that because I felt that it was likely that the customer would never really notice.  I was happy that it could go to 2.8 and let double the light into the camera that my previous f4 lens could.

The deal killer though was the aperture control.  It wasn't smooth like my 16-35 f4.  Instead of seamlessly opening and closing the aperture it would wait to do so...then make a big jump.  Like...a full stop of light jump as compared to how my 16-35mm would adjust on the fly in 1/10th of a stop increments.  The result was that the light levels would jump up and then jump down as the amount of the light in the scene changed.

This wasn't workable.  I dunno if the lens was designed to only adjust in 1-stop increments when used in S-Priority mode or if this was due to the fact that the lens couldn't "talk" to the camera efficiently enough to know to make the adjustments faster and thus more smoothly.  Either way, it had to go back and was replaced with the significantly more expensive 12-24mm f4.  Sure, I lost the extra stop of light and sure I didn't want to spring for the extra coin...but the downsides to this lens were not acceptable trade-offs for what I do.
Needed it for some real estate shoots and it absolutely killed it and at a great price too

Compared with other sub-factory lenses, this fixed-focus wide-angle lens is quiet and fast! I am very satisfied with it. I have seen some negative comments here. I think that for the price of ¥500, it is completely faultless! I give five stars, not because of anger, but reason!

it is a really nice lens. photos taken are great and no distortion noticed. however, i don't know if something wrong, lens cap damage the hood, which should not happen. the caps and hood seems too get scratch easily, which reduce its value quickly.

I am a full time real estate shooter and for the longest time I used a Laowa 9mm on my Sony APSC cameras but recently made the jump to a Sony A7iv and did want to shoot in APSC mode and lose megapixels so I decided to grab this lens.  The results I've been able to achieve are on par with the Laowa and now I have auto focus which is something I very much wanted for video purposes.  My only issue so far is in video this lens has a lot of breathing which can be a deal breaker for some.  I also wasn't aware that I could not update the lens firmware unless I spend another $60-70 on a dock for the lens so that is very disappointing to me.  I wish there was a way to even see what firmware is currently on the lens in the system menus but I have yet to be able to find it.

Overall in terms of shooting real estate stills and video I am incredibly satisfied with this lens at it's price point.

This is a must have lens for a budget full frame real estate photography kit. Truly the only lens you need to start with. I use it with a sony A7ii and love it, it takes care of 99% of my real estate work. For things other than real estate, the autofocus is far enough for non action shots, at least with the A7ii. Is also a joy for astro photography!!! Don't hesitate buying this lens!

Bought this lens for real estate videography & it performs great for just that as well as Astrophotography. the Autofocus feature of the lens is pretty crap. specially in low light conditions as it keeps on hunting and ruins the shot.

Besides that great lens for the price point.

So, I bought this after doing some research as I was looking for a solid Astro photography. And I have to say the reviews were absolutely spot on, this is a sold lens especially at this price point. Images are sharp, auto focus is good and the over all performance is amazing.

You wont regret buying this lens I can guarantee it.

The case was perfect for the specified camera and my kid loves it. The material looks and feels great. It's also built very well.
Its a good bag
Fit and looks good
Fits my camera

product_title: SLIK SH 707E 2 Way Pan Tilt Head Black 618 717
product_description: Stable and all metal It has a multi action pan head with a quick release plate Simple one arm lock release system controls camera movements Perfect for tracking moving subjects with a spotting scope or binoculars It also uses a fast and easy to use quick release plate to securely mount a camera or spotting scope on the tripod The mount for the quick release rotates 360 degrees and locks down facing in any direction

reviews.review_body: Well made.  Works smoothly and easily.

product_title: Manfrotto MSY0580A Dado Kit with 6 Rods for Photographic Lighting and Grip Equipment
product_description: Multiple attachement points Flexible in positionsing and friction control Compatible with all Manfroto products

reviews.review_body: Haven't had a chance to use in "real" world settings but have hung two EL500 monolights and it seemed pretty stable (with some help, not fully trusting it to hold both with just one attachment point). Very robust and sturdy! Wish it was a little cheaper but hopefully that's a sign of quality!

I use this product with my Manfrotto Magic Arm. Gives me multiple shooting angles and options. Works great with the Manfrotto Super Clamp as well. With those two products I have multiple mounting options for my gopro and camcorder. I use this product to film son's hockey, soccer games and my excursion on my mountain bike. Only issue so far is once the rods are screwed together virtual impossible to unscrew by hand. This process requires tools.

product_title: Coleman 16x50 Signature All Terrain Waterproof Binoculars
product_description: 16x magnification High index porro prisms for sharp resolution Fully coated 50mm objective lenses ergonomically designed with non slip rubber armor waterproof fogproof dustproof and shock resistant

reviews.review_body: Very clear image for image at far distance.  Some difficulty with aligning left and right eye images into one. I would have liked a wider field of view, however, these are fine binoculars for panning a distant horizon or static field.  Not the greatest for tracking birds in flight.
Great product great price.
Yes can see moon's craters and uneven features. Made well.
They are too heavy and too powerful for what I had wanted
These are fantastic!
Was looking forward to getting the 16 power. What I received today was 8 by 40s.  Which are a dime a dozen.
Great product, use for bird watching and am very happy with it. It is a quality pair of binoculars, very clear and feels solid, I would buy again and was happy with seller??????????

They are pretty good, no real complaints.  I find my 10x42 binoculars to be easier to use.  You have to have a steady hand and patience to use these, because it takes a bit to get it in focus and on target and then adjust the width perfectly or you'll have blacked out spots.  They are heavy and solidly made.
Yes, the prism is BAK4. Exit pupil is round,the picture is crystal clear.

Lost the BEST binoculars we ever had (couldn't remember the brand name) when they were accidentally left in a rental car and never found.  So, we ordered new Bushnell binoculars (because of the brand name) and we have never been happy with them!  We are taking an extended driving trip and wanted some great binoculars.  My husband did not like the "Coleman" name but I ordered them anyway.  What a great surprise!  These binoculars are FANTASTIC!!  Love the exterior coating that makes them easy to grip and handle.  Sight through them is SO MUCH BETTER than the Bushnell ones which cost way more money!  Even my husband loves them!  I haven't been in a situation where they might fog up (like our Bushnells did whenever we went from cold to hot) but these are supposed to be fog-proof which will be wonderful (no more waiting for them to clear up)!!  I would compare these to some binoculars which cost more than double what we paid!  Thank you COLEMAN for making such an awesome product!

I recently purchased 4 different pairs of inexpensive binoculars in my quest for acceptable performance and returned them all because of poor optics. The only ones I found that were clear and resolute enough in this power and price range were the Bushnell Powerview 16x50/20x50 models and the Coleman Signature 16x20. This Coleman has to be the best buy in this price range, considering features and optics. The view, although somewhat narrower than less powerful models, is very clear with outstanding clarity and resolution, enough to view the tiny bullet holes on the long distance targets of my shooting range. The build seems to be good. They have nicely designed rubber covered twist up eye pieces. The lens covers are also rubber-like, instead of plastic and fit tightly. The eyepiece lens covers are one piece and clip to the strap. Some online stores describe these erroneously, I believe, as having BK7 prisms. The pair I received have the better BAK4 prisms. "BAK4" is stamped on the body of the binoculars and noted on the box. Scoop these up while you can. I took a chance on these as there were no reviews available.  I'm thrilled that I did! By the way, an online search I conducted identified the Coleman binoculars as a joint effort by Coleman and Olympia.

product_title: Tiffen 49PM1 49mm Pro Mist 1 Filter
product_description: Great for portraits and scenics Maintains focus Often used to mute colors for exquisite pastel tones

reviews.review_body: this filter did everything it said it would on the tin. :)amazing little piece of glass. used by the famous vincent peters in many photos. its really an invaluable piece
This filter series, for film and video, starts getting too foggy for my taste at the #1, but in certain landscape and 'atmosphere' conditions it is perfect (along with the #3).

product_title: Exxy Omni Sr Universal L Bracket for Most DSLR Cameras Canon Fuji Nikon Olympus Panasonic Pentax Sony All Metal Black Camera Hand Grip for Acra Swiss or Arca Swiss Type Quick Releases
product_description: Arca Swiss Compatible Mounts on Bottom and Side Side Mount is Adjustable to Reveal Cable Ports and Battery Access Bottom Bracket Length is Adjustable for a Universal Fit Four Standard 1 4 Tripod Sockets for Flexible Mounting Options Limited 2 Year Manufacturer Warranty

reviews.review_body: I've bought 2, They are on my Nikon1 V2s. The great thing abought this L Bracket is that it allows access to the battery, without having to move the bracket. The photos on the Fotodiox site shows it attached to a Nikon1 V1, the Amazon sites shows a Samsung.

I have always used Really Right Stuff gear.  It's good but expensive.  They do not make a good L-Plate for the GFX so I tried this product.  Works great.  Not as well made as RRS gear, but so far for over 1 year it has worked fine for me.
Not as well designed as Really Right Stuff, but much better price - for fairly rare vertical shots.

I have looked at a number of L-Brackets for the Fujifilm GFX.  I feel this bracket is the best design.  It enables you to loosen the thumb screw and then slide the vertical bar down to change the battery, something that other L-Brackets can not do.  HOWEVER, there is a BIG flaw that compromises this bracket.  The tolerances between the two pieces are two great, so that the side piece "wiggles" even when locked down. I had THIS problem out of the box.  Over time these two pieces are going to start to wiggle even more.  Unfortunately, this L-Bracket needs to be redesigned.
Seems well made. Cool idea. But, does NOT fit Panasonic G9 or G85. There's not enough width from the lip to the mounting screw. If you do put it on, it won't sit flush against the plate (see photos).
Fantastic price and very versatile

I spent 2 weeks shooting in patagonia with this bracket - it works well - the screws supplied works well and replacing the battery isnt an issue. In portrait position there is a little bit of play on the bracket but did not affect my shooting
Though this L-plate is adjustable, it still not match with some cameras.

This is a well built L Bracket.  I also have one from Really Right Stuff for the Fuji GFX.  The reason I like this one over the RRS L Bracket is that you can change the battery without removing the bracket or the L portion of the bracket.  I am sure it is not as structurally sound as the RRS bracket but the fact is that Fuji Batteries need to be changed out regularly and it is easy to do with the L bracket.  You simply loosen the screw that you see in the picture at the end and the vertical portion slides down revealing the battery door.  You don't fully remove the L portion of the bracket so there are no parts to be lost.  I think that is my main reservation about the RRS bracket is that you have to completely remove the L portion and screw and I can see dropping the screw while in the field.

For this bracket, I find it bottom part of the bracket very well built and molded to the shape of the Fuji GFX so it won't slip.

I recommend this.

This bracket is made of two pieces, bottom one and a side one.  The side component screws to the bottom part but the screw mechanism can never be tighten enough to provide for a solid, no wiggle, fit.  This means that the side bracket is loose and has a lot of wiggle room and at times it just gets loose.  Every so often you need to tighten the screw.  My camera fell out of this bracket and fell to the ground once, incurring damage to the body and possibly a lens.  This is a shame as this is not a cheap bracket.  I have several Fotodiox brackets for Sony and they are great.  Skip this one.

This product is actually a big disappointment. It doesn’t fit on my EOS M200 or my Lumix ZS100. I can get it to go on my Lumix GX85, but it doesn’t sit perfectly flush, so the camera will be slightly angled in portrait orientation.

Manufacturing this with 2-3mm of extra adjustment would make this compatible with so many more cameras.

There is not a lot of things to critique with a bracket but here are the main aspects that I like about this:
- Fits very well on the camera.  It is designed well to fit concise.
- Works excellent with a RRS (Really Right Stuff) bracket.  It does not slip at all which is a problem I have had in the past with other third party brackets.
- I do not own any of the other brackets but the concept of this one for enabling the battery changing makes the most sense to me and it does work well.  All you need to do is loosen the screw and slide it down and you can change the battery.  Also, if you are in a shooting situation where you won't need to use the vertical side of the bracket it is easy to remove which is a nice option to me.
I really like this bracket and I feel it is a great value when comparing it to the alternatives.

product_title: Manfrotto 061 Joining Stud for Super Clamps Replaces 2913 Silver 2 x 5 x 2
product_description: Package Dimensions 18 541 cms L x 9 652 cms W x 0 254 cms H Package Quantity 1 Product Type Camera Other Accessories Country Of Origin Italy

reviews.review_body: This stud is for joining 2 super mafer clamps together [

I guess I missed the part about this not being able to join 2 manfrotto clamps at 90 degrees on this one.  I needed one that would do a 90 so as to clamp going the other way.  This will not do that, I'll look for a 90 somewhere, oh well.
The joining Stud, by Manfrotto, is a necessary piece of equipment that helps a lot join two super clamps! The versatility that this provides is more than you can think in a first impression!
I use this to connect 2 Super Clamps for a motion rig. Worked well and as expected.
Working as expected

This short stud will join two super clamps together, back to back. One half of the stud fits into each super clamp, so they fit together tightly.

It's made from aluminum and is very light, but it's also thick and very strong.

This was designed for the Manfrotto Super Clamp

product_title: AmScope EP10X23 S One WF10X Microscope Eyepiece 23mm
product_description: 10X Magnification Power 23 mm Mounting Size in diameter Wide Field of View Fitting 3 mounting sizes 23mm 30mm and 30 5mm

reviews.review_body: I ordered this item as a replacement for a microscope that I found in a Thrift House that had no eyepiece and was actually in the dumpster.  The eyepiece fit perfectly, and the optics were amazingly well-manufactured.  The item was shipped quickly and securely packaged.  I highly recommend this seller!

What I received was essentially the same as the 10x WF eyepieces that came with my Swift SW380T.
They look, feel, weigh, smell, taste, nearly the same as the Swifts. Same height, field of view, and focus point.

The only difference I noticed was the text written was in a different style (obviously it would) and the apparent groove ring for a possible locking mechanism in a higher end model is in a slightly different depth. But optically and aesthetically, they were the same to me.

I finally found a parfocal 3rd eyepiece for my phototube. For ~20 bucks. That's a win!

PS: if you hold it by the two ends and unscrew, it comes apart pretty easily. You can clean easily and more importantly try to realign the lenses if you get the impression the image is not focusing evenly (radially).
These are 18mm, not 23mm. Product not as advertised.

My microscope eyepiece was missing (borrowed to use on a telescope?), so I ordered 10X and 16X replacements.
I have been using the 16X, do not need the 10X version, but it works as it should.

product_title: OM SYSTEM OLYMPUS LH 48 Lens Hood for 12 mm f2 0 Lens Black
product_description: Item Package Height 4 826 Centimeters Item Package Length 10 668 Centimeters Item Package Width 8 636 Centimeters Product Type Camera Other Accessories

reviews.review_body:
I think we should just say it aloud. It's disgraceful what Olympus charges for this lens hood. That being said, it's made of metal, the finishing coating and markings seem (and are likely) very durable. I have high confidence that years from now it won't look tattered and scratched (The way that my OMD-EM5 Mii looks brand new. The hood goes on smoothly and has no "jangle". I should note that the "screw" that tightens it seems closer to a gun metal grey and it seems to be treated for that finish (not coated). The threading slide of the screw feels solid and the end of the screw hasn't scratched the metal lens in the slightest.
But the 12mm f2.0 lens is a special lens in my opinion, is there another 12mm? Is this the widest, non fish-eye lens Zuiko made? I think so. That lens can make a career for a real estate photographer and I love the manual focus clutch (which in itself is pretty rare for Zuiko).
I'm including a quick cel-phone snap of the lens, this hood and my EM5 Mii... to me personally, it's one of the sexiest camera combinations that I can remember (I immediately thought of the stealth fighter jet when i saw it together at first). I'm going to (hopefully) leave my gear behind to my daughter. And for this case, I want the official genuine lens hood... not an affordable Chinese knock-off.
The cost of this lens hood is the only reason I will not buy the Olympus 12 mm 2.0 lens.  Why would anybody pay that much for a lens hood?
Really well made, and I got it on Amazon for $30 less than Olympus was charging.

Since most of these are plastic, this one being metal has it's major advantages. I was hiking through some crazy rock formations recently when the camera swung around and nailed a rock. The only damage was this Lens Hood being Slightly Bent. If it was plastic it would of smashed and my lens would of been hurt. Alas this Hood being Metal saved my lens and is still completely operable.

People like to give lower rating because of price, if that were the case for me I too would give a lower rating. However. since there are cheaper options that you can go with I will not use price as a factor in this rating. My rating of 5 is for the machine quality of the item. This thing is flawless and perfect in every way possible. The precision is mind blowing.
The manufacturer is channeling Leica with this product; a very pleasant surprise.

product_title: BELL 5302 0 Mounting Lugs and Screws Gray
product_description: For use with 1 or 2 gang boxes Allows box to be surface mounted 2 1 4 in diameter mounting holes 2 lugs and screws per bag

reviews.review_body: Good add-on mounting brackets for weatherproof boxes. I think they should be included with the boxes by default.
Not as expected since I thought it would be larger-should have read the description. Tiny.
