product_description: Save 50 80 or more vs buying pre printed checks Create business and personal checks 100 copy safe counterfeit proof and instantly DNA identifiable Powered by INKcrypt Add unlimited accounts manage track your finances and customize your account safeguards INKcrypt security enabled Bundled with VersaScan 21X MICR Compliance Scanner Test readability of MICR encoded checks and documents at anytime Includes Credit Debit card stripe reader VersaScan 21X ensures your check MICR bank code line positioning and bank data formatting were set up and printed properly Includes VersaCheck X1 Gold 2018 VersaScan 21X MICR Compliance Scanner Note Scanner color may vary 150 check sample pack

reviews.review_body:
Advertising said maybe different color.I know this is a local business school issue.I checked in my business firm equipment with justice of the peace court 5 .Can return used bought by January 31 2020 for new at delivery and can pick up my first one.Mr
B.C.W. c.p.p.firm,c.p.a.firm Taylor,Texas-76574.Dell Corp repair trouble shoot and quality assurance precheck before plug in.

product_title: Vivitar DVR786HD RED WM DVR 786 Full HD ActionCam
product_description: Capturez 12 1 megapixel photos Records Full HD 1080p video Features a 2 in touch preview screen to playback recorded videos or photos 4x digital zoom Wireless remote control to control the camera from anywhere

reviews.review_body: Mine arrived missing items listed on the box: like the manual, the remote, and the software. The battery was dead and not accepting a charge, and the record function did not work. Luckily returning it to Amazon was easy, except it meant yet another trip to the UPS store to return defective stuff from China.

This camera was the first sports camera I got. It is pretty simple but could have better features. I ordered the Blue Polaroid sports camera which is also waterproof and way more efficient to use. It is also cuter and easier to use. Around the same price as well.

Took great pictures, when we could get it to work??
Kept freezing and the screen would go black!
Audio does not work even speaking directly into the holes. Junk !

I bought it for scuba because package said it was waterproof but with no specifics of depth. Nowhere in instructions gave any info on depth. Similar camera cases waterproof up to 100ft.  Had to call customer service and was told it was waterproof to “5-6 feet”
The picture quality is not that good but the rest is. People are saying you have to use the 32 GB card but if you go to menu and format the card, it fixes the whole problem

Turn on, last about one minute then freezes up and will do nothing. Have to reset the unit in order to turn it off. Also, the camera gets quite hot within the one minute of use. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!!

I bought this knowing it was not going to be as good as a GoPro - but at a third of the cost, I thought it would at least perform at a third of the quality.  I went snorkeling on a 'once in a lifetime' trip - it took four photos (good quality) and when it switched to video, it froze up after 0:28 seconds.  And did not unfreeze until the battery died, which was at the end of the day.  So I guess a plus is that it had really good battery life (it would not hard reset or anything).  The downside is that I only got 28 seconds of video and nothing else.  Personally, I won't trust this brand to anything other than playing in a swimming pool.  Hopefully it was a fluke, but bad enough for me that I don't want to try it again.

I was looking for a cheap action camera, what I got was barely a paper weight. I knew it was not going to be great for what it was but it literally would not even record 1 single video. All it did was fill the SD card up with 8kb corupt files. I tried several different SD cards and got the same thing. This is my 2nd Vivitar purchase and both were huge mistakes and both got sent back.

This camera is cute-- I like the idea of it,  the case and different attachments are great.. BUT the camera itself sucks so badly! The battery constantly needs to be recharged- it doesn't last very long at all.  The camera freezes up constantly and needs to be reset-- and a lot of the time that doesn't work either!  The screen will go blank and a little green light will just keep flashing.  It also gets hot on the charger--- so I would not trust it to leave it charging over night.  This is our 2nd one-- because the first one, that was a Christmas gift for our son, crapped out after less than a month.  We were able to send it back to the company- at our expense.. and they sent us a new one.  The very same issues.  It is cheaper than a go-pro for sure, but you get what you pay for.  So disappointing because I read reviews on this camera before we purchased it- and the reviews that  I saw were pretty good.  I can only guess that these were reviews by excited people who just opened the package, or had only used it maybe once or twice.  It's very unlikely that I will ever buy another Vivitar camera.
Video Player is loading.

ended up buying a second one because i liked the first one , stil works and using it btw it went hunting with me , motorcycle rides, rain and snow, hiking, etc..  it is simple , works well,  has good video quality
i'm sure for less money now you can get better video quality and more features so before buying this i'd think about it and shop around but it does take great HD videos and the battery life is very good

Long story short, I lost the charger to my olympus underwater camera while on vacation the day before a rafting trip. Saw this in walmart, it included a helmet mount and a waterproof case, and it was $40, so I said why not.

I tried to put a 64GB card into it, and I got an error message, then I noticed that it only takes 32 GB cards. No biggy, back to walmart and the problem is solved for $8.

I then took a picture of my daughter sitting still reading her kindle in the hotel room, and it was aweful, it was like something you would get from a 15 year old cell phone. Blurry, dull and pixelated. I set the resolution to 12 MP, and it didn't improve at all. I'll attach a 12MP picture for your review.

Anyway, without a remote, I can't image getting any usable photos from this camera. Particularly while moving.

The video quality is likewise terrible. The aspect ratio is locked at 4:3, and the framerate seems to be less than 30FPS, it's very jerky even if I am just sitting in a hotel room.

There are very few options in the menu section, so there is little help of improving the quality. I'm not even sure that I want to bring it with me.

Long story short, don't bother with this one, get a better camera or use an old cell phone...

This camera was a gift, and I'm glad I didn't pay for it, but it doesn't make it worth it. The warranty and customer service for this product are inadequate, and they don't solve the problems, and won't replace what I think is a defective product. All of my photos came out black. I explained this to customer service, and they kept trying to get me to fix the camera with the reset button. The reset button did not work. The warranty is now expired, and I've never taken a photo with this camera that didn't come out black. I'd rather use a flip phone camera. Just buy something else, and don't take your chances with a defective product that won't be adequately serviced. This camera has now been put into the Best Buy e-waste container because it is a piece of trash.
Not worth purchasing
Item not as shown, these cameras do no come with the remote. Most of the reviews customers were not happy.
When on my bike it vibrates to the point where it fell off so not very good mounting  capabilities for the Intense athletes
Short battery life and camera only lasted one month.  The was the 2nd one.  Won’t buy this again.
Vivitar said  to return,  not functioning.
Turned it on, tried to use if but it froze up. Won't shut off. Tried to let it die then recharge it but same thing happened. It sits in the bottom of my trash can now.
Bought it for my 10 yr old , it's been recording under water mounted to skateboard, and bike helmet ,easy to use
I thought that the camera would’ve been larger and less awkward to handle.

Decent when you get one that works. Bought two and have one good one. Day videos are good but get blurry in high heat as the lens actually warps when overheated. Night performance is poor; about as bad as the GoPro Hero 5. Otherwise, I do like the camera. Takes 64 gig class 10 cards well with over 8 hours of recording. Brass 1/4 20 threaded insert, 2 hours of use on full charge, smooth file format. A little better quality control and these could take off.

Lol ??. That all I'm going to say. I got this as a christmas gift last year and have only used it twice. Once to try it out and once to remind myself of the poor quality. It doesnt have any kind of internal stabalization so even walking with it mounted to my head is unwatchable because of shakiness. Not to mention it has terrible jello effect when bouncing or moving any thing faster than a walk. Im thank full I didnt spend my money on this camera because its not worth it in my opinion. However, when its not being all bouncy and jello-ee the picture actually looks nice. I got some nice video of me and my family at the park one afternoon. If you have it in its case the mic wont pick anything up but if you have it out and speak loud enough it works just fine. I did notice that the case tens to take in a little moisture when its cold outside. Having only used it twice, i havent tested it underwater in a pool but i submerged it in my sink for a minute and it was fine. I accidentally droped the case (by itself) and the clamp on the side broke. A little superglue fixed it up nicely and it works as it did before. Even tested it in the water again.

All in all, not really worth it but has some nice moments.

this was the 2nd time buying this thing, the 1st through another vendor and i wasn't going to disclose the name but now i doubt it's Ebay's fault when the manufacturer was so quick to blame them for selling their own product  self described as faulty when we'd established this 2nd one was purchased from Ama. if that's too convoluted, Vivitar seems to be selling the 786 HD series action cam in full awareness they are defective.
Gave it 5 stars because we bought it to take underwater video.  It takes GREAT video. BUT ... stills are horrible ... like skinny-scope.

Haven't had any problems. Works better for what I'm using it for than I expected for the price. Couldn't figure out the helmet strap, so I screwed it to the brim of a baseball cap. Image is a bit grainy but not bad even in low light. The wrist remote buttons are a bit sensitive and can turn recording off/on unexpectedly. So far I'm satisfied.

Purchased this Vivitar DVR 794HD from Marshall's on 6/30/2019.  Put battery in camera and charged it overnight.  Removed from charging, and turned it on.  Battery indicator shows 1/2 full.  Why not completely full?  Maybe battery is old?
I did note that the camera's Display and the waterproof case has scratches on it consistent with use.  Although the unit came in sealed case and the remote control still has the battery protector (pull it to connect the battery and use the remote) are still in place.  The "QC PASS" sticker indicates 5/2018.

I'll update this after it finishes recharging.
I didn’t like it.

product_title: REVO America R12VPWRSUP 500mA 12V DC Power Supply Adapter
product_description: 12V DC power supply For use with your BNC cameras Simple and efficient design

reviews.review_body: As described.
Very Happy
great
Works great with my NightOwl DVR Security camera system.
Worthless
Not a good power rating for the any of the options.
nothing much to say other than it works as it should.
The description said that the power supply would fit ALL Revo Screens.  This product did not!
Much cleaner set up than individual power supplies.
GREAT
Quick shipping, item as described, Thanks
No problems.. smooth Transaction and we are dedicated to Cyberpower usage...because of reliability, etc..
Exactly what I needed to get my security camera's, back up and running. Fast shipping, and product works as expected.
I dont know why REVO doesnt just use these in all their set ups, make a world of differences. Used this one to replaced a burned out adapter that came with the original camera
Great price the company sells these for 3x as much very happy with it

product_title: Rokinon Cine DS 12mm T3 1 Ultra Wide Cine Fisheye Lens for Canon EOS EF DSLR Cameras Full Frame Compatible
product_description: Full Frame Sensor Coverage with aperture range of T3 1 T22 Dual calibrated right and left side distance an T stop scales Produces an Extreme Ultra Wide 180 Degree Diagonal Fisheye View De Clicked Uncoupled and Geared Aperture and Focus Rings with Unified Cine DS Lens System focus gear and aperture gear positions

reviews.review_body: As with my other two Rokinon lenses, well made, perfect fit with all of my Canon gear. Great image.

i'm not a video guy. the reason I wanted to try this lens is that it was eighty bucks cheaper than the photo version of the 12mm f2.8, seeming to be an identical twin. i was gonna use it for taking photos. well, folks, these two lenses aren't identical!

two major differences: 1. the cine model doesn't have a chip in it, your camera won't recognize it. the photo version for Nikon has a chip in it and my cameras (d750 and d5100) do recognize it. 2. on d750 you can set up a custom lens for this in aperture priority mode, but you will have to settle with the camera default 13mm instead of its real 12mm while the camera can see the photo model at 12mm. with the same setup the photo model seems to be much faster.

product_title: HappiJac Truck Camper Tie Down Kit 2004 2014 Ford F 150
product_description: SECURE Prevents camper movement in all directions up down side to side and front to back INNOVATIVE DESIGN The HappiJac tie down is designed to make your camper an integral part of your truck CUSTOM LIKE FIT Kits are readily available for Ford Chevy GMC Dodge and Toyota truck models STRENGTH The direct to frame mount is strong and easy to use DURABILITY The front tie downs are made from powder coated steel and the rear anchors are made from sturdy chrome plated steel

reviews.review_body: 2005 F-150 camper

product_title: V7 8GB SDHC Class 4 Flash Memory Card VASDH8GCL4R 1N
product_description: Content protection for recordable media CPRM Built in error correcting code ECC to detect and correct transfer errors Support in system programming ISP SD Adapter card included Lifetime warranty

reviews.review_body: replacement for a lost one. it works fine.
Very fast shipping. This memory card works perfectly in my Nikon L27, i can take up to 1000 pictures so i am very satisfied.
It works like an 8 GB class 4 SD card should. I really can't say anything bad about it.  I'm giving it 4 stars because I reserve 5 stars for really exceptional products.

I bought this card for use with the Creality CR6-SE 3D printer, since Creality recommends an 8GB SD card for the printer.  I felt I needed another card, so I could have the next file ready to go into the printer as soon as it finished. I'm very happy with this card.

product_title: Lowepro Volta 25 Camera Bag Clamshell Case For Your Point and Shoot Camera
product_description: Fits a compact point shoot camera spare memory battery credit cards or ID Molded foam clamshell design with PU exterior soft tricot interior lining

reviews.review_body: I've used it for my pentax and canon cameras. The case is really narrow so the inside pocket is unusable for fear of breaking the lcd screen on the camera, yet there is plenty of room top to bottom and on the sides; just not enough to store anything. It is a well made case and it protects my camera in my purse or large camera case with all my other goodies. It is a molded hard case, but it's not hard plastic, so it is flexible and comfortable yet protects well. I've never really found the perfect case. If the dimensions were more specific to your device, it would be nicer.
Great fit for HTC Pure

I needed a case for my Panasonic Lumix camera, but when the Volta 20 arrived, I discovered it wasn't deep enough to hold the camera.  The case does fit my iPod Touch, but it won't zip shut with any device thicker than 3/4".  The simple black case is well constructed with typical Lowepro quality, has a beltloop and small interior pocket for a memory card or earbuds.  I think it would be fine for traveling with your iPod, but if you're looking for a small camera case, pay close attention to the case dimensions.

This is perfect for those little slim cameras, such as the Kodak Easy Share M1033. It's sleek design keeps the slim profile but still offers protection for your equipment. The construction is solid and everything works as it should.
Very useful sized case - similar to the Case Logic hard drive cases. Fits my camera fine - but too small for iPod or iPhone.

Ever want to put a camera in your pocket while skiing, hiking or doing other strenuous or risky activity? Were you worried that the camera might break but didn't want to add extra bulk? This is the perfect case to use. Its small, secure, attractive and convenient to use. Great item!

First I bought the Case Mate Signature Series leather case (see link below) to protect my Ipod Touch during use, then I purchased the Lowepro Volta 20 to protect during storage. With the Ipod Touch fitted into the Case-Mate, it fit perfectly into the Volta 20. This is a great combination for using and storing your Ipod Touch. I would highly recommend both of these items, a great combination indeed.

I like this case. I've used it to carry my Fujifilm J28 camera around (the only compact P&S camera that I own), and performs that job perfectly well. Looks very professional. As another reviewer mentioned the logo is almost invisible, which I really dig. It's quite sturdy, and can protect the camera even if it falls to the ground.

The case has a small compartment inside so you can carry a spare SD card, though there isn't enough space to carry a USB cable.

It's definitely worth the price.

I gave this case to my grandson - he has a new digital camera, cell phone and an mp3 player.  He uses it for all 3, depending on which needs to be encased.  He is very pleased with the usability of this case - it is easy to grab and go and fits in his pocket as well.  He can store an extra memory card or cash inside the case, too.  The case is designed to open far enough to get whatever is inside without worrying about it falling out.  The hard outside shell and zipper seem quiite well made and I think it will provide some years of use.

This is an interesting case because it's not a soft cloth case yet it's not a totally hard clamshell case either; it's sort of in between. It has a soft interior and the front and back are semi flexible plastic. It has a belt loop as well which is very handy.

I consider this like a wallet for my small point and shoot camera or a PDA or cellphone. Note it DOES NOT fit the Apple iPhone though as the iPhone is too tall for this case.

This case is worth the money if your device fits in it. It also has a secondary inner pocket for an extra SD or CF card as well, which is nice. It offers good protection in a nice slim package.

I bought the new Coolpix S8100 which is a tad bigger than some shirt pocket cameras out there, and while at the store picked up the Lowepro Volta 20, knowing I could return it if the camera didn't fit. Turns out the camera fits in it like a glove - not much room for an extra battery, but exactly enough room for the S8100. Padding is sufficient for protection and the belt loop is a plus. It is stylish and sleek and I am very happy with this little case.
I use this as a zippered wallet. Great size and comfortable too. Have not used for anything else but it is durable

I was having a difficult time finding a case to fit my wife's S8200.  I ordered 3 previous, & they were either too big, or too small.  This one is perfect. There is no room for anything but the camera itself, but that's all we needed it for, to protect it while in her purse.

This is the perfect case for my flip video.  I wanted a hard protective case (but not a molded plastic one) for when I carry the camera in my purse or other bags.  The size of this one is perfect and it's simple.  There aren't a lot of pockets or extras I don't need so the price stays reasonable.

I found the Lowepro Hipshot 20 for Flip video cameras while I was here today and ordered one.  It's a soft case with a clip on it.  I'm thinking that the Flip inside the Hipshot will still fit nicely into this hard case.  That way, when I want to I can pull it out of it's safe purse "storage" and clip it on the outside for quicker access.  The Hipshot gives a choice of black, blue or cherry. It might even end up working well with my Sansa Fuze.  Lovin' it!

PROS:
- Very compact.  It would be a really tight squeeze for a pocket, but fits nicely into a purse without taking up a lot of room.
- Solid build.  Quality of materials seems to be good.  It feels like a hybrid of a hard case and a soft case.  The outside is hard  with some give, while the inside is a soft material.
- Decent protection.  The inside has no padding, but the outside material seems to take shock absorption well.
- Outer material doesn't seem to get scratched/marked easily.

CONS:
- Very small.  Must be a small pocket camera to fit well.
- No room for accessories.  While there is a small pocket on the inside, I struggle to fit my camera and a spare battery.  The battery always flies out when I open the case to remove the camera.
- No straps/carrying handles.
- Belt loop is not detachable.  You would actually have to feed your belt through the loop sewn onto the side of the case.

I bought this case with a Sony DSC-HX9V.  The camera barely fits.  The first time I tried to zip it up, I thought it didn't fit at all.  It seems to stretch slightly with use.

I like the small, simple design with the leathery feel on the outside, but I wish it had more room for supplies (memory cards, batteries, etc).  It's great if you want to store it in a purse or backpack and just want a shell to protect the camera in a bigger bag, but if you are looking for a case that will hold the camera and your accessories and you don't wear a belt or like cases that attach to a belt, this case is probably not for you.

This case does not have any straps or handles.  Once you remove the camera, you either have to hold on to the case, or find a place to put the case.  This can be extremely awkward when trying to take pictures if you use both hands to steady your shot.  It is slightly larger than a standard wallet and probably 2-3x as thick.  It doesn't fit into pockets well.

Perfect size for Nikon aw100 ...simple, clean and slim. Not much padding but I'm just looking for something to protect the camera from scratches while throwing in my backpack during travel. Semi-hard, little pocket on the inside for whatever and perfect for someone just looking for a good quality case ...as opposed to those looking for the do everything, hold everything, tell you where to go, help you take pictures kind of cases.

5 stars because it is exactly what it is.

I bought this case for my new iPod touch 4th Generation after seeing it in a store.  It is a small thin case which has the perfect dimensions for holding the new iPod.  It has a center that is great for holding my earbuds, but the BEST feature is the thin "pocket" on the inside wall of the case.  It fits my iPod PERFECTLY!!!  It holds it firmly in place and doesn't move around.  I can even open the case and hold it upside down and my iPod will not fall out!  This fact combined with the "molded EVA foam construction" & padding makes me feel comfortable that it will be protected if I drop it.  I carry it in my purse and I can't even tell it's there....which is saying alot!  I like it so much that I plan on purchasing another one so I have it as a back up in case something ever happens to this one. I wouldn't want to find out later that Lowepro had stopped making this model.
Works good

I didn't buy the Volta 20 for a camera. I bought it as a replacement for my Otterbox case belt clip. It does a supurb job as another softshell around my Blackberry Bold 9700. The Otterbox is a great hard shell inside a soft shell but the clip is trash. The Incipio has a worse protective case but a slightly better clip. The Volta 20 works great as a holder. I've never dropped it once and I wear it in all weather, including rain. It keeps my Blackberry dry and safe as a first line of defense.

After three months the stitching on the belt loop is loose but I think this is a great solution. Now, I am looking for a similar solution for a new Blackberry Bold 9900 when I upgrade.

I hope this review was helpful. Please add your vote.

While this case can be used for just about anything that will fit such as an Mp3 player, I decided to use it to store a compact digital camera while traveling. This would appear to be the main purpose of this case. Just a small case to take your camera around in.

Unfortunately most cameras either don't come with a case or it's just a sleeve to keep dust off of it. This is compact enough to fit the camera, short USB cable, and a few SD cards. And that's about it. There is a main section for the device and a smaller pocket inside for other slim items. It also features a loop on the outside that you can run a belt through. The case itself appears to be well made and durable; although as others have mentioned, there isn't a lot of padding in there.

Granted if there were additional padding, it would add to the bulk. But it wouldn't hurt to have a little more padding. So it's really more like an extra pocket to keep the camera in and give you easy access to the device while traveling. It'll definately help prevent scratches, cushion minor drops, and keep it relatively safe.

If that's what you're looking for, then I'd consider this item highly recommended.
Canon Powershot SX720 barely fits in there - you have to force it in to close the bag. Not practical.

When you have the markets tiniest camera with a 12x lens, the last thing you want is a bulky case that steals the pocket ability you paid for with the camera.

This Volta case is super slim and glides into your front pocket. The twin zippers open the clamshell case revealing the perfect size to carry the elph. The interior pocket holds the carry case for the micro-sd card adaptor. Sine barrel life is short you need a spare. An extra NB-9L drops to the bottom of this case and the elph rides just on top.

This is a perfect fit for the elph 520, and probably for the 110/130 series as well.

I have other Lowepro cases for my GPS, DSLR lenses and portable HD. All are well crafted and durable.

I just cannot get over what a perfect fit this case is.

I bought this case to hold my Kodak Zi8 pocket video camera.  It fits PERFECTLY (although there is no room for anything else in the case and the camera only fits in when you push it in head-first).  The overall construction is good (firm feel without being a hard case) and the dual zipper pulls make opening and closing the case easy.

Highly recommended if you are looking for a "glove like fit" for a Kodak Xi8!

I bought this for my son's nikon coolpix. It fits a little snug in there but it is serving it's purpose for an inexpensive case. I wanted to buy another one for my camera after I saw the prices of others in stores, but the price increased. Hoping it will go back down.

Got this for my Canon S100 camera.
This camera is famous for sucking the electricity out of its battery.
The size and design of this case let me store an extra battery and the camera.
It is the smallest case I have found that will take both.
It also has a belt loop which holds the case tight against your body.  You can also put the thing in your pocket - it's a perfect fit in most pockets.
The case is constructed of a semi-ridgid material which is smooth. It's inside is a soft material. There is little padding. Do to the combination of the two materials this doesn't seem to be a problem and makes a slimmer case posable.
It has two zippers on a fine tooth track. They seen pretty secure. The inside also will only open about three inches which makes loading the camera easy and safe.
As you can tell I am pretty pleased with this and do recommend you get it to protect what ever equipment you can fit in it.

ETA:  August 1, 2012.  This has ended up being my favorite camera case of them all.  It's thin so it fits almost anywhere, yet being hard on the exterior, and soft on the interior, gives lots of protection. My cameras I have stored in this case have NEVER had that first scratch.

I've never seen a camera case quite like this one, it's almost a combination of a hard molded camera case and a soft case.  It's nice and slim and doesn't take up much room in my bag.  Utilizes a quality, double zipper, and when the case is opened, there are gussets on the sides to keep your camera or whatever you have stored in there, from falling out.  It also has an inside storage pocket for a memory card, and a belt loop (double-stitched with heavy-duty thread) on the back.

Currently I'm using mine to store a smaller Panasonic Lumix camera.  Any of the smaller Lumix cameras less than 1" thick should fit fine.  Whatever you decide to store, don't go beyond 4-1/4" on the length or it may be too snug.

I've been looking for a camera case for some time for my smaller canon camera.  Most of the cases I've come across look pretty bad.

I own a camera case from lowepro (that I use to hold my dslr), and wanted something nice to hold my compact camera.  Something that I would feel safe with throwing in my bigger camera bag or where I keep my laptop + journals.

This case fits that bill, it's also small enough to fit in your pocket along with the camera inside (wonderful!), no more risking it getting scratched or beat up while it's in my pocket, just put on this case and then stick it in my pocket (it would be a big bulge if I stuck the case in my jeans pockets, but in my cargo pockets (which I tend to wear these kind of jeans / shorts when hiking) work perfectly (same for gym shorts).

The case looks nice and holds my camera with ease.

Pros:

Looks nice and professional (no (easily see-able) logos, no big obtrusive logo saying the brand name covering the entire item (that is viewable, again, the logo here is in black) )

Has space for your camera, as well as a small pocket where you can put your memory card (or if you like to take your camera with you while you jog, you can put your key in that area, no more key aggravating your leg!)

Cons:

If you have a really big fat old camera, chances are it will not fit, this is a sleek, modern camera case.  If your camera easily fits in your pocket, it will easily fit in this case, I love it).

Bottom Line:

Highly recommended.  Sleek, stylish, does the job (quite well), with an extra slot to hold your memory card (well thought!)

This is an ideally sized clamshell case to protect numerous small electronics as well as other items.  I purchased several of them to protect portable USB rechargeable batteries.  The zipper works smoothly and flawlessly on each case.  It is stiff, but not hard, so it has give which also adds to protecting its contents.  I am going to purchase a small dash camera yet this year. If the camera will fit, it is going into one of these cases to protect it when out of the vehicle.
Three months into using this case, it still looks pretty good, so it seems durable enough.  It was just millimeters too small to fit my digital camera, but I kept it for use with a

The Volta 20 is an excellent, but small, case.  The exterior is a nice matte surface that is firm yet gives a bit, it has an excellent quality zipper, a pocket on the inside to hold a memory card or two, and a belt loop for those that go that way.  One of the nicest features is the fact that the accordion flaps on the sides prevent it from opening all the way, minimizing the chances that it will flop open and drop your electronics on the ground.

The only downside is that the interior is slightly less padded than I would have thought, though I personally think that the rigidity of the outer shell makes up for it. The lining is, in my opinion, suitably soft to protect anything.

If your camera will fit (check the dimensions!) and you are looking for a high quality compact case to drop in a bag or breifcase, I can't think of a better choice than the Volta 20.

It seems to me the negative reviews of this product involve people who found the case too small for their device.  I actually measured mine and found this case fits my Lumix SZ7 perfectly.  I was not looking for an end all case, but one that would fit in my pocket for a quick trip.  I have a bigger Lowepro that carries my camera, charger, and extra memory.  It suits my needs and is the usual Lowepro quality.

This is a nice little case which can be used for a small camera, an mp3 player or cell phone.  It seems to be well made.  It has a clean, flat black appearance with an intergated belt loop on the back.  It has a double zipper so it can be zipped in either direction.  It has an "accordion" hinge so that the case can only be opened so far (which is handy if you use it to carry an item on your belt).  It has a nicely lined gray velour interior with a single pocket which could be used for memory cards or accessories.  The only thing keeping this case from five stars in my opinion is that there is almost no padding factor to the lining - it's very thin.  So if your item doesn't fill the interior, it will float around in there to some extent.  Other than that, it's a nice case.

The case fit our Canon Powershot SD880, with just a bit of room to spare.

I really liked the solid feel of the case - it almost feels safe enough for short drops to the floor, and feels somewhat weather resistant. Although it has a belt loop, my wife would really have much preferred an external loop. She worked around this by having the camera's loop strap hang out of the case.

The inside pouch is generous enough to fit the usual memory card sizes (such as CompactFlash or SecureDigital). However, you won't be able to store a spare battery in this pouch. In addition, any memory card that you drop in there will take some work to dig out - unlike some other cases, the card storage area is fairly deep but isn't compartmentalized.

As with any camera case, you really should handle it yourself, to ensure that it not only fits the target camera, but also fits in your storage area. My wife was really thrilled that it was compact enough to fit in her purse, and also didn't add much bulk to the camera itself.

Happy clicking!

If you want a form-fitting case for the rx100 v, this one works very well.  I have the Sony grip installed and it still fits though there is no room to spare for an extra battery.  An extra SD card will fit in the inside pocket, though.  Since I am usually carrying a front pack or small crossbody, I can put extra accessories in there.

I love the double zipper - I have an after-market wrist strap installed on my camera and the double zipper allows the case to fit snugly over the camera without impeding the strap.

I like a lot about the Lowepro Volta 20.  The outside shell is hard, but flexible, the zipper is of a nice quality, and there's a tiny pouch inside for a memory card.  It also has protective fabric on the sides so your camera won't fall out easily while opening and closing the case.

My one concern is that the interior might not be soft enough.  The interior fabric is somewhat rough and thin compared to other cases I have used.  I tend to worry more than most people and I feel concerned that the interior might end up scratching the LCD screen.

It's difficult for me to rate this product.  The exterior is great, but the interior is just average.  When I travel, I plan to use a small soft pack for my camera and then put it inside the Volta, which offers a harder shell to protect against drops and bumps.
It was small and didn't fit your standard point n shoot camera.

This camera case is a good fit for Nikon Coolpix S6100.

Pros:

* It's compact.
* It will fit the camera (Nikon Coolpix S6100) and spare battery.
* It has side flaps that help keep the camera from spilling out when you open the case.

I love these cases.  I have 8 point and shoot cameras that I loan out to high school students.  I have boxes of very nice soft cases but they tend to be a little bulkier and may not be as protective when the camera is dropped.

Because these cases are more form fitting and semi hard shelled, they’re smaller and more compact.  Their firmness actually protects the camera better than the soft cases I have.

Because they’re more compact, I think the kids are more likely to keep the cameras in the cases, too.

While I have boxes of soft cases, these are the ones I use.

I wanted a case for my Canon PowerShot S100, and this case fits the bill. It's snug without being too tight.
If you worked hard at it, you probably could cram a spare battery in the case with the camera, but it would be a very tight fit and good luck zipping the case closed. I didn't try it, however.
The case is a nondescript black with a low-key logo that doesn't scream, "Camera! Steal me!" when you carry it. There is a loop to attach the case to a belt or strap, and there is a small pocket inside that could hold a credit card, money or a spare SD card. The two-way zipper is also a nice touch.
This case is all I need as a hands-free way to carry my camera and a way to give it a bit of protection without being overly bulky.

Just what the Doctor ordered. Great little pouch to place my Concealed Carry 22wmr, stack barrel Derringer as well as a few extra 22 Maxi-mags in there. Camera Case, what camera case?  This is a mini handgun case, for my Concealed Carry defense.
These cases last about a couple of years, before the plastic covering starts to fray from your belt, but the fabric itself stays well beyond that for another year. Tough little case, and is highly inconspicuous to everyone. Everyone except one Officer got suspicious of my case, as to why was I wearing two cell-phone cases? Although this one was not a cell phone case, or maybe it was. He laughed his butt of, then asked me if I was concealed Carry. I said "yes", he laughed and walked away.

I bought this to hold a Canon S100.  This holds the camera very well with a lot of room left for SD cards.  The cover material is made from a semi rigid plastic that provides some protection from minor bumps.  The inner lining is made of a soft material that doesn't scratch the camera.  The one downside to the case is that it has a large belt loop.  The belt loop on the back is about 2.75 inches wide, much wider than most belts.  When hooked onto a belt, the camera case tends to sit mostly below the belt line and makes it a bit awkward.  It would have been better if the camera case belt loop was reduced by an inch or so so that the camera case sits in a more balanced position when hooked to the belt.  Overall a very nice camera case for an S100.

A good protective case for my Nikon cool pix s9600 fits tight with a pretty hard case with soft interior, it has a belt loop to attach Tia belt but it's not much bigger than an otter box belt clip holder for phone. You could get a usb charger cable and extra sd card but not a plug in the wall charger in interior side pouch. Id recommend to someone one looking for a small protective carry case for a small camera. Just be aware it won't carry much else but that can be a plus. Light and attractive, quality seems good

I bought this for my Canon S95 and it is way to slim to protect it. I did get the zipper to close but the case has no padding inside and it was so tight it bowed over the lens (if dropped flat I'm sure my cam would be damaged). So I went out and shopped the local stores and tried every one I could get my hands on Lowpro, Caselogic, etc. and I did find one that worked perfect for the Canon S95 IMO and it cost half the price too! Its the "Case Logic TBC302" and it was $7.00 locally. It is padded and fits the Canon S95 PERFECT! It also has a pocket that holds (2) spare S95 batteries and still room for an extra card, all in a case that appears smaller than the Volta 20. Amazon has it here if you want to check it out:

I just got this camera case in the mail yesterday along with my new Canon SD4000 camera. The camera is great, but so is this little case! It fits my camera perfectly, actually leaving a decent amount of space making it easier to hold an additional battery or SD card if needed. The pocket inside will be perfect for this as well. One reviewer noted that the inside of the case seemed scrathcy and they feared it would scratch the camera...well I don't see this to be a problem. It's not like it's a velvety soft fabric on the inside, but it's not one that will scratch anything as far as I can tell. And the outside of the case is somewhat hard which makes it great if you drop it.

Overall, great little case! I love Lowepro products :).

Hello All,
  This is just as Much a Review Concerning the Manufacturer LowePro
as it is a Review of the Product the Volta-20 & Amazon.More so I'd say.To lay it
all out clearly,my Wife Researched Digital Point & Shoot Cameras before deciding
on the Panasonic Lumix DMC-F2.Once we Ordered & put one through it's Paces (the
pink one)I quickly ordered & Silver one for myself,& as backup for hers as well.

 With our Eldest Daughters Birthday right around the Corner,& being Quite
Satisfied with the Performance & Functionality of the Pink & Silver DMC-F2's
already in our possession I quickly Ordered yet another in Black for our soon
to be 16year old Daughter.

 Now to keep them Protected yet still easily Identifiable as Who's Who's? I
began Ordering the LowePro Volta-20 Digital Camera Cases.First the Grey
one,then the Black.They Appear to be well Made,with Decent Materials &
Construction & Fairly Functional so a Third was in Order.

 A little Digging around on the LowePro Website Revealed that there was in Fact
a Third Color Offered in this Particular Case."Twilight Blue".All seemed right
with our small Slice of the World of Digital Photography so I quickly began the
Search for a "Twilight Blue" LowePro Volta-20 Case.

 This is were things got STICKY!Did Amazon have it? NO! Did I find it myself on
any other US Site,(including LowePro)? NO! In fact the only Sites I saw it
Listed on as "In Stock" during Searches were Australian Sites.Okay,no problem.I
like the Aussies just as much as I like everyone else.So I Contacted one of the
Sites & asked what one would Run in USD + Shipping.

 To my Dismay,they informed me that they do not Ship to the US.Having #3
Matching Cameras,and only two Matching Cases,& my Daughters Birthday soon
approaching giving up was not an Option.Not to mention I'm not the Quitting
Kind,I decided to get in touch with the Manufacturer LowePro,& ask them
directly.

 If the "Twilight Blue" was actually available in the U.S.,& were it could be Purchased.
Here's where this Review TRULY Merits #5Stars,& where in over 16years of doing
Business on the Internet I found myself Impressed by the Promptness,Efficiency
& Customer Service of a Company for the first time.

 Checking my e-Mail I saw one from LowePro literally within a few Minutes.
Thinking it's surely one of those Auto Responses,"Thank you for contacting customer
service,we will get back to you as soon as possible,have a nice day" kinda
thing I went ahead and Read it anyway.

 To my Surprise it wasn't a Auto Response,but an actual Representative REAL
LIVE PERSON from the Company responding to the e-Mail I had sent through their
Site only Moments ago.Even MORE surprising still He had already Tracked Down
the EXACT Model and Color (presumably through his companies records of sales)
that I was looking for,& e-Mailed me a Link to the Webpage.

 Long Story Short I quickly Ordered the Final LowePro Case needed from the
Second Party Website,& it's on it's way here as we Speak.

 In Closing,if I have to tell you how INCREDIBLY Rare this Scenario is,then you
haven't done much Business on the Internet.

Thank You LowePro,TOP NOTCH!
  Chaz

This is a replacement for the exact same model that I've had for several years and 3 or 4 cameras. It's been a perfect fit for my point and shoot cameras. I carry this all the time. When cycling I have in a jersey pocket where it is constantly subjected to sweat. I wear on my belt when I'm out hiking or walking. Easy to access the camera. The outer covering was coming off but that didn't affect the function. The zipper finally failed so I was forced to retire it. I was very happy to see that Lowepro still offered the exact same model.

This case is pretty ideal for a modern point and shoot. It's very compact, fitting the camera perfectly so that it doesn't bounce around a lot. Despite this small size there's still room for an extra sd card, or other small accessories. Unfortunately you're not going to be able to fit a charger or even a USB cable in this case but I usually leave that stuff at home so this limitation hasn't been an issue for me.

Other people might prefer a softer case with more padding. While it is true that this case doesn't have a ton of padding it is somewhat rigid, providing crush protection that a soft, padded case doesn't seem to provide as much of. To me this case protects against the kind of problems that I expect to have when transporting this camera, such as having heavy books or other items in my backpack crush the camera. I've had this case for over a year now and have been very happy with it.

My nephew is obsessed with this camera!

Whew.. this thing.  If it actually had made it to my nearly 8 year old daughter, the printer paper door lever would have broken off immediately.  Not even because she's clumsy, but because it sticks out really far, and isn't very reasonably placed.  Aside from that, it was pretty easy to get started, I guess.  I couldn't believe the internal memory only had the capacity for 1 photo..but we still moved on to printing.  This is where we decided that this item is really garbage.  You can't make out the image at all.  I tried different lighting...nothing worked.  The images were kind of scary.  The paper is the same as credit card receipts.  Luckily the return process with Prime has been working out so far.  Looking forward to my refund.  I NEVER return things.  I hate the hassel, but this is worth it.  Okay, I'm done ranting about my disappointment.

Great camera and fun for kids. Technically the picture quality as fine...for kids. Don't expect your iPhone quality results and you won't be disappointed. It is a little bulkier than expected but my daughter didn't even notice. Fun, easy to use, charges fast and was an immediate hit in our house. Refill paper on here for $7.99.

I got this crafty cam as an activity to have at my little girl's sixth birthday. The other girls really had a fun time posing and taking pictures. But the fun wasn't over then, with the crafty cam they can even paint, color, and decorate. You should have seen how much glitter they used, I'll have to buy more next time!

Exactly what it is supposed to be. Works like a charm, and after adding a 64GB memory stick, my daughter can take upwards of 17,000 5MP pictures. She is absolutely in love with it. It prints great quality fun black and white pictures and takes great 5MP pictures for the kid that the family can look back on to see her journey.

I collect children's toys and sell them on ebay. Let me tell you I was super excited to find this crafty cam from sunny and fun. It's such a cute little device, the kids really seem to enjoy it. I let the kids in my neighborhood borrow it sometimes. I'm sure I'll get a lot of good bids for it on ebay.

The crafty cam is a great way to get kids to learn and create together. I got it for my daycare group and we taught the kids about cameras and how to take photographs. They liked that part, but they liked coloring and decorating the prints even more. Whoever designed this camera knew what they were doing, because the kids can't get enough of it.

I bought this camera for my nephew for Christmas. At the time there were no reviews so I bought it fingers crossed. It’s great! The picture prints black and white only. The quality up close is pretty decent but declines as you get farther. There are various settings and backgrounds that can be used also. He loves it and we’ve already gone through a whole roll of paper (which was probably 50 +/- pictures). Would definitely recommend!

This is a breeze to use. Everybody loves it and wants to take a picture. Bought for 10 yr old girl. It has been used hy the entire household. Ages 2 thru 69. Very very great gift. Inexpensive and low cost paper/film. Does not disapoint. I've boughten 3!!! And recomended several to friends that have bought one. Great to just let the kids have at it. Thermal paper prints right away. Just a wonderful item.

I have two little girls, 4 and 5 years old, and I wanted to get them something fun but also educational, something that would teach them a skill they can use later in life when mommy's no longer there to protect them. As soon as I laid eyes on the sunny and fun crafty cam, I knew I had found it. The girls enjoy coloring but most importantly, they're learning how to be future photographers. A skill all women should know.

I've always thought of kids toys as a waste of money. What do the kids learn from playing with toys anyway? but when I saw this crafty cam I knew it was much more than just a toy for fun. I gave it to my son and taught him how to take photos, then he went outside to play and taught his friends how to photograph. If more toys like this we're made in america, we'd beat those chinese for sure.
Only one downside. We didn’t realize it only had enough storage to take one photo on it without an SD card. Now that we have one all is good!

Love this camera for the little ones that want a Polaroid camera but mom and dad know this is not a good investment yet.  Perfect for kids 10 and under.  Images are “like the ones from chuck e’ cheese” according to my child.  Picture quality is poor due to gray scale, but lots of fun.  The refill paper is not terribly expensive which is great!  The micro SD card is not I listed but you can find a nicely priced one on amazon.  My child loves this camera because of the instant print and is now able to paste these photos into a journal or sketch book.

I bought this not expecting much.  It's reminiscent of the pictures you'd take with your Gameboy/at ChuckECheese when you were younger (and to swap with friends).  This did not disappoint.  It took a few tries to figure out the settings, and to wait a few moments after the flash for the display.  It took less than 10 seconds from photo to print.  This will be perfect to use at a photo booth for kids. It's simple to use AND uses thermal paper rolls, which is so much cheaper than polaroids or zink paper. If you are looking for quality pics, this is not for you.  If you like the fun of taking a ton of b/w, grayscale grainy pics meant to be swapped, this is perfect.  Young children will have fun with this camera; older adults that remember their Gameboy cameras and birthday parties at ChuckECheese will love this too.
I couldn't return it because I have to pay for the shipping, it didn't work.
Disliked how the camera worked. Not like what I expected.

I got this wondering if it would print anything of quality. I charged before I gave it to my child and tried a picture out and was surprised. It printed in under 5 seconds and the quality was good. My teenager got many nice gifts for Christmas, but this turned out to be the favorite. What is great is you can take 1000's of pictures for the price of one refill of the other instant camera. Several friends bought this camera after seeing  ours. Just make sure you adjust the settings and the refill are register paper.

UPDATE: I decided to give it another chance and found the settings menu. Changing the settings made a world of a difference. It now prints on par with the other I bought, I think I still like the other better because it is more compact and the plastic feels less cheap than this one. But the other was $35 and I got this for $25 last week (since then the price has gone up to $35 as well). Play with the settings and this works well.
*********************************************************
Skip this one and buy a different thermal printing camera. I bought this and another (with a cheesy bear on it...) the other prints darker better quality pictures. They are meant to be lofi, but comparatively this camera sucks. I gave the other 5 stars. This one gets 2.
See my photos to compare the light picture of this and the darker more detailed picture from the other. I am going to return this and get another of the other.

I love this camera! I got it on sale for around $20 and I wish I had purchased a few! The photo quality isn't amazing but it's way better than I expected. You can change the pixel settings (5, 8, 11mp are the options) but I generally keep it on the lowest. It's fairly easy to learn to use - though I still haven't figured out how to add the decorative frames to photos.

One thing to note: Sometimes it takes a couple minutes for the camera to warm up enough to print when you first turn it on. In other words, if you turn it on and try to print immediately, you'll get blank paper. Also you can operate it without an SD card but it'll only hold one photo at a time. You can print the same photo multiple times.

product_title: SABRE Fake Security Camera With Night Sensor IP44 Rated Weather Resistant LED Lights Automatically Turn On When Dark Realistic Design Deters Intruders Battery Operated Fake Dummy Camera Black
product_description: PERSONAL PROTECTION YOU CAN TRUST SABRE is the 1 pepper spray brand trusted by police consumers a leader in the personal safety category REALISTIC WEATHER RESISTANT DESIGN This dummy security camera looks and blinks like a real bullet camera perfect for deterring intruders and theft in residential and commercial spaces This camera is IP44 rated and can be safely used outdoors VISIBLE AT NIGHT Infrared LED lights automatically come on at night making it more visible to intruders in the dark and add to the realistic design of the camera EASY TO INSTALL SABRE Fake Security Camera With Night Sensor requires no wiring and installs in minutes Requires two AAA batteries not included STAY SAFE WITH FREE SECURITY INFORMATION Feel secure with every SABRE product Packaging includes links to informative videos and information to help secure your home or office so that in the face of danger you are better prepared

reviews.review_body: Fantastic product.  My church, which is located in such a way that it is not visible to neighbors, has a prominent dumpster.  We need to discourage people from leaving their non-church related trash at or near our dumpster, but cannot afford to install a real surveillance camera.  This device perfectly meets our needs.  Coupled with a "this area is under surveillance" sign, the camera does indeed deter folks from using our trash services as theirs.  Very pleased.

I use this to supplement my real security cameras to give greater coverage to my yard. I think it looks real on the corner of my shed and feel having it there is a good thing. I may replace it later as I make enhancements to my system but overall as a deterrent, I think it does the trick and is priced right.

Even though I have several real security cameras,  I use a couple of fake cameras in very obvious locations.  The idea is to be a deterrent and also to prevent thieves from stealing my real security cameras (trust me this is a growing trend especially with the cost of the new cameras these days).  This Sabre fake camera looks realistic and the flashing LED lights are a great addition (though having to replace the AA batteries can become tedious).  In the event that a thief steals this camera I will not be out more than a few bucks and I will have the footage of their theft from my real cameras which are more concealed.

Overall this looks real and is not excessively priced so its easily a 5 star product.

This fake video camera looks like a real one and the red light going on and off makes it seem to be working. It was very easy to install. It only takes minutes It seems to me that people should either get a real one or this fake one to help assure that their property is safe.

This is completely ridiculous.  It looks completely fake and may be a deterrent only because the intended offender is too busy taking pics of it to share with friends and laughing he/her proverbial butt off.  It's also comically small.  Add the LED lights and it will only draw attention to whatever it is you are trying to protect. I've read reviews how, if used inside, helps create the scene that someone is home.  Well, so does a timer and a single lamp.  Pass on this one unless you are using it for a low budget spoof type of video. This stinks. For real.

I had hoped that this camera facsimile would look a little more realistic, so I could add it to our home's security system. Specifically, I wanted to put this on one wall, so that when a bad person tried to avoid this camera and the "pictures" it takes, the person would turn toward the actual camera, which is well hidden. It seemed like a good idea at the time.

But this camera, which comes in that sealed plastic covering which is such a bear to remove, looks as fake as it is.  I could move the real camera to some area beside this one, so I could catch burglars looking at it and laughing.  I don't think it would fool anyone.  Too bad.
This is not going to fool any real burglar, since people have these for real everywhere now, but for my purposes, with teenagers and young adults around when I'm not home, it might deter someone.

The camera looks real enough and does what you'd expect. Ultimately even real cameras are merely a visual deterrent. They will help after the fact for investigations but on their own won't prevent anybody from breaking into your home. The fake camera gives your home the appearance of being an unappealing target. Hopefully would-be thieves see it and move on to a more attractive target.

When I worked retail we relied on fake security equipment to deter theft. It's no different for home owners. I mounted the Sabre fake camera to the side of my garage and, from a distance, it looks like the real deal. Installation was simple and accomplished in just minutes. I have a real home security system, but I'm all about adding additional crime deterrents, and this is a very economical option. $15 is a deal for added security.

I like this as it seems like it’s been a very good deterrent. Ever since  I have put this up on my car park I have had no problems with anyone messing woth my parking area or my car. Years ago I had a motorcycle and car stolen. Wish they had these back then.

This fake camera looks like the real thing.  It was easy to install with just two screws that are provided.  It should keep would be burglars away, we also have a sign on our property stating security cameras in use.  A burglar was giving an interview on TV and he said that he avoids homes that have security measures in place or even a beware of dog sign, he figures he can go to another house in the neighborhood that doesn't have any security measures.

I only got  a fake camera in my order (not the keypad that it said when I ordered.) But even if I had, I doubt I would have put up more of this. I got it for my shed. We'd had some car break ins recently in the neighborhood and I figured a camera would dissuade criminals. And maybe it is. But not because of the red lights, which went out the day I put this up. And up close this looks really cheap. I don't recommend it.

Easily mounted and runs off of 2 AA batteries. When the light goes down there is red glow that emanates from the device making it appear as if it were a CCD camera. The construction is simple yet does appear to be a security camera. It does not appear to be waterproof so be sure to mount in place where it is not subject to direct rail and/or weather.

This fake camera does not look all that real. It has a blinking red light - have you ever seen a real camera with a blinking red light? You must mount it by drilling three holes. But if this were real, the  hidden wire would be going somewhere. Any real burglar or geek would know that if this is mounted in a place that the wire would not be it must be fake. Attach it to the post on the porch? How did the power/signal cord get into the post? The two AAA batteries (NOT included) last 90 days. Better to not use the blinking light anyway. In which case the thing could be made for  $1.99 without the battery, night sensor and LED.

Businesses especially should avoid fake cameras. If someone is a victim in the vicinity of the camera they could sue because the camera isn't real and they felt protected. A dead REAL camera has plausible deniability, at least.

I'm not impressed.

This does look like some security cameras and could fool some that only take a quick glance. Just be sure to mount it in a place that would normally have a real camera (hint: not somewhere unlikely to have a power source).

Now for the test with two people at the same time (after this test, I didn’t look for more participants): thirteen year old neighbor noticed we had a new camera; eleven year old grandson noticed that we had a new fake camera. I might move it to the bedroom he uses when he visits.

I got this Fake Outdoor Security Camera with Night Senor, for one side of our house. This camera was easy to install but it's a fake. It looks real for far away but won't fool anyone from nearby. It's a decent fake but it won't go very far.  It's very cheap so keep that in mind.

We had mail theft in our neighborhood so replaced it with a locked mailbox but wanted a fake camera as a deterrent. The camera looks pretty real and installs with a few screws. A red light blinks to seem real. The downside is the batteries do not even last a month. If you install the camera over a doorway, you have to constantly take out the ladder to replace the batteries.
For less than $20, it is a cheap alternative. From a distance, I don’t think anyone can tell if it is fake.
We eventually installed a Ring doorbell which has a real camera and many security features.
This Sabre camera serves a function. It is easy to install, looks real, and inexpensive.

The product page says "Sabre Home Security Burglar Deterrent—Fake Security Camera, Fake Security Keypad and TV Burglar Deterrent" as it sells all the Sabre Home Security Burglar Deterrent product all on one page. You need to pick each one and order separately. This review is for the "Bullet Camera" variant that is being sold on Amazon.

I must admit the fake Bullet camera does look real but not exactly like what is pictured on the Amazon product page. I think this a new and improved model (HS-FSCR-B) that has light sensitive "LDR" which Senses ambient light and automatically illuminates the IR LEDs and they produce faint Red color glow in the night just like most Day/Night Camera produce. It uses 2 x AAA batteries. See the pictures and you will notice the changes in new design. It also includes mounting hardware. It is crucial to mount this fake camera in such a way that it makes sense as this one does not have any fake cable.

Bottom-line: It is a FAKE Bullet Camera. But It might make Burglar think twice but the Burglars are smart these days.

Rating with three stars!

This security camera looks acceptably realistic; it’s not waterproof, so places to mount it are limited. The red infrared lights that glow at night are similar to those on my real security cameras, so they look realistic. If you can’t get the real deal security cameras, I would invest in getting a few of these. I think they will  deter an intruder. This unit requires 2 AAA batteries, which are not included. Screws and mollies are included.
I guess this is one of those 'you get what you pay for' and this was very cheap. Wouldn't recommend it.
It moves all the time outside with the slightest wind. The lights don’t stay on no matter how many times I change the batteries. I would not recommend this product.
Very easy to install, now if they will just work to detour the thieves

Though I haven't run into issues of someone stealing my packages, I just feel it might be a good idea to put something in front door area to discourage such theft activities.

For that reason, I am getting this fake security camera for installing at the front door side. This security camera is smaller than those installed in commercial areas. I would expect it to be a little bigger to make it more visible. It also does not have the shinning "silver grey metal" color that I would like to see, which is more close to those security cameras installed in commercial buildings.

Powered by 2 AAA batteries, the built-in ambient light sensor can sense the surrounding light condition. When at dark, it mimics the real security camera and gives out steady red light (like infrared light). During day time, there is no RED light coming out of it.

Well, I would prefer it has one LED blinking light running the whole time, day and night. I just feel the "LED blinking" action makes people the unit is really "working".

All in all, I am not too impressed by this fake security camera, specifically, it does not have the flashing LED light.

To be clear, the fake camera I received does not look like the one in the photo on this Amazon page; it is black, does not have the words "CCD camera" anywhere, and doesn't have that fake electrical wire. In short, it doesn't look quite as realistic as the one in the photo on the website as I write this today. That was a bit of a disappointment. Perhaps they will change to photo to match the actual product.

This is a cheaply made plastic item from China, but what do you expect from a fake camera? It serves only one purpose -- to tell burglars and criminals to go elsewhere. I suggest mounting it high so people can't touch it or see it too closely. I once knew a burglar, and he said he'd never try to enter a place with security cameras if there was a softer target in the neighborhood. So yes, a fake camera can be a deterrent, and I also have a small placard that says "NOTICE: For your protection, all activity on these premises is monitored by security cameras."

It's true, I have a real, motion-activated camera inside the house, but all that can do is take video of the person who is robbing my house. It's a good idea to also have something outside that tells the burglar to go elsewhere. If you can afford a full-house alarm and camera system, obviously that's the best way to go. But for about $12, this fake security camera is a cheap and effective deterrent.

product_title: Lanparte FFGR 01 Adjustable Gear Ring for Follow Focus Black
product_description: Top grade rubber gear Maximum diameter 105mm Industry standard pitch 0 8

reviews.review_body: Works great on a number or lenses. It sticks out a little more than my dji one but gets the job done.
Thought it was a bit pricey at first but after using it for some time I think it was the best option for me, they work as advertise and look and feel really nice.

product_title: Burris Optics Signature Fixed Power 30x Eyepiece
product_description: Country Of Origin China Product Type Sporting Goods Item Package Dimensions 8 L X 6 W X 6 H Item Package Weight 3 0 Pounds

reviews.review_body: I am a huge fan of Burris Optics!  I cant believe this eyepiece is at such an amazing price here on Amazon.  In order to call accurate corrections for shooters, this eye piece is a must have.  The reticle and glass are crystal clear and are also covered by the Burris forever warranty.  This puts the Burris Signature HD Spotter light-years ahead of competitor scopes in the same price range that dont offer reticle eye pieces and the super clear glass. I highly recommend this eye piece.
I have long suspected that the Zen-Ray ED2 and the Gen 1 Razor HD were built under the same roof by the same hands.  This EP works (and is accurate) in the Zen-Ray ED2.
I love this spottinv scope so the extra eyepiece is awesome

Just wanted to get this out there in case anyone else was interested; this eyepiece fits and works on my Swarovski STS-80 spotting scope!
I'll try to update this as I get some more time through the glass....

I purchased a Vortex Razor 20-60X85 (Gen. 1 Model # RZR-A1) Spotting Scope on close out. Vortex dis-continued the scope replacing it with a re-designed model (Gen. 2). They also dis-continued their 30X ranging eyepiece and none where available anywhere. A posting on Sniper's Hide suggested this Burris eyepiece worked perfectly, so I took a chance and bought one. Sure enough they were right and it works to my observation +,- 2% accuracy for ranging. The quality of the eyepiece is excellent with top resolution & clarity. I think it equals the quality of the factory Razor zoom eyepiece. Warning if you have a Gen.2 Vortex Razor spotter, it will not fit or work. There was a design change.

I got a 1st generation Vortex Razor 20-60x85 spotting scope but, I could not find the eye-piece with the reticle from Vortex. I heard that this Burris eye-piece is compatible with my Vortex. And it is!! I am very happy with this eye-piece and reticle. I wish my scopes have this reticle. It's cheaper than the vortex one and works great! The best thing is it is available.

I have this Burris 30x, as well as the Vortex branded 30x lens for my first generation Vortex Razor 85mm.  This lens fits the scope bayonet mount perfectly and locks into place.  I’ve done a lot of A/B’ing to decide which to keep, and the view is basically indistinguishable.  I wonder if it’s the same glass, rebranded and in slightly different casings.  The view in both is noticeably wider at 30x than the 20-60x zoom that comes with the scope.  If you’re wanting a 30x for your 1st generation Razor, then this is a no-brainer replacement for the Vortex 30x lens that is very hard to find.
I purchased this for a vortex razor HD spotting scope, it fits perfect, and the reticle is a tremendous improvement when spotting and calling shots on target.
Great add-on to the HD Signature spotting scope. Extra 10x magnification from the factory 20x and the Mil redicle makes a huge difference when spotting long range targets.

Fits great on my 1st Generation Vortex Razor 20-60x80 spotting scope (RZR-A1) since the Vortex version has been discontinued.
The eyepiece is just as clear and crisp as the original eyepiece on the razor.
In testing, the reticle seems to be magnified by about 2.5%.
This seems to be consistent with what other people have achieved.
In order to get a perfect distance when ranging, the result would need to be multiplied by 1.025.
