The strap is secure, not bulky, and removable.  I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a case with that criteria in mind.

Saying that this fits a Lumix LX7 is like saying that a softball fits inside a coffee mug. I don't have any filters or attachments on the camera. Widthwise or lengthwise, it ain't even close. I wish it fit because it truly is a great looking and smartly designed case. I was pretty bummed out, actually. Before you buy, check the internal dimensions carefully against your camera. Don't go by the fact that your camera is listed in the item description.

Was looking for a case that would fit on my belt for an upcoming trip to Disney World. I had gone the route of just keeping the camera in my pocket in the past and while it worked for a long time, it can be a pain digging it out each time I want to take a picture.

My camera, a Sony DSC-HX30V fits very snugly in the case, almost a little too snugly. I had to work slightly to get the flap to snap shut but I got it closed. I'm hoping that if I leave the camera in the case for a while that it will stretch slightly.

Packaging was surprisingly good for the $20 pricetag. The case came with multiple straps, inside a cloth drawstring bag inside a plastic bag.

I have a Canon Powershot SX260 HS.  I thought it was a leeetle bit loose in the case.  Found on Amazon black felt sheets, sticky-back, 4" x 4", 1/8" thick, easy to cut with a utility knife, cut a piece to fit the bottom, the back, the front, one on one side, in that order (of course the order doesn't matter).  Now it's snug and pretty close to a perfect fit.  Just an idea.

I purchased this for my new Sony RX100 II camera. I wanted a form fitting case that I could wear horizontally on my belt, and this was the only one I could find.  I was a bit concerned about fit because the Model II is slightly bigger than the last model and its published dimensions are slightly thicker than the published interior dimensions of the case.  But the camera still fits nicely in this case.  Snug but not too snug.  I was surprised that the case came complete with both matching leather wrist and neck straps, and wrapped in a plastic back inside a cloth pull-string bag, inside another plastic bag.  That was a lot of high-end packaging for a $20 product.  The magnetic snap at the bottom of the case works well, and it is easy to pull the camera out for quick shots. This is an excellent case if you want as compact a case as possible for the RX100.  Mega West was an excellent vendor too.

MegaGear has at least three cases of similar size and every time I order one they seem to send me a similar, but wrong-sized case.  The reviewer here who received one that snugly fit the RX-100... that's the one I want and the one that I have (sometimes) received in the past when I have ordered this Amazon stock number.  Reordering this item again, instead I was shipped a much larger case, labeled as for the RX-100, but it is so large that the RX-100 rattles around inside of it.  I've ordered the smaller model Amazon part number, but sometimes I get the too-small-for-the-RX-100 model and some times I get the model that fits the RX-100.  Very frustrating.

The case is well made and comes in a cloth bag.  I'll probably use the bag more than the case.

The Sony RX100 II fits in the case the way your clothes fit in an overstuffed suitcase.  If you squeeze the case closed you can make it latch closed with the RX100 II in it.  If you hold the case with one hand, you can pry the RX100 II out with your other hand.  I am leaving the camera in the case and hope the case stretches.

The RX100 is the problem, not the MegaGear case.  The lens sticks out from the body while the front of the case is flat.  The needs a cutout for the lens like on Canon's case for their S110.  The case flap is enough to protect the lens area.  I'll let the case stretch for a while, and cut the front to fit the lens bulge.  If I had a smaller camera, I would rate the case much higher.

I bought the RX100 II because I wanted a small camera.  I like a horizontal belt case.  This case is useable with the RX100 II.  Other horizontal cases are too big.
Fits my camera snugly. The belt clip is handy, better then hanging around my neck. The case is solidly constructed.

This case does NOT fir the Nikon P310.  Yes, you can squeeze it in by force and then apply more force to snap it shut but I certainly hope you don't treat your camera that way.  Also the P310's lens assembly can accidentally attempt to deploy while you try to situate it in the (too small) case. It simply does not fit properly.  I returned it and ordered a "Universal Nikon Case for Nikon Coolpix ....".  Much better case for just a bit more.  It did take a while to get here as it is shipped directly from China.  Worth the wait and the few dollars more to have for a nice case that won't damage my P310.

I've just bought Panasonic Lumix ZS15 and looked for a proper camera case.
I don't understand people when they invest good money buying camera and then - they buy some kind of a camera case that looks like a little bag or zipped case that can't do the job.
A proper camera case, according to my humble opinion, must have:
* Be stiff enough to protect the camera, but doesn't look or feel as a metal or plastic box.
* Be convenient and comfortable to wear on the belt, (for this size of camera it must be vertically), has the option to carry with a strip and has easy quick and safe way to lock,(not by zipping).
* I don't need to carry on my belt accessories etc. The camera case must be as small as can be. Just enough for the camera.
* Looks and feels nice, elegant and proper production.
* Reasonable price. (The black color is chipper than the brown one, so I bought it, even though I would prefer the brown...)
Okay...So I searched all the lists at Amazon, and I found all the above musts existing in this camera case.
That's why I give the <MegaGear Protective Leather Black Camera Case> 5 stars ^_^...

I returned the product as it does not properly fit my SONY HX30V camera. I rated the product 4 stars however for its quality.
It stated that its a case for SONY HX30V, among others, but the Sony camera is a tight fit though you can still close the case. You have to use some force to put the camera inside the case and I am afraid that over time it would either scratch the camera finish or the side of the camera case. I would have retained the case if not for the tight fit.

product_title: YABER Y31 9500L Native 1920x 1080P Projector 2022 Upgraded Full HD Video Projector 50 4D Keystone Correction Support 4K Home Theater Projector Compatible with Phone PC TV Box PS5
product_description: Innovative One Click to Brighten 4D Keystone Correction Official Feature Sponsor of New Orleans Film Festival Our Y31 hd projector is the first projector with One Click to Brighten function and Auto Vertical Correction With manually 50 4D Vertical Horizontal Keystone Correction One Click Restore 25 zoom function very convenient to adjust the screen by using the remote control especially for the projector suspended from ceiling 1080P Native Resolution 1920 1080 Support Play 4k Video The projector with native 1920 1080 resolution remarkable 9800L Brightness and high dynamic contrast ratio of 10000 1 provides sharp and detailed images from HD content without downscaling or compression which is four times higher than 720p ensuring the best video experience HIFI Stereo Sound Latest Advanced Cooling System The LED projector has built in 3W dual stereo speakers with SRS sound system provides a great auditory sense experience without external speakers Updated an advanced and silent cooling system with 3 fans running simultaneously Adopt the latest SmarEco technology to minimize lamp power consumption to extend the useful life of the lamp to a maximum of 100000 hours 300 Giant Screen Wide Compatibility The video projector offers the projection size from 50 to 300 depending on the distance and 10ft is the recommended viewing distance Equipped with 2 HDMI ports 2 USB ports VGA port AV port this phone projector easily connects with TV Box Amazon Fire Stick TV Chromecast PC laptop tablet external speakers Xbox DVD player USB stick iPad iPhone Android smartphone Three year Lifetime Professional Support This 1080P projector is very suitable for home movie entertainment backyard games and party fun YABER provides 6 month back and 3 year repair lifetime professional technical support NOTICE Jerky or lag when playing videos is not a quality problem and can be solved by Firmware Upgrade Any problems please let us know anytime

reviews.review_body:
We couldn't be happier with this projector! We bought it as a Christmas gifts for our 3 children,  so that they could have a fun and safe socially distant way to spend time with friends during Covid. It was hands down the best purchase we've made. Five stars for sure. The picture quality is super crisp even when you enlarge it to fill a wall! Getting this one with the higher lumins was the game changer. The screen was crisp and bright, colors were how you would want them to be in a professional movie theater. Very happy with this purchase. I also bought a smaller projector (different brand) to try and compare (it had 5500 lumins where this one has over 7000) ....and it did not even compare. This one is bright/crisp. The other one was dull and a little fuzzy.
Make the jump and get this one if you want crisp and bright pictures (even in a room during the day!)  . You won't be disappointed.

This projector is the best for those who want to save a little money without sacrificing resolution or brightness on the image, if you want a good 1080p projector this one is for you. I rate it 5 stars since you get a lot for the money. Don't expect crazy dynamic contrast with projectors of this price range or to have a high refresh rate for gaming or watching sports. This projector works best when positioned on a shelf, setting it up to low or too high the tilt can deteriorate the sharpness of part of the projected image, so take that into consideration

This is an honest and professional review and I will compare it with what replaced it, Viewsonic px700hd. For those that don't want to read, understand that this is a Chinese projector and you are getting the usual "Chinese quality" with this projector which is not a good thing.

Overall it's built solid and the remote is nice and responsive and has great distance, I can point it at any wall. The fan however is somewhat loud, louder than any off the shelf desktop computer or laptop. The physical keystone works decent, not too accurate but it works, the digital keystone worked pretty well and can change pretty much any angle. I had it sitting on two nightstands stand on top of each other as it needed the height.

The quality of the image is hard to describe. It is sharp and has not the best brightness but on those two things, it's bearable. The part that is not bearable is the colors. Imagine running a giant magnet on the screen of an old CRT or tube TV and all the colors turn purple, that's what you're paying 500$ for and that's why I'm giving it the rating it's getting. I thought spending more means getting better quality but not in this case, because I could have bought a projector for 100$ that probably had better colors. I did spend more on a NAME BRAND projector, the cheapest one out there, and I'm completely blown away at how bad the Chinese projector is. Do not buy this as your home theater or tv replacement, I would even feel bad buying this for kids. Kids aren't animals they don't deserve something of bad quality. I got this projector for half price I guess on a sale so for like 250$. I started the return process after adjusting every setting professionally to get the colors right and it still didn't look worthy of what I spent.

I bought a used Viewsonic px700hd which is normally 400-500$ but used was 300-350$. Used and all I'll pay 100$ more any day for a name brand projector that displays colors correctly right out of the box. The difference is night and day. Night... and... day... Don't be fooled, if you want a cheap projector, go buy a cheap one for 100$ but if you want something you're going to be happy with, get a real projector. There's no in-between.

I really liked this projector for the first year or so.  Recently the picture has developed an orange discoloration.  I've tried to contact customer service at Yaber twice, but and yet to receive a reply.

Update 2/1/23
After back and forth with customer service, they did send a replacement product along with instructions not to run this projector for too long at a single time and ensure proper ventilation.

I can say the projector had more than adequate ventilation on my ceiling mount, but I was certainly a heavy user.

I found this particularly easy to set up and used it occasionally for various home theater viewings.  We had a special outdoor event with the neighborhood coming up and wanted to use a (brand new, never been used or set up) Firestick instead of the DVD player.  I had some trouble with the sound and could not figure out how to get to the Firestick controls for output. I emailed support with less than 24 hours until our event and they responded in only a couple hours!  And the information provided was easy to follow and complete - I did not need any further contact but decided to write and let the world know, they are legit!  Very easy and friendly!  Our event was awesome and everyone had a great time, thanks to vendor support!

Updated to 4 stars because the company gave me a refund which was very nice of them. I'd still avoid this projector.

I'll be honest. I got this because it was cheap & I wanted an LED light that would have a longer life than the halogen projectors I'd had previously.

The picture was always bright and crisp. It was noisy, however.

Additionally, a few months ago we noticed a browning on the right side of the screen, assumptively from some burning. Then today (11 months after we bought it) a black hole developed at the top right of the screen.

Support of course only lasted for six months. Ah well.
Video Player is loading.

This is a great projector for this price.  We wanted something relatively simple to casually watch movies on a big screen at home with the family.  This projector is perfect for that.  The picture is nice and bright.  The screen is comfortable to view with the lights off and curtains open, but best in total darkness.  We were able to connect it to our Chromecast.  The fan can be heard if the movie is really quiet, but with any movie noise you don't notice it.  My only complaint is that the connectivity is a little weird.  My husband is a techie and he had a little trouble getting it all set up through our receiver.  I have no idea what that means, but some of you will.  We still figured out a solution that works for us.  Overall, we are very pleased.  We got this pull-down screen with it, and have had no issues so far.

https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07QNVLGGF/ref=ppx_yo_dt_b_search_asin_title?ie=UTF8&psc=1

I have been using this product for a few months now and am posting my review. First part of my review is , its value for money and good to have if you are on a budget. This has all features you need for basic media projection and up to 120" viewing. quality is also good! no disappointment so far with the exception of remote which stops working anonymously despite of changing batteries.
Second part, not a super star - which i didnt expected it to be when i bought it. 3D viewing, Super High quality like Epson is not there. But again, i didnt expected it and this product works best for me.
overall I will keep it and recommend ..

NOTE: this was a refurb "Amazon Warehouse" item

I bought this with the idea of upgrading / replacing an older projector (Epson EX7210). On the surface, the specs look good. The Y31 is 1080p, compared to the Epson's 720p resolution. The Y31 puts out 7000 lux, while the Epson is rated at 2600. The bulb in the Y31 is a LED based unit which can go 100,000 hours between changes, while the quartz bulb in the Epson lasts about 4000 hours on average.

A great upgrade if your vision isn't so hot, or you need to see sharper detail.

Not so fast. Look at the two pics I attached. The Y31 produced the blueish image, while the Epson produced the more white image. Both pics were taken with my cell phone. No matter how much I fiddled with settings, I could NOT eliminate the Y31's blue tint -- what you see is the best I could do. Different HDMI cables made no difference.

See the difference in resolution? Maybe. Look at the "wolf creature's" cheek. I see more detail there, possibly. However, I also can see that the Epson image is more uniformly focused than the Yaber image (look at the time/date in the lower right corners of both pictures).

...and I still can't get past the dim output, which I hope is a flaw in this particular unit. Even the "High" output setting didn't really improve things much. So there you go. Whites aren't white.  The "bright" setting barely compares to a 7 year old projector. I'll be nice and attribute the shortcomings to a bum unit. However, i will also NOT be getting another one of these as a replacement.

Paid $183 for this Projector, definitely can not beat it at that price point. If you're willing to pay over $1000 for a true 4k projector  then disregard this review . For me  1080P  image works well with my Xbox and Roku stick. Few tips 1. Set the aspect ratio to point to point and the HDMI output to PC this  provides the most clear and accurate image. 2 Go with a dark room, it's a bright projector but bright light definitely washes out the image some . 3 Connect it to your surround sound if possible. The speakers are ok but not impressive. 4. Experiment with the settings and project it onto different colored wall/screens , a grey background seems to provide richer colors while a white  screen/wall provides more brightness and whiter whites.
Video Player is loading.

We bought this hoping it would be good enough for backyard movies. We were a little worried due to price point that it might not be that great, but it was perfect! We bought a 150 inch screen on here for $28 to go with it. We temporarily  put the projector on top of a 5ft ladder so we could use it this weekend. It was about 15 ft from the screen. It was perfect!  We used a aux cord to connect a speaker, and played movies with a mac book and hdmi to c cord. It was a perfect night and we are all so excited for cheap family movie nights on the new deck.

Actually very impressed with this little projector. My wife and I were planning to get a projector and screen for learning shows for the kids as we are trying to keep direct backlit screen viewing down for them.

I was originally looking at much more expensive projectors, but the virus situation a) pushed us to pull the trigger and b) the expensive ones weren't in the cards. So this Yaber unit was our compromise, as it was 1080p and seemed to have good brightness and features.

I was unsure when I first turned on, but after a little setup and tweaking settings this thing is awesome. Once I figured out the keystone adjustment a little better and tweaked color temp and color settings I am very impressed.

With 1.2 gain screen we were even able to turn on during the day with just closing some blinds (no where near close to being dark).

Colors are very good and pop, plus where it's native 1080p the picture is quite sharp. I really can't say enough how surprisingly impressed with this unit I am.

Also, if wondering, yes the USB on this will power a Firestick 4k so you don't need to use the power brick!

Not as good as the Yaber Y30, overall. I have the Y30, but also got the Y31 with the hope it would produce a larger picture, since it claims up to 300" while the Y30 claims 200".
At 13' away (I have a shelf on the opposite wall, so cannot move forward/backward), the Y30 produces a 115" picture, which was a larger picture than the Y31, even using the Y31's hardware zoom feature. The issue is that in order to get a focused picture at this distance, the picture size ended up a lot smaller. The Y30 didn't have this issue. Also the fan on the Y31 was loud, even on the lower brightness setting. Not like it was broken, just loud. When the brightness button is pressed to make it brighter, the fan is distractingly loud. The Y30 is much quieter. Also, we noticed blurring in the corners of the image from the Y31. Because of the placement of the shelf being dead center to the screen, I didnt have to use keystone correction, so that wasn't the issue. I will say that the picture was otherwise bright and sharp. It may work well if you can physically move the projector forward and backward.

I ordered this projector to use outdoors, and so far I am loving it.
I just received it this week, so have only used it three times: once inside and twice outside. Hope it holds up, but for under $300 I have been very happy with the quality.
Used it with a laptop and an old Apple TV, and getting it up and running from new in box to projecting was a breeze.
Indoors the sound was fine. It is NOT amazing surround-sound with deep bass, but you should NOT expect it to be. I could hear the show fine in the small room I had it set up in.
Outside the sound did not carry that well, but I didn't expect it would. I had ordered a separate dongle to run the content through and connected a small speaker with aux wire, and again, worked fine (tried with a soundbar as well, which sounded great, but don't want to lug that outside).
I tried setting up early evening outside, and projecting from about 15ft, and that didn't work (not sure if any would), but once it got dark out, it was great.
A few days in I would definitely order again.
Video Player is loading.

For an entry level native 1080p projector, the image quality is fantastic.  It does need to be in low light or dark rooms for best quality.  Mine is mounted about 12 feet up on the wall in a room that is about 30ft long and 15ft wide.  Right now I'm using the built in speakers and for some streams it works great, for others it just doesn't seem to get loud enough.  As an example: Batman the Animated cartoon I can play at level 25 and it is very loud.  However for the Avengers I need to put the volume at 80.  Both are streaming from the same service, VUDU.  So I'm considering adding a soundbar to the setup.

Image quality is stunning, especially for a $200 projector.  My son says it looks as good as our 60 inch LED TV.  Again you need to be in low light/dark room for the brightest picture.

I am not one to normally write reviews but with a product like this, I find reviews are very helpful and I utilized them when I decided to make this purchase. I will have to say, I am quite impressed! It was an easy set up and love it so much better than a regular tv. The kids love to be able to play their game systems on it along with movies and watching Street Outlaws is almost like being there! The whole family will get much use out of this and would highly recommend. Picture quality is fabulous, especially considering right now the picture is showing against a plywood wall painted white and not even on a screen yet or even regular dry wall. I figured the picture would look crappy against the wall being what it is but looks great as it is! Absolutely love this product. The speakers are great for our family room and plenty loud enough. The projector is not noisy while on and does not cause any distractions.

Unboxed and mounted and right away wasn't impressed.

1. The noise from the fans is loud. Much louder than I was prepared for, even on the low power setting. In order to see the screen well during the day, it would need to be set on high power brightness, but the noise is horrible.

2. The keystone and focal adjusters on the projector itself feel fragile and not tight. Any vibration would knock it out of alignment.

3. The menu appears 80s basic, super huge icons. There are English spelling errors in the menu. "ceilling"

4. My ceiling mount is 12' from the screen. I can not adjust the projector to fit the screen (which is already 90" wide) so the blue edges go over about 4" on both sides. I don't want to have to move my ceiling mount. This is NOT a short throw issue. There just isn't enough adjustment options. The adjusters on the projector are only for Keystone and Focus. NOT size.

5. It's bulky and doesn't look modern at all. Folks may not have an issue with that.

Best thing about it, when you power down, it's off. Silent. No running for 2 minutes to cool down. I liked that. Too bad that it's going to be returned.

This is a gem. I did my research and bought one other projector that was great except it was only sharp in the middle, and the caption words appearing at the bottom of the screen were fuzzy and could not be made any sharper despite the picture being focused. So I returned it and bought this projector. The issue was gone immediately. This Yaber projector is sharp all the way through. I use a decent screen in the living room as in the attached photos, and it is very bright and focused at every bit of the screen. Notice the vivid colors and super bright images even with backlighting behind the screen.
The device itself is very elegant and quiet during operation. You can hardly hear the fan running. The remote is very responsive and even faster than my Fire TV stick. I found that the best sound setting is to set it to "Music" as the default standard audio setting is low unless you want to crank the volume all the way up. The Hi Def feature of the native HDMI is extremely nice and you won't be disappointed at all. I would definitely recommend this product if you are shopping for a quality projector.
This is a great projector, but I think I need a new bulb since it is getting somewhat dim when I use it in a room. Where might I find a replacement bulb for this product?

I was very surprised about the quality of this projector!  Most of these projectors at this price range have a very low light output of less than a 1000 lumens.  At 8000L you are guaranteed a great picture, even with it pulled back to a large screen size.  The focus and vertical and horizontal adjustments are easy to use and the controller has an intuitive layout that I was able to navigate in the dark without looking at it within the 1st 1 minutes of using it.
The only negative would be the fan noise can be a little loud if you are sitting right next to it.  But with a decent sound-bar and it mounted on the ceiling, you wont notice it.  Also during the day with the curtains drawn it produces an ok picture, but I would recommend a higher lumen for a well lit room.  Overall I'm very happy with my purchase and will be using it on a regular basis.

I've been looking for a quality projector to use in a tight space for my golf simulator.  I needed to have a unit that was capable of keystone that wasn't just top and bottom.  This projector offers a 4D keystone which means I'm able to mount the projector behind me in the upper right corner and out of the way so our shadows don't show on the screen.  The 4D Keystone allows us to adjust the picture to fill the screen as though it was projecting straight onto it.

This product was packaged with quality and the project feels very high quality.  The picture quality is amazing and can be seen without having to be in darkness.  The daylight from the windows did not take away from the brightness of the picture.  The product was very easy to setup and the included  remote makes easy operation a breeze.

I recommend this product to anyone looking for a great projector with high quality and a bright excellent picture.

I had not heard of Yaber before and was a little hesitant to buy the brand and at this price was prepared to be disappointed. The reviews were good and so I gave it a shot.

It came down to this one and another one that was about  $150 more, I am so glad I gave it a shot. I tested it both inside and outside and am quite pleased with the image quality and brightness.

From my testing, I will be able to have an outdoor movie night start at sunset when the sky is still lit and people can see to get around and situated. I can also watch movies inside the house at any point in the day.

The one issue that I had was that it took a while (~ 15 to 20 min) to get a good picture. The presets didn't do it, so I went into the user-defined color and picture settings and played with those before I was happy with the results. If you are hypersensitive to picture quality you may be disappointed. I think the image after adjustments would be satisfactory for 95% of people.

Advice from my errors on adjusting the image quality:
Don't try to make the adjustments with a movie or show on, use a statice display gradient test image that has both color as well and black and white sections and gradients.

I have been using LED projectors since Christmas 2011 as my primary living room TV/Home Theater solution.  The Yaber is an excellent unit, and has a great remote as well as simple menus and setup.  I was up and running very quickly with this projector.  I even use it upside down and the menu setting for "Ceiling mount" was easy to choose and logical compared with other projector menus.

Daytime use:  This projector is not bright enough during the day unless I block all the windows and two skylights that I have.  During the night time, however, it is extremely bright, crisp, clear and smooth for video.  The price is also excellent.  My prior LED projector was about $650 (Optoma ML500 and ML550) but it was also significantly smaller than this one.

Get this projector with a solid mount and you will be very happy!

I’ve had a career working with audio and video technology including all manner of projectors.  I have to write this review because this affordable projector has impressed me.  My previous projector was a big name big dollar but it was 10 years old and the lamp finally burned out.  I looked at replacement bulbs and realized that I could take a chance at this device for nearly the same price as repairing my old “Cadillac”.  Wow, this projector beats it in every aspect.  It’s  bright, clear and has good color.  At 1080p native, it’s an upgrade at less than a 10th the price.  With the LED light it should last much longer.  I’ve even tried it with my PS4 playing a racing game and it didn’t miss a frame that can tell.  I’ve only had it a week, so time will tell, but I am impressed.  It’s fan is a little loud, but I’d rather know it’s properly vented than have it melt.  Saying good bye to my old projector, it’s on the top shelf waiting to be disposed.

One month later.  This is still incredible.  How did they make this for this price!

This is the best projector I have ever owned, the colors are bright the resolution is amazing and the sound is really clear, what!!! It all comes in the box? It honestly comes with everything that you need To get started, It has the power cable, VGA cable, the remote control, the quick set up book that is in 6 languages, I found the quick start guide made it really easy to setup and get to watching our movie right away, I also used the HDMI smartphone adapter wich is a cable that I personally purchased to maximize and facilitate the use of the projector, because with that i can literally watch anything from my smartphone anywhere I want, we don’t have a projector screen yet, so we projected it onto our wall and we were really surprised with the quality and brightness of the video picture, it is fantastic! In fact there's no worries if you decided to take the machine with you anywhere you go, all you need to do is to plug in the HDMI cable adapter to your smartphone and kick back and enjoy, also the cooling fan on this projector seems to be quieter then others that I encountered in the past, overall this is a great quality machine, I wouldn’t replaced it for our TV as an everyday used but it’s definitely great to give us that cinema experience and to make for some really fun family movie nights! We all love it.

I ordered this projector with the intention of garden movies under the stars.

I checked it out when it first arrived. The picture was crisp and bright, even on a distant wall making it at least and 80” wide display (we were about 10’ from the wall). The image adjustment for different viewing angles was very flexible, and even the interior speaker was a quality I did not expect. I was thrilled! But when I went to use it again, there was an issue with one of the lenses caused by what seemed like a manufacturing glitch. I was so disappointed and immediately reached out to them.

They were *wonderful!*

The customer service rep replied immediately with very supportive questions and feedback on what likely caused the issue and taking full ownership for their product and improving it!

Wow!

My replacement was immediately sent and is working beautifully! I have enjoyed my tv and movies under the stars since. I love having “the big screen” experience back, especially with all of us staying home these days...

Sometimes there are issues with products and I believe the mark of a good company is how they handle it from there...

They knocked my socks off!  I love their representatives, I love this product!

Both deserve 5 stars in my book!
Video Player is loading.

Got the projector on sale, and set my expectations according to the price. I was impressed with it overall, definitely worth the cost for an entry or home projector. Image is clear, brightness is OK and remote seems to work well. As long as you have this in a dim or dark room, and ideally use a proper screen it performs very well. If you are shooting at a dark wall, or in a bright/sunlit room(firstly shame on you!) then it probably won't be bright enough for clear visibility of darker images/scenes.

Speaker is OK, sufficient for most things I would say and while better than most computer monitor speakers it definitely won't rumble your home theater.

Wow, to be honest I wasn't expecting much for a sub $300 projector but I was impressed the quality of the images given this is a sub $300 projector. I tested this with a Netflix movie in a very dark room giving about 10 ft in distance from the wall. Overall, I was impressed with the brightness of the image. The video isn't the sharpest but i wasn't expecting that given the price. If you want super sharp video, you'll need to spend upwards of $1000 of even $2000 for 4K. For this price, I think it's hard to beat the quality.

What I liked about this projector:
- Video Quality for the Price
- Decent brightness if you have a dark enough room
- Image size if you have space to back up your projector
- Easy to use menu to tweak the video settings (I did spend a bit of time configuring the settings - you pretty much have to tweak the Brightness / Contrast / Sharpness / Temperature to get optimal conditions
- Dual HDMI is great  - I used a Roku stick

What could be improved (but considering the price, it might be unreasonable to ask!)
- the overall build quality does seem very "plastic"
- to get the biggest projection, you'll need to have alot of space to back up the projector

Great projector for the price! It is very bright and can be used in a living room setting with lamp lighting, but I would recommend you use it in a dark environment. It does not have optical zoom, but can be zoomed digitally, which I assume reduces the full resolution, but nice feature. Some other projectors seem to have issues with blurring around the edges where text is out of focus, but I did not notice this on this projector. However, I do have a stand that I use to raise the projector even with my screen, so that may help. The projector also turns off and on quickly. The fan noise is audible, but with sound from a movie you don’t notice it. You also have two brightness setting from the remote to lower/increase the brightness instantly, which should increase LED bulb life and I did noticed that it automatically reduces fan noise. The built in speakers also work great. They are loud, but not great for a huge room and I would sit close to the projector to hear them. The are great though for a portable setup, but I would recommend purchasing some home theater speakers for a permanent setup. Though the projector comes with a power cord, remote, HDMI cable, AV adapter, and cleaning cloth I would like to see a carrying case added or at least an option purchase one separately. Though the cardboard box that the projector comes in can be used, it’s not a long term solution. This is honestly a great 1080P projector for the price. I would recommend this one over the others I’ve researched.

We purchased this projector for outdoor movie nights for our kids and to watch games with friends.  The projector has met and in some cases exceeded my expectations.  Bottom line...for the money, it is a very good value.  It was easy to set up and use the remote control to customize the settings.  I think the clarity is impressive.  We purchased a 120 inch screen and when viewing at night or a dark room it looks great.  I think I could go to 150 inch screen and it would still be fine.  Daytime is what you would expect, pretty faded and washed out but you can still see it.  We have used with both cable box and Apple TV.  When you have it hooked to Apple TV, you cannot get 4K to stream through.  My understanding is that 4K is only through your phone but then no one really streams 4K on you phone from what I can tell.
We had an issue with a small shadow and I emailed customer service who responded within 24 hours with a step by step troubleshoot which worked.  So far very happy with this purchase.
Video Player is loading.

Believe it or not, the three photos are a solid black screen, a solid white screen, and the projector menu. This reminds me a lot of screen burn in from CRTs from back in the day.

According to Amazon, I bought this projector about two years ago. About a year ago, it started showing discolored spots. These spots rapidly got worse until they mirrored the Youtube panels (my main use of this projector was watching Youtube videos). The right side of the screen appeared to also start to glitch out, but you can only see it in the menu because I used the settings to shrink the screen so it wouldn't show the right side of the screen.

Projector was starting to show a brown spot in upper right corner and headphone jack stopped working, connected to external speakers. Was able to provide things to try and ended up replacing the unit. It was not a long drawn out process, making it very nice.

UPDATE: 6 MONTHS IN AND NOW THERE IS A BIG BROWN SPOT ON THE SCREEN, NOW WE WILL SEE IF THERE CUSTOMER SERVICE IS ANY GOOD.... WILL UPDATE YOU AS TO THE OUTCOME

I was totally surprised by the brightness and clarity of this projector. I was expecting a marginal picture experience at this price but decided to give it a try as I was tired of buying bulbs for my Optima DLP projector. Frankly the picture is remarkable at this price and you will enjoy the maintenance free operation with 100,000 hour LED bulb. Picture is viewable even is a well lit room. But in a dark room you will freak out at how good it is. Yes, of course you could buy a better and brighter unit but for the vast majority of us this is all you'll ever need. Bravo

We have only used the projector twice.  Bought to use outside in pavilion.  Seems to work well.  In all honesty we used an old Roku device with it and had trouble adjusting the distance to screen for great picture, however, we definitely believe it is the old roku device that is diminishing the experience.  Also, the sound from the machine is not good - but we have not yet attached external speakers -- hoping we can use a blutooth device to get speakers to work.  The picture was still good, but the device was pretty old.  We don't have another device to attach to it for outdoor at the moment so we will soon be acquiring a new one, or connect via laptop or phone.  I expect the experience to be far superior.  I ordered the anycast from the seller and they were very quick to respond and are eager to assist with any issues - so that is definitely a positive.  I would not hesitate to purchase, especially given the price.

Immediately noticed a dead pixel, right in the middle of the projectors sweet spot. Boooo! I've had bad luck with returns, so I'll be keeping it around for art projects. But I ordered this brand new, and when I first popped off the lens cap, I see dust... all over... the inside of the lens. Creating MORE spots than just the dead pixels i mentioned up front here. I'm an experienced multimedia specialist, and for the price, I would say it's a good starter projector (which is why it gets 3 stars. To get the feel of what you might want to look and pay for later. As long as you don't need to read text, I was able to get a fun 150" screen output and play some Rocket League and watch some low-end Amazon Prime Video. Don't expect a cinema experience. If you sharpen up one side of the screen, the other will be out of focus (consistent with other reviews I read here). And while I like having manual controls for some features, the focus wheel is part of the lens and swings freely - so you'll screw it up by touching any part of the projector, especially the lens cap (who thought that was good idea?). The manual v-keystone (?) also has the free swing issue. Still, it packs a punch for an entry level, experimental projector. Just shame on you, for sending me dead pixels. Shame!

I absolutely love my new projector for Yaber. I was scouring through review after review attempting to stumble across a gem and I did when I found a review comparing two Yaber projectors: The y30 and y31. They were both well described; however, the user highlighted the y31 model for its crisp imagery and surround sound. My main concerns were the imagery during the day and a lack of sound, forcing me to spend on external speakers. With the y31 model, the imagery during the day is not the best, I would assume that there are not enough white lumens when compared to other projectors. However, the y31 speakers are phenomenal! More often than not, I try to listen to hear the fan of the projector over whatever show/movie I am watching and it is almost impossible. Many reviews complained about how other projectors needed the volume on max to get a decent sound, but this is not the case with the y31 model. I normally keep my device at a volume of 25-30, while the max is 100. I have also posted a picture to show the image; it is about 9:04 AM, at this time. You can see that there is a bit of light distortion, but overall the curtains in my room have mitigated the light.

I am in LOVE with this projector and the picture quality! I recieved a defective projector and they replaced it quickly, and even gave me a 10% refund for the trouble. Now that I have a properly functioning one, I use it all the time! The sound is only okay, but you're not buying a surround sound system, and the picture is crystal clear. I have used projectors for a couple years now, and this one is far superior to any I've used before. When you get super close, you can see just how small each pixel is, which is what makes the picture clear and crisp.

PROS:
- Fantastic picture quality
- Highly customizable settings
- Great customer service
- You can watch during the day if you have decent curtains or wait just a little bit for the sun to go down some
- Fan is pretty quiet, especially when you start watching something that covers it a bit

CONS:
-Sound is a little lacking
- Only one 'save file' of user settings, so you have to change your settings around if they don't work for that time of day/ particular movie (but that's standard)

PICTURE SETTINGS I USE:
Contrast: 40
Brightness: 60
Color: 65
Sharpness: 60
Color Temp: Warm
