Reasonably priced replacemet for lost decoration ring for M. Zuiko 40-150 pro lens

product_title: Fotasy N3517 35MM F1 7 TV Movie Lens and Adapter Kit for Sony NEX E Mount Cameras
product_description: Compatible with Sony E mount APSC Mirrorless cameras NEX 5R NEX6 NEX7 a3100 a51000 a6000 a6100 a63000 a6400 a6500 Lens mount 16mm C mount comes with a 16M Cine C mount to Sony E mount adapter Focus operation Manual aperture operation Manual Focus length 35mm aperture f 1 7 f 16 close Pls note this lens is good for portrait photography but it not good for landscape photography The sharpness in the center is fine but the border is soft It looks like a tilt lens

reviews.review_body: Dude, it's like $30 for a super fast 35mm lens with an interesting character to the shots.  The edges are really soft and out of focus, but you can use that to your advantage to create some really interesting and dreamy shots...  This isn't an everyday lens, but it can be great for portraits and isolating a subject in the center of the frame.  If you are considering it, just buy it.  It costs less than a tank of gas.

To be honest, I purchase this item just for fun.I know I can't get a GOOD picture out with it, but it prooves me wrong. I attached an example for you to see. A warning, this lens has to be use ONLY in MANUAL mode, so you need to know what you are doing here. The focus and aperture ring are not that smooth, but they'll get the job done. The maximum aperture of F1.7 lets in a lot of light, so it works VERY VERY good. But the soft and dark corners it has won;t give you the BEST look. As I said, for FUN will do the trick, for serious photography...I don't think so.

I worked in professional audio for decades, and there was always a debate about adding 'color' to the recording. Some love it, some don't. I think owning equipment that forces you to work in a different way, or brings new, possibly non-traditional elements into the work, is the best part. To that end, this lens is the best camera accessory I've ever bought, and has made me realize a $30 lens can be better than a $1000 one for a specific task. For the record, I'm using a Sony A6000.

Considering the price this thing is amazing. It really makes pictures stand out and you will get some great shots if you are a beginner like my self. It will give a new life to your camera :). I have a Sony A5100 and you have to remember to go into the camera settings and allow the camera to take pictures even when no lens is detected. This is necessary because the camera won't detect the lens is there. There is no zoom and focus is manual which makes it a lot of fun. Really recommend this lens for any beginner looking for fun shots at a low price.

I love this artistic lens.  The bokeh is wonderful.  I use it a lot.  It gives a tilt/shift look to almost anything.  If you can manage to have a scene where there are things close to you on the edges of the frame, and the main subject at hand far away from the camera, you can achieve a wonderful effect of the edges being clear while the center is clear as well, with other superfluous things being blurry.

And you certainly can't beat the price.

I love this little dude. It has such character, and for the price you really might as well go for it and have some fun. Went out and snapped some quick shots. Nice bokeh, good in low light. Obviously not the crispiest image and only the center point will be in focus, but be creative and it's a great effect. You can also put this thing in your pocket it's so small. Good budget portrait lens to carry around.

Just do it!

I am utterly surprised by the quality of this product. When shopping for lenses you get used to seeing price tags will in to the hundreds, so you get a little skeptical when you see a lens advertised for so cheap. I am absolutely blown away by the quality of the lens! We use this with our Sony a7000 and it takes breath-taking portrait pictures. We now use it to take pictures of our baby to send to friends and relatives.

Do yourself a favor and get this lens. You will be hard pressed to find something of this caliber at a fairer price.

Fast delivery and from what I can tell great lens. It's basically a CCTV lens modified to fit the e-mount system cameras and seems very well made. I actually love the working the aperture and focus manually! I mounted it and snapped some shots and wow! Super excited to take it for a spin outdoors. For the price I say scoop one of these little guys up, get creative and have fun.

This little lens is very interesting! It’s won’t be your main lens but for the price it’s completely worth the purchase. You can get some awesome swirled corners and some cool looking bokeh. This thing is one of a kind and I recommend picking one up if you want some artsy shots, just remember it’s 100% manual, so you’ll actually have to think before taking pictures.
None

You can't beat the quality shots for the price. Seriously one of my favorite lenses I've come across. Has such a unique quality to the shots you can produce.
I use a Sony Alpha 6000 and paired with this lens, you'd have a fun and creative time.
My only qualm is lack of rear cover but I had a spare E Mount cover that didn't entirely fit but did the job.

Anywho, totally worth the buy if you've got some spare money.

If I had the choice again I would repurchase this lens, amazingly cheap compared to the results, however it's only sharp in the center, so you need to compose your pictures accordingly. moreover I was looking for more stylish bokeh yet it's quite clean as you can see.

What a nice lens for a great price. F
Real good quality pictures for a novice or professional photographer who is into manual setting. Yes but this cheap but with a great punch lens if you don’t want to break the Bank.
Sometimes it appears sharp in the screen but once the image is captured, its blurry. Just my experience. Overall, you cant beat the price.

For as inexpensive as this lens is, I would have expected it to be impossible to take nice pictures. After having a friend destroy my stock lens, I needed a new a6000 lens on the cheap for a party, and I came across this. I was mildly surprised that as long as you center your target, and use the camera's focus assist, you can take some pretty solid picture.

This lens is cheap, its fast and its compact. It's not the sharpest lens that you can get since its normally a CCTV lens, but it's still fun to play with. The Sony NEX camera's dont really have a good line of lenses that are affordable. If you're on a budget and you want to play around with some bokeh. I would recommend this. Come on, a lens for under 30 bucks. Theres no way you can get cheaper than that. Rainbowimaging offers other lenses as well. I would get the 25mm instead of the 35 since the NEX is on crop sensor. In fact, the 25mm is faster at f1.4 than the 35mm. I just happen to get this lens before the 25mm was being sold on amazon :( shucks

I love this lens, it was exactly what i needed in order to get more intimate with my camera as it is a manual. The quality is surprising for the price and not to mention it is just so much fun to play with. My only complaints is that i wish it had a cap for the back as i dont want dust to get back there. But i saw that you could buy that separately. It feels heavy and nice, the quality is durable. You can get pretty creative with this little guy.

You get what you pay for,  this lense does as advertised,  takes a picture with good manual focusing blur. Not the best in picture quality of course but again you get what you pay for. I got this lense for my Sony a6300. Have had it for about a month. No flaws here so far !
This lens is FREGGIN awesome. The Bokeh blur is epic. It’s equally as good as other lens that cost way more

Got the Fotasy 35mm 1'7f two days ago. First impression is great. Material Quality is very good. Just had a problem when i first mounted the lens on my sony a6300 - it got stuck a little bit, but now it works fine. Aperture and manual fokus ring is very smooth, works perfectly for taking fotos and filming. Would - and already have bought a second one as a gift for a friend
The picture quality is outstanding for such a cheap lense.

Everything others reviews have said is true. This lens has plenty of quirks some good some bad. Sure the build quality is a bit iffy as shown by the distance scale and aperture being applied in a way that makes little sense compounded by the adapter being just shy of the correct depth. But if you are looking at this lens you are probably fully aware of what is possible with this lens at it does a good job of it. Nicely rendered bokeh in the OOF areas with a nice "sharpness" to the centre. Are the improvements in the SLR magic version worth the $100 difference? I can't say but I am happy with this purchase.

I love this little lens.  I would not suggest if for motion, but for stills it is so much fun to use.  The center of the lens can achieve sharp focus, but the falloff and lack of consistent pattern to the falloff is really wonderful.  (look at the attached pic for a good example of this look)  You'll get a handful of meh / soft photos... but will definitely capture some keepers as well.

For the price point, there should not be ANY hesitation.  It's a toy lens, but a very nice toy lens.  It really surprised me, to be honest.

Excellent sharpness in the center, soft on the outsides. Clickless. Feels durable. Everything is build of metal, there are no plastic parts. It sits a bit too tight on the camera and there is no indicator for the focus & apperature, that’s why I just give 4 out of 5 stars. Other than that it’s a great lense, I would buy it again.

I attached a picture of my cat, the lightning has been software corrected after the shot.

Somebody bought this lens for me at first because it was extremely cheap, however, the quality is actually pretty decent. The effects are fun to play around with, and I was vaguely reminded of the Lensbaby system. It's already broken on me once--though, that was my fault entirely--and I bought another one myself the same day! I would recommend this lens to people that want to *start* experimenting with new lenses outside of the stock lineup, but don't want to break the bank just yet.

Some of the reviews have indicated that they have had some screws from the lens scratching their cameras. I did not experience this issue.

I bought this as a gift for my son and his Sony NEX 5T, which is an e-mount camera body.  This lens takes amazing photos.  It *is* manual focus, and manual f/stop, and neither focus nor f/stop information is relayed back to the camera.  You must also set the camera to allow the shutter to fire without a lens, as the camera cannot detect the lens.  For all that, it can work quite well.  Wide open, it has a very shallow depth of field.  Low light performance is amazing.  There is vignetting around the edges, but this can work to your advantage, especially in low-light photos of faces.  Probably not a good lens for architecture or landscapes.

I use this lens on my a7iii and I LOVE it. I bought it because I wanted something cheap with a vintage look to practice manual focusing. I wasn't sure what to expect for $30, but I am pleasantly surprised by how much I fell in love with this lens as I took test shots around my house. I can't wait to test it out in the real world.

The first one I got was broken. Returned it and got a new one after a week which... that's life I guess. The new lens works great. No complaints really. The only thing is that the adapter has been glued onto the lens so I can't use the adapter for any other c-mount lenses. Why the frick would they glue it to the lens?! The only reason I can think is to sell more adapters. Some guys like to have an adapter for each lens anyway (and I probably would have done that eventually too) but getting three lenses in the mail and one adapter would have worked fine for a while.... if the adapter came off the flipping lens!!! Also, I'm pretty sure the first lens was broken because whoever is affixing these adapters to the lenses is doing it manually and I think it's very easy to break the focus ring off doing that.
Video Player is loading.

How can you not love this little lens? It's $28 for Pete sake... This lens is fun to shoot with. It creates some interesting points or focus.. I mean it's not a traditional front to back focus.. it focuses middle out..  so either everything in the middle is in focus and the outer edges are out of focus or vise versa.. it's interesting and unique.. plus it's super tiny.. throw it in your pocket and go.. plus I love the de clicked aperture ring.. makes it great for filming.

While I'm not a fan of APS-C lenses this is great for the price. Awesome for you to play around with. Keep in mind when you turn the focus ring to pull back towards yourself at the same time, otherwise it will slowly twist off of the lens for some reason haha. It's built according to the price so don't expect wonders. I do wish it was full frame but for this price that's too much to expect. But if they come out with a full frame one at a comparable price (below $100) I'd buy it immediately.
